AiReviewSummary: This cafe is perfect for a cup of coffee. The coffee is very strong and delicious. They also serve good banana smoothies. Food is okay, but nothing special. You can try their pasta, pizza, and ham and cheese sandwich. The service is very friendly and helpful. They have an English menu, which is great. The atmosphere is cozy and nice to chat with friends.

Name: Café Aux Bacchanales
Address: Aux Bacchanales Plaza Singapura #03-83, 68 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238839
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 81 reviews","4 stars, 38 reviews","3 stars, 16 reviews","2 stars, 14 reviews","1 stars, 15 reviews"]
Reviews:
["The food was decent, albeit pricey. Ordered xmas course: Jamon, sea bass, lamb rack and orange crepe.

Jamon and lamb rack was great, though the lamb was abit gamey, still acceptable. Sea bass was tender with crispy skin. But the sauce was too creamy, doesn't seems to match with the fish, perhaps a clear sauce would be better.  And, would prefer potato instead of sweet potato as sides.

The french onion soup was delicious, duck confit was decent. The sirloin was good but it's abit tough. Hope to try ribeye next time. Escargot was great, like the parsley-garlic olive oil.

Creme brulee was delicious, wasn't overwhelming sweet. The orange crepe was abit too sweet though.

The ambience was cosy and their staffs were very attentive and friendly. They would change my cutlery set for the next course.

Axel was especially attentive. I needed a teaspoon for the escargot, he noticed and gave me teaspoon even though I didn't request for it. And, he changed my water promptly when he noticed there's breadcrumb in my glass. I've totally missed it!

Through out the dinner, he was very attentive and we had a pleasant chat.

With such service, I'm willing to go back again. Maybe for the dessert and tea. Great pleasure dinning there.","Great food quality and service is very good too. The lamb rack is nicely done and the onion soup is one of the better items on their menu. The breakfast menu is quite limited but everything else is available throughout the day. Decent coffee and desserts too."," More","Visited again for the set lunch and happy that is value for money. Around $55 for two persons for such quality food is a steal ! Staff are extremely friendly and food served very fast but hot. Please support them 🥰
————————————

Had chocolate crepe @ $12.80++ and (L) long black @ $6.20, decent price for a nice afternoon teabreak. Service is good but this dessert is too sweet and rich.","The lunch sets are good value. However, you do need to top up for steak. Onion soup was average. Probably not worth the extra $8. The chicken and fish were alright too. Steak is pretty good so I think it’s worth topping up. You can’t go …"," More","Favourite casual French food dining choice where we have returned repeatedly for its steak, onion soup, pâté, and most importantly the creme brûlée to die for…

We have brought numerous friends here on multiple occasions the service is always good and had many fond memories!

Look out for the 2-3 course Promotion set available on weekday afternoons which is totally worth it to go for","Came here to try since The Entertainer app had a 1-for-1 main course offer. The food was definitely nice and worth the offer. But I’m unsure if I’ll return to pay the full price. Not that the food was bad, but it was rather average. …"," More","Expect French food staples in busy Dhoby Ghaut. Tastewise, it is pretty decent. I really enjoyed the duck, which was tender and soft. Fish was cooked well. Fries were alright, nothing much to shout about. The ice lemon tea was sub par.

Good place to choose if you’re craving simple french fare.","I've been here several times and it's always been consistently good.  Food is delicious, service is warm and prompt and prices very reasonable.  Also, I really like the decor, as there are plenty of small details in the decor that makes the …"," More","Walked past this place and thought this is probably new. Nice ambience. Very attentive staff as what the others had reviewed as well.

We ain’t really hungry and so went for something light. Ordered the omelette and lemon tart for myself and the crepe for my mum.

The food tastes really good! Love the omelette and how it was cooked so smoothly done. However I do find the lemon tart too sweet for my liking but still nice.

Will be back again to try the mains some time.","Service","Service","Dine in","Dine in","","Meal type","Meal type","Dinner","Dinner","","**Updates on 2nd visit **
Had the set lunch with my husband. Order the Galette Au Jambon & Champignon (ham and mushroom  crepe) and the pan fried seabass  was great ! Not forgetting the …"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: The restaurant had decent food, but it was a bit pricey. We enjoyed the Jamon, sea bass, lamb rack, and orange crepe. The Jamon and lamb rack were great, but the lamb was a bit gamey. The sea bass was tender with crispy skin, but the sauce was too creamy. The French onion soup was delicious, and the duck confit was decent. The sirloin was good, but a bit tough. The creme brulee was delicious, and the orange crepe was a bit too sweet. The service was great, and the staff were very attentive and friendly.

Name: Ginza Sand

OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 5 pm\u20134 am","Friday, 5 pm\u20134 am","Saturday, 11:30 am\u201311 pm","Sunday, Closed","Monday, 5 pm\u20134 am","Tuesday, 5 pm\u20134 am","Wednesday, 5 pm\u20134 am"]
Reviews:
["Did I find this place via my FYP instagram? Absolutely, yes. Was it worth the 30 min wait for the sandwich? Also YES! I opted for the steak sand and it was so incredibly tasty and packed with flavor. I’d definitely come back to try another!

Pros:
-the wait to order isnt too long
-Super tasty with every bite
Cons:
-the wait to pickup gets backed up and you have to wait around for when your name is called
-price is a bit much for the area
-No place to sit; takeaway only","terrible experience. Staff was very rude and made us feel like the did not want to take our orders. Be warned, they do not like to serve Americans and Europeans. After the rude experience the prime steak sandwich was mediocre. We’ve had better in the US. Don’t give this place your business, there are too many other great restaurants and kind people in Tokyo to be spending anytime or money here. Very disappointing.","Not too sure what’s the hype about it. We ate the beef cutlet sando, it was mediocre, nothing impressive. In fact, it was quite disappointing given that it cost 2,900 yen. I could have eaten a decent meal in a restaurant. Furthermore, we ordered the fried chicken, totally disappointing - one of the chicken was uncooked inside. There’s too much chicken fats, not to my friend’s and my liking.","Absolutely one of the best sando I've had, you know it's gonna be good when it's served in the back alley. Very affordable and addictive. I finished in less than 5 minutes. Took about 15 minutes to get done. I got 3 items, the beef, egg and …","Definitely one of the best things we ate in Tokyo. We got all their best sellers, Beef Sando, Egg, Eel and Plum Shiso Pork. All were very delicious, hard to pick a favorite. Eel was definitely the most memorable and unique in flavor for me …","This is a small hole in the wall, walk fast and miss it stall in Ginza. The stall is small and crammed for you to order, so do not attempt to go with a huge group. Not the cheapest sando but def worth the pricetag. Popular with locals and …","Came here to grab a bite based on reviews. The place is a hole in the wall without any seating options. You stop by their window to order and come back to pick it up in a hour. We got 3 different options, the beef was great while the egg …","Went twice for supper during our trip in Tokyo. Both time, we ordered the beef sandwiches. About 2800 yen for each beef sandwiches. It was the best beef sandwiches we have eaten. The beef was prepared to medium rare and the middle seem …","These are so delicious. A must try after spending the day around Ginza boutique shops.

A little hot inside with little fans but a great find nonetheless","So good! I was told that I needed to wait 20 minutes but it only took 5 minutes! Brought back to hotel to enjoy. Still warm. ビーフかつ最高！","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 1","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Service: 1","Meal type","Take out","Service","Food: 5","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 2","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: The sandwich place is popular but has some drawbacks. The steak sandwich is incredibly tasty and packed with flavor, but you have to wait a while to pick it up. Some people find the prices too high, and there's no place to sit. On the other hand, many reviewers loved the beef cutlet sandwich, beef sando, and fried chicken. Some people had mixed experiences, but overall, the sandwiches are delicious and worth trying.

Name: Kisoji Shinjuku
Address: Japan, 160-0022 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Shinjuku, 3 Chome175  46F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 257 reviews","4 stars, 210 reviews","3 stars, 68 reviews","2 stars, 21 reviews","1 stars, 26 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139:30 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139:30 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm"]
Reviews:
["The Japanese beef at here was truly delicious. For lunch, we ordered the set menu, which offered great value. The highlight, though, was the excellent service provided by the female staff. They were attentive, friendly, and made our dining experience all the more enjoyable.

Based on this positive lunch visit, I will definitely return to try their dinner menu. The high-quality beef, combined with the wonderful service, makes this restaurant a must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic Japanese sukiyaki experience. I look forward to exploring more of their menu offerings on my next trip.","A fantastic restaurant serving delicious shabu shabu. The menu is vast and the ingredients fresh and well portioned. Went here during lunch which was even better value. The wagyu was amazingly tender. We were celebrating with a baby and the staff were extremely accomodating. Our booking was only for 90 min but we were able to stay for 2 hrs as we were slower with a baby. Service was warm and friendly and the atmosphere warm.","I tried the blowfish shabu shabu. The texture was a mixture of chicken and frog. They also serve beef. The quality of the beef is one of the best I have in Tokyo. If you are nearby, stop by this place. Even better, book before you go as it is always full during meal times.","There is an older lady dressed in kimono who can speak English but is extremely rude. I hope she doesn’t ruin your experience if you come here to try their cuisine. The rest of the staff were pleasant and friendly. Sukiyaki lunch course was delicious and value for money.","Good service and quality food. Serving is big for my  family of 4. Friendly service staff with limited speaking English, but they able to understand some English.  Reservation is essential. Additional 10% surcharge for private dining room. Recommended!!","The lady at the reception has been very friendly and helpful. All other staff are just beyond polite. I genuinely wish I could give more stars for the service.

We ordered the Kiso meal set and sukiyaki, great taste, flavor & value.

ありがとうございます.","I have meet up with friend in Japan. Find a good restaurant and Arrange a dinner together. This is good for reservations in google. But I'm disappointed that 4 people in one table just have one heater for cook. That why 4 person should be …","The servers here are very friendly, and can speak little english. There are no English menus, but the server tried to explain best as she can. We ordered the sukiyaki and puffer fish sashimi. It came with side dishes and dessert ice cream …","I came here not quite realizing how nice of a place it was. The menus are all in Japanese so come armed with google translate. I got the soymilk shabu shabu (I think?) set for one and it was delicious and filling. Ambiance is calming and …","Excellent beef, becareful when cooking it as it melts away in the pot and in your mouth! A little on the pricier end but totally worth it. If the matsutake mushroom is available, get it! The mushroom dashi served from it is just perfect!","Wheelchair accessibility","Wagyu Steak, Sashimi","Recommended dishes","Vegetarian options","Price per person","Paid parking lot","Kid-friendliness","Parking options","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","Parking space","Very friendly","¥2,000–3,000","¥8,000–9,000","¥1,000–2,000","¥4,000–5,000","Service: 5","Service: 1","Meal type","Available","Not sure","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","和牛刷刷鍋套餐","Tempura","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: The reviews of this restaurant were very positive. The Japanese beef was delicious, and the service was excellent. The staff were friendly and attentive, making the dining experience enjoyable. Many reviewers tried the sukiyaki and shabu shabu, which they found to be of high quality and great value. The menu is vast, with many options including wagyu, blowfish, and beef. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, making it a great place to celebrate special occasions. Overall, this restaurant is a must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic Japanese sukiyaki experience.

Name: Asakusa Silk Pudding
Address: 1 Chome-4-11 Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0032, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 337 reviews","4 stars, 157 reviews","3 stars, 66 reviews","2 stars, 17 reviews","1 stars, 27 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 10 am\u20139 pm","Friday, 10 am\u20139 pm","Saturday, 10 am\u20139 pm","Sunday, 10 am\u20139 pm","Monday, 10 am\u20139 pm","Tuesday, 10 am\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 10 am\u20139 pm"]
Reviews:
["I went to this place yesterday with my friend (2023/03/22) we bought 3 types of pudding but found a ‘HAIR’ in one of them.

We decided to go to a staff and ask her if we could change. It turned out that she was so aggressive to us and almost yelled at me even though I told her I just opened it. She kept asking me back that what minute what seconds did I open it? Me and my friend tried to explain to her that we literally just opened it 5 seconds ago. She cut my conversation and told us it was some dirts from sky because we opened it for too long😩 she didn’t even use the polite form with us and her voice was so loud.

The rest of the puddings were great but the staff’s attitude ruined it all.","There was a small bench available, but I chose take away. The lady was super friendly and had very good english.

I had the strawberry pudding and premium silk pudding. They had silky texture. Tbh, the puddings aren't remarkably better than those bought at convenient stores (texture-wise, and the flavour of classic pudding). However, this place has much more flavours to choose from, and I bet they have much better ingredients.","MAR 2024

I bought two puddings to try and they were creamy and silky smooth. The premium silk pudding uses vanilla bean and is 100 yen more expensive than the other flavors. The coffee pudding was sweet with a nice strong premium coffee flavor. Both were delicious. Definitely want to try more flavors next time.","This little shop is adorable and they have a lovely selection of flavors. We tried the top 2 best sellers along with matcha and black sesame. All were delicious! The portions are small but the pudding is silky and creamy. My favorite was the number 1 and black sesame. The packaging was nice too.","We bought the limited sakura pudding to try, the texture is really creamy and smooth with a hint of flowery taste. It was pretty sweet and the bottle is actually quite small, so the size is just alright for a person as dessert.","The most popular pudding is definitely worth a try. Very silky.

Packaging is nice but I think most people don't keep the bottle so you're sort of paying for it without keeping it.","The pudding was alright, but nothing really special about it.

The host was rude, no smile and seems annoyed.

A bit overrated and wouldn’t recommend.","Taste quite nice. The pudding very smooth and melt in mouth. It taste even nicer when is cold. Bottom got brown sugar(?) They have few seats inside.","Amazing pudding, super creamy with really interesting and tasty flavors. Well worth trying. And the jars are super cute, they make great souvenirs","Not really a big fan of lemon pudding but others are great","Price per person","Atmosphere: 2","Atmosphere: 5","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 4","Service: 1","Service: 5","Meal type","Breakfast","¥1–1,000","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Food: 2","Food: 5","Dine …"," More","Other"]
AiReviewSummary: The customer went to this place with their friend and bought three types of pudding, but found a hair in one of them. The staff was aggressive and rude, not using polite language. The customer had a strawberry and premium silk pudding, which had a silky texture, but was not remarkably better than those bought at convenient stores. Other customers enjoyed the pudding, finding it creamy and smooth, with interesting and tasty flavors.

Name: Satou
Address: 4 Chome-2-9 Tsukiji, Chuo City, Tokyo 104-0045, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 95 reviews","4 stars, 29 reviews","3 stars, 8 reviews","2 stars, 1 review","1 stars, 6 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 5\u20139 pm","Friday, 5\u20139 pm","Saturday, 5\u20139 pm","Sunday, Closed","Monday, Closed","Tuesday, 5\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 5\u20139 pm"]
Reviews:
["Outstanding!  From the entrance to the seating was super impressive.  Everything about the experience was otherworldly.
I cannot heap enough praise upon the service, presentation and taste.
It was expensive, but a once in a lifetime experience.(at least for me)
Yasuko Sato was our hostess who spoke fluent English for us, and answered every question we had.  She acquired a sauce recipe from the chef for me and wrote it down for me.
When we were leaving the chef recommended a knife shop for me too.
If there is any justice in this world, this restaurant should be known by every food geek on the planet.","I had an amazing experience eating the matsusaka beef here. Not only was the food incredible but the service amazing as well. We were served by a very nice young lady who explained to us the differences between the meat. I'm glad I came here, a definite  thumbs up from me and my partner. Keep up the gd work 👍 …","I had a delightful solo dining experience at this charming Japanese steakhouse on a quiet weekday night. Despite its small size, the cozy atmosphere added to the overall charm. The service was excellent, and the food surpassed my expectations. Looking forward to returning for another delicious meal!","이 가격에 이런 품질 이런 맛 최고입니다.
I was looking for a place I can try Japanese gyu well, and i just decided visiting here for a lunch on fri. it was slow a bit. the service, the foods, the prices are all legit. must visit. I'm definately willing to visit again.","This was one of the best meals of my life. The beef is so tender it's like butter in your mouth. If you're in Tokyo, make a reservation now at this place. Everything was amazing from the food to the service.","100% would recommend to anyone wanting a great steak and meal. Was told it'd be the best steak, and it lived up to the hype. I had the 19800 yen sirloin steak course, was worth every penny!","My favourite Kobe beef restaurant in town.
Outstanding quality of food. The fillet and Sirloin are divine. This is THE PLACE to dine if you’re after the best Japanese beef. …","OMG! An amazing experience with Ebara-san. Meat, wine, sake, and an impeccable staff service.

Reservations highly recommended.

Worth a trip to Japan just for this dinner.","Best steakhouse in Tokyo. It’s not just a meal, it’s an experience. And you can make reservations now!","Amazing Teppanyaki! A5 wagyu was incredible. Super nice staff and delicious food.","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥8,000–9,000","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: This Japanese steakhouse offers an outstanding dining experience with impressive service, presentation, and taste. The matsusaka beef and Kobe beef are specialties, with the 19800 yen sirloin steak course being a highlight. The waitstaff are knowledgeable and helpful, taking the time to explain the differences between the meats and even sharing a sauce recipe. The atmosphere is cozy, with a view of the chefs cooking at the teppanyaki grill. With prices ranging from ¥8,000 to ¥10,000 per person, it's an indulgent treat worth saving up for.

Name: Satou Kichijoji Steak House
Address: Japan, 180-0004 Tokyo, Musashino, Kichijoji Honcho, 1 Chome18
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 55 reviews","4 stars, 25 reviews","3 stars, 1 review","2 stars, 1 review","1 stars, 5 reviews"]
Reviews:
["Good quality Japanese steak house. Fresh cooked and you can enjoy watching your food preparation. Seating area are small and located on second floor. You have to climb to the restaurant so if you cannot move well please be careful. Ventilation is not quite good so you may got some grilled smell after your meal. English menu and communication with staffs are ok. Credit card is ok.","Came all the way from Los Angeles. It's definitely worth coming back for.
Even though it's a small place (probably sitting 15 people at the same time) and stairs were steep. The food and service here were excellent. All our steaks were seasoned well and cooked to the perfect temperature. The chefs and the server were awesome.","10/10 2nd time I came here and the steaks are just as good. The premium cuts are more fatty but regular Wagyu are pretty good too. 150g is enough for 1 for the lunch portion but definitely come a bit before they open as there'll be a line and you'll be waiting around 30minutes to an hour.","This is very popular butcher near Kichijoji station. They are selling different parts of fresh and ready-made meats. I got chuncky roasted pork（焼豚） and fried meatball(メンチカツ）which is their speciality and 250 yen for one piece. This is very fresh,crunchy and juicy one!!","Awesome meat. Perfect service .
Somehow I was hoping for some Japanese alcohols such as sake and wines but it was only western wines (or maybe I missed something?). I had a Japanese beer though.","Went in while not busy in a group of 6.  Served immediately, and food was absolutely amazing. We even tried all of the beef meals. I won't recommend going with more people as it is a bit small.","Short and sweet, I like it.
Yes, I ordered takeout, but opened it and gunned down with it in less than 2 minutes.  Say that I was a bit hungry, but yet good is good.  No? …","Superb steakhouse. On the second floor of the famous Satou meat balls stall that every tourist (and the locals) knows.","I've been back several times over about 5 years. The food is consistently of good quality. …","Kichijoji Satou was pretty quiet on a Monday evening. Food was great!","Difficult to find parking","Parking is unavailable","High Grade Loin Steak","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Parking options","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Parking space","¥4,000–5,000","¥1,000–2,000","Wagyu Steak","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Take out","Service…","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: This Japanese steak house has good quality food, cooked fresh right in front of you. The chefs are skillful and the server is helpful. The venue is small, located on the second floor, so be prepared to climb stairs. Some reviewers like the grilled smell, while others find it overwhelming. The restaurant offers Wagyu steaks, including premium cuts and regular options, which are all seasoned well and cooked to perfection. They also serve other dishes like roasted pork and meatballs. Reviewers recommend trying the premium cuts, but note that 150g is enough for one person.

Name: Kiwamiya Tokyo Station
Address: Japan, 100-0005 Tokyo, Chiyoda City, Marunouchi, 1 Chome91  F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 294 reviews","4 stars, 125 reviews","3 stars, 44 reviews","2 stars, 21 reviews","1 stars, 60 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20139 pm"]
Reviews:
["This restaurant is so unique, that you will cook your steak or hamburg (or both) to the doneness you want. I would recommend Hamburg and Steak set with rice. For small size, total is going to be around ¥3000 or about $20. Small size was enough for me because rice are refillable, but fyi large is super huge
Steak are very marvelous and hamburg was very flavorful. They said that to cook the hamburg all the way through, but I cook it to more like inside turns pink.
Steak I highly recommend to try eat without any sauce and just with salt. Just try it you won’t regret!

Only reason why service are 4 star is because compared to Japanese standard, particularly male staffs are lack in customer interactions (still 5 star in American standard)

Overwell it is well worth it, but be prepared to walk around the station for a while and be in the line for 30 minutes to an hour","Burger with rice! A unique dish in Japan.  Beef is of high quality, a steal given the price, ~920yen?  Chef will prepare burger in front of customer and help cook both sides lightly, then leave it to the custyto continue cooking to one's fondness.  Add another 400yen for free flow of soup, salad, rice and ice cream!  No doubt it attracted so many customers.  A nice place to go when you visit the Tokyo station.","Very delicious meat hamburg and steak! Recommended. Will definitely come back again. Staffs were nice with fast and great service. Rice, soup and soft serve are able to refill if you order the set. To get to the restaurant, you go to Daimaru inside Tokyo station, then walk toward Yaesu North Entrance and you’ll see restaurant on the right conner.","Interesting concept... I wasn't prepared to be cooking the hamburger steak myself, but it's fine.. Only thing is it's very oily and some of the oil will get you when you cook.. So be prepared.. The taste is pretty good especially the onion sauce.. Everything else was sold out when I went, so not sure how their regular steak is..","Chanced upon this place when I was at Tokyo Station and glad I joined the queue.. just under an hour later, I finally made payment for my order and was shown to my seat. Part of the reason for the wait is that the staff have to meticulously …","I was attracted by the amazing smell when I walked by during the lunch rush & the queue was so long. Headed there for dinner instead at around 5PM (japan time) & the wait was shorter but sadly the steak was already sold out. Got the m size …","Perfect meal to start our japan trip every time. It has become our favourite go to food. The queue is long even before it was open. You get to grill the Meat to your liking. We tried the patties only. Staff would help to cook the meat just …","Meat was excellent but rice too wet and soft.
Waitress who took order while we were waiting has no patient. She spoke English with an accent we couldn’t understand and then she became mean.","Kiwamiya has affordable halal hamburg menu . This is the only halal menu they have at Tokyo station. They have other branches in Tokyo (some offer halal menu).","Sauce, Hamburg Steak, Hamburg","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 2","¥1,000–2,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 3","Service: 4","Service: 2","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: This restaurant is unique because you cook your own steak or hamburger, or both. I recommend trying the Hamburg and Steak set with rice. A small size is enough for one person, and you can refill the rice. Steak is very good and hamburg is flavorful. Try eating the steak without sauce and just with salt. The only reason the service is not five-star is because the male staff don't interact with customers as much. The burger with rice is a unique dish in Japan and is a great value. You can cook the burger to your liking and add other food items for a small additional fee. The staff are nice and the atmosphere is good.

["I am a big fan of Dorayaki, and while i enjoyed their red bean paste which was very moist and soft, I did not enjoy the fluffy pancake part as much as it was too dried for me. The price is slightly more expensive (50~100 yen roughly) comparing to some other japanese desserts places.","The queue is long,, waited for about 40 minutes but it is worthy.

The batter is fluffy and moist, costs about 390yen for one, but the size is much more bigger than the traditional dorayaki. It has two fillings: red and white bean paste.

The red bean paste is not too sweat. …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Take out","¥1–1,000","Service","Food: 4","Food: 5","Other"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: This place is very popular, and for good reason. Their dorayaki, a pancake with red bean paste, is soft and moist. Some people might find it too sweet, but others will love it. The price is a bit higher than other places, but it's still affordable. There are also different types of fillings, such as white bean paste, which is a bit too sweet for some. The line can be long, but it moves quickly and the staff are friendly. You can also buy it as a souvenir and it lasts for up to three days.

AiReviewSummary: This bakery is a great place to try their famous melon pan, a must-try in Asakusa. The staff are friendly and the prices are reasonable. The melon pan is soft and fluffy on the inside, crispy on the outside, and can be enjoyed with fresh whipped cream. Other delicious options include the soft ice cream, bread rolls, and frozen yogurt. It's a great place to dine in or take away, and is also wheelchair accessible and kid-friendly.

Bought a melon bread with matcha soft serve. The melon bread has a sweet sugary …","Melon Pan with Vanilla Ice Cream","Matcha Ice Cream Melon Pan","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 4","Service: 5","Service: 3","Service: 4","Meal type","Take out","¥1–1,000","Service","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dine in","Brunch"," More","Other"]
AiReviewSummary: We visited a popular bakery near Asakusa Temple and tried their melon pan with matcha and vanilla ice cream. The bun was large, soft, and crispy on top, and full of good matcha ice cream. We also tried their plain melon pan, which was soft and fluffy with a sweet crisped top, similar to the "Bo Lou Bao" from Hongkong. Some reviewers recommended their salt bread, which was delicious and crispy. The melon pan with ice cream was a must-try, with the vanilla ice cream being a perfect match with the melon pan. The bakery was popular, but with quick service and a cozy atmosphere.

Name: Asakusa Menchi

["The signature here is their wagyu croquette. JPY350 a piece at the time of writing. Even in the off peak morning do expect a queue as this store has been recommended by many influencers. AiReviewSummary: This store is very popular, with many influencers recommending it. Their signature dish is the wagyu croquette, which is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The fried croquettes are served hot and fresh, and are a great value for the price. The store has a designated area for customers to sit down and eat, and the staff are friendly and efficient. The menu also features menchi-katsu, which is a savory and sweet minced pork patty with onions. Many customers have raved about the delicious flavor and generous portion size.

AiReviewSummary: The reviewer went to this restaurant twice and had different experiences. The first time, they ordered normal menchi and had a fantastic experience. The second time, they waited in line and got koroke criso with burnt outside but delicious beef inside. They tried various croquettes and recommended them for their delicious taste and affordable price. They also liked the fried rice and port, but the sausages tasted processed.

The staff was friendly and professional, and the food was well-presented and tasty with decent portion sizes.

Name: Rainbow Pancakes
Address: 4 Chome-28-4 Jingumae, Shibuya City, Tokyo 150-0001, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 404 reviews","4 stars, 323 reviews","3 stars, 109 reviews","2 stars, 39 reviews","1 stars, 31 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Tuesday, Closed","Wednesday, Closed"]
Reviews:
["A cosy 18-seater pancake joint tucked away in the back near Shibuya's Cat Street.

We arrived at 10:45 and were second in line. The wait staff let us order in advance and we entered the shop right at 11:00. Small groups generally had an easier time than large ones. They had an English menu and also spoke good English.

The pancakes were freshly prepared in small batches from the dough, so the wait time was around 20 minutes.

The dishes were nicely presented and the pancakes were very soft and fluffy. They also weren't overly sweet and had a subtle eggy flavour.

All in all, it was a nice easy eat.","This was the worst soufflé pancake I have ever had in Japan, I can't believe you can find such bad pancakes in Japan. I don't understand why the reviews here are so good, are their tastes normal?

The pancakes have no egg flavor and are very bland. I wonder if cheap eggs are used. The sauce doesn't taste good either. The texture is not fluffy and basically not up to standard ( I even wonder if the egg was fully cooked) Why are the reviews here so good? Have they tried regular soufflé pancakes in Japan? I'm disappointed because it ruined my impression of Japan","Found this place by chance , actually, I thought it was closed.

We had black sesame banana iced drink , cold lime and ginger drink
And shared a delicious caramel apple pancake.

Served with ice cream. Lovely and fluffy.

Friendly staff. Highly recommend.","I found this restaurant randomly while in the neighborhood and have been wanting to try this style of pancake. We got the maple syrup with ice cream and the apple with Carmel pancakes. They were both delicious. I also got the sparkling win, …","We had a great experience here. We got the original, it came with iceacream and syrup and the macadamia pancakes. The pancakes were light and fluffy and the macadamia topping was amazing. I wish that there was whipped cream or something …","A very comfortable place for enjoying your time. The pancake is fluffy and delicious. The chef and the staff are kind.  Their English are also good so that it is a visitor friendly place.","Decorous fluffy pancakes and yummy drinks. Wasn’t busy when I was there, so it felt low key and off the beaten path. Fun music and incredible food though!","Pancake is very delicious!
The staff is very nice. He gave us umbrella when it was raining heavily outside. Very considerate! Thank you so much!","Amazing place to try if you love pancakes, because they were sooo delicious! Atmosphere was also great, I highly recommend! :)","This is the best pancake you'll ever eat!! Order the macadamia one.

Remember to also order the hot latte, milk is awesome!","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 2","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Service: 3","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 1","Brunch"," More","Other"]
AiReviewSummary: This cozy pancake joint near Shibuya's Cat Street is a unique find. The pancakes are freshly prepared in small batches and have a soft and fluffy texture. They are not overly sweet and have a subtle egg flavour. The dishes are nicely presented and the wait staff are friendly and speak good English. Some of the customers enjoyed the caramel apple pancake, maple syrup with ice cream, and macadamia pancakes. They also offer delicious drinks like black sesame banana iced drink and cold lime and ginger drink.

InputString: The French Toast Factory Yodobashi AKIBA Japan
Name: The French Toast Factory Yodobashi AKIBA
Address: Japan, 101-0028 Tokyo, Chiyoda City, Kanda Hanaokacho, 1-1 Akiba8F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 442 reviews","4 stars, 268 reviews","3 stars, 109 reviews","2 stars, 46 reviews","1 stars, 36 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Friday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Monday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u201310 pm"]
Reviews:
["Absolutely loved this restaurant! So much that my friend and I ate there 3 times in 4 days! The soufflé pancakes here were much better than the happy pancakes place, in my opinion.

My friend and I tried different dishes from here. All the pancakes and French toast dishes were had were fantastic. The burger and grilled chicken sandwich were also amazing. I also tried the Tom yum soup with noodles and that was light and comforting. We didn’t like the garlic shrimp pasta very much.

Avocado salad was great. Also enjoyed the buttermilk fried chicken! The mango lassi was my favorite drink here: slightly different from the regular lassi from Indian restaurants but it was still good.

Overall, I enjoyed coming here and can’t wait to be back when next I’m in Tokyo.

There was a line every time we went but it moved fast! Amazing service too; very nice waiters and they made slight adjustments to my dishes when I asked. Food was also very affordable.","***how to find!***
Google maps is really bad at telling you how to find this place! You need to go into the electronics store and find the elevator to the 8th floor!

Very good restaurant! Really nice ambiance, and great decor. The staff is really nice, and the middle long table is great for meeting people!

I had the eggs Benedict with a Chiffon Cake! The eggs were really fresh, and tasted home made! The sauces used were really tasty, and the presentation was amazing! My only complaint was a bit too much salt on the fries.

The chiffon cake was extremely soft and sweet! Everything about the bakeries in this place is super top notch! I hope to visit again!","Great portion of food for an affordable price. So much variety of sweets and teas. Very nice to eat for lunch for just have a snack.

Got the sister dish that had both hot cakes and French toast. The French toast was amazing!

However, the hot cakes were very eggy and not my style. They were indeed fluffy but I would go back only for the French toast even though it seems like the hot cakes are their selling point.

Service was fast and English friendly. In a very busy area in a busy mall but worthwhile if not a long wait. Luckily, no wait when I went on Friday lunchtime.

Recommend if in the area!","Popping in looking for French toast and we were not let down with it. The wait is long for it since it is baked and prepared fresh but the flavor is great. The Eggs Benedict was also good on flavor the picture from the online menu do not depict much American cheese on then I didn’t notice any on the photos and I don’t generally have cheese all over mine the flavor was still good but would skip that item next time. The grapefruit juice as well is one of my favorites and always order it when it’s at restaurant and isn’t as common these days.","Good food and portions for the price. The service was okay. The place seems to fill up very quickly. However, the entire restaurant felt like it needed a face lift. As the tables and chairs were at the end of their life cycle. The floors and walls were dirty too covered in sauce stains and scraps it seems. Obviously this place is popular with tourists and accessible, so I can't knock it too hard, but this rating is definitely closer to a 3 than a 4.","Was so good we came here twice. Had the Eggs Benedict followed by the Macadamia Pancakes because I just couldn’t make up my mind. Both were delicious. Husband had the same but with the Creme Brûlée pancakes and they were ok

Tried the Beef Pho when we came back the second time and it was better than the pho I had at other places although I could have done with more rice noodles. Plenty of veggies and herbs in there though.","I went in the morning and there was a 1 hour+ wait, I came back at night and there was no wait! I ordered the original french toast, pancakes, and garlic shrimp pasta. The French toast portion is a bit small, but tasted better than the pancakes as the pancakes tasted too buttery even when I didn’t add any butter. I liked the garlic shrimp pasta the most.","Without a doubt this is a place I'd recommend people to stop by if they're hungry and in need of either something sweet or savory. I have had the pleasure of trying different items on the menu and each time I've enjoyed them to the fullest. I love the flavor that you can taste in each cup of coffee which fits perfectly with the meal.","Good pancakes but was little eggy taste
The french toast was good but dense not fluffy
The waiter wasn’t welcoming
First time in japan felt that way
Although there was empty tables but he told us to wait for 15-20 min to sit at the empty table.","There was a queue at around 1:30pm when we dined but it moved relatively quickly. Pancakes were super light and fluffy. Delicious. French toast was also good but a bit sweeter for my taste.","Chiffon Pancake, Toast, The French Toast Factory, Garlic Shrimp Pasta, Salad, Pancake, French Toast Factory Burger, French Fries, Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Chicken Sandwich and Fries","There is an elevator that takes you to the restaurant from the Yodobashi store","The French Toast Factory, French Toast Factory Burger","Chiffon Pancake, Pancake","Wheelchair accessibility","Recommended dishes","Strawberry Pancake","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 2","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Service: 3","Service: 2","Meal type","Breakfast","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Brunch","Dinner"," More","Lunch","Other","Toast"]
AiReviewSummary: I loved this restaurant and went there three times in four days! The soufflé pancakes were amazing, and the French toast dishes were fantastic too. I also tried the Tom yum soup, burger, and grilled chicken sandwich, all of which were delicious. The avocado salad and buttermilk fried chicken were great, and my favorite drink was the mango lassi. The service was excellent, and the food was very affordable.

Name: Parfaiteria bel
Address: Japan, 150-0043 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Dogenzaka, 1 Chome710
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 254 reviews","4 stars, 179 reviews","3 stars, 77 reviews","2 stars, 25 reviews","1 stars, 37 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 5\u201311:30 pm","Friday, 5 pm\u201312:30 am","Saturday, 3 pm\u201312:30 am","Sunday, 3\u201311:30 pm","Monday, 5\u201311:30 pm","Tuesday, 5\u201311:30 pm","Wednesday, 5\u201311:30 pm"]
Reviews:
["Japanese girl receptionist attitude is awful, shouting to customers (not only to tourists but also to local Japanese) to queue up at back door staircase.  I understood the waiting area is narrow and people may block the entrance to other restaurants, but receptionist attitude is so terrible (forgot to record her name).  If my friend is not insisted to try the dessert there, I will definitely not to spend 1 yen there.  Waiting queue sequence is a mess!  Late come can access first!?  Highly NOT recommended to go Parfaiteria beL any branch.  Price is not worth any, a lot better choice in Japan other place with good service.  Do NOT waste your time and money at Parfaiteria beL.  If don't believe, try it yourself.","If you're looking for the ultimate desserts close to Shibuya crossing, look no further than this ice cream paradise! The ice cream here is the stuff of dreams, with an incredible variety of flavors that will leave you wanting more.

We visited for a cool dessert after the full day out in Tokyo. I had this on my watch list from Instagram and wanted to try some of the hyped desserts I've seen online. The number of layers you get on the plate is amazing and the testes are very well coordinated. Prices are on the top end on the ¥2,000 range but it's worth the price you pay.
The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, perfect for a quick treat or a leisurely dessert date. Don't miss out on this sweet gem!","Located on the 3rd floor. Came here at 8pm on the last night of Golden week. No wait, I was seated at the counter. Staff spoke good English, explained the menu, and warned me they were closing early (I had an hour. All the groups that arrived after me were turned away.). I ordered the strawberry parfait set with a Japanese whiskey. The flavors were perfectly coordinated and the presentation was impressive. The whiskey also paired well, though the staff seemed surprised when I asked for it neat.","We came as a party of 4 on a Sunday 8:45pm. It’s full but we waited for about 5 mins only. I ordered the parfait with pistachio - omg it’s so delicious - full of different textures and flavours from the beginning to the last bit. I enjoyed immensely. The strawberry one and the citrusy one ordered by my parents are both amazing. We all love it and had a great time here. Staff are so nice!! Highly recommend this place and want to come back again next time 💖","So quaint and cute! The pistachio tapir parfait is their best seller and contains a medley of ingredients. Five cookies, three types of ice cream, many nuts, creme brulee with burnt sugar, and cake. Though some ingredients were tasteless, some others like the ice cream were delicious.","Tried this place over the weekend. The parfaits were really tasty and very artistic. It's a bit pricey for a parfait but it's worth it. They have a changing menu and the 1st pic is a special for the Sakura season.  Would recommend this place.","We visited around 9:00 p.m. after dinner on a weekday.
I was surprised at the popularity of the restaurant, which was almost full when I entered, but was convinced by the hospitality of the staff and the parfait …","Cozy spot for some good parfait. Can't remember the names but ordered 4 types and all were good and distinct in taste. We were lucky that we didn't have to wait to get in. There was a queue forming when we left.","The best parfaits I’ve tasted in my life! Very creative! Must try when in Japan! Parfait is an art work! Long lines so be patient.","It’s on the third floor. The parfait looks cute but the waiting time is a bit too long. Sadly the cream does not taste very good.","Speak to the chef and they will adjust the dishes","Princess Belle, Chocolate and Pistachio","Dietary restrictions","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 1","¥3,000–4,000","¥8,000–9,000","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 1","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 1","Dinner","Other"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: I visited Parfaiteria beL with my friend and we had a terrible experience because of the rude receptionist. The waiting queue order was also very confusing. On the other hand, some reviewers had a great time here, saying the parfait is amazing and the atmosphere is cozy. They liked the variety of flavors and the presentation of the desserts. Some even said it's the best parfait they've ever had!

Name: Mensho San Francisco
Address: Japan, 160-0023 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Nishishinjuku, 1 Chome13  7F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 190 reviews","4 stars, 230 reviews","3 stars, 128 reviews","2 stars, 26 reviews","1 stars, 22 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Friday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Monday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u201310 pm"]
Reviews:
["One of the best places to get vegan/vegetarian ramen in Tokyo. They have this chain in San Francisco & Oakland but the price difference is stark. At only ~$8 USD a bowl here vs the $23 USD in California locations, it makes this place worth visiting multiple times if you're on vacation. You order on a kiosk outside and present your tickets to the employees who are always friendly and have great customer service, they even offer you a bib if you need to cover yourself from broth splatters.
The flavor is complex umami and so delicious. I have to admit I came here several times during my 2-week vacation. Because the other vegetarian ramen places nearby just couldn't compare.
I came here with my brother and he was pleasantly surprised at how delicious the Matcha Ramen was and preferred it over other ramen we tried. I'll definitely be back at Mensho the next time I'm in Tokyo.","【柚子ラーメンの絶品味とユニークな店内】

Mensho San Francisco in Shinjuku offers a delightful ramen experience with their Yuzu Ramen. Despite the slightly long wait and a line of eager patrons, the wait was worth it for the incredible taste. The ramen's rich flavors and the fact-filled walls about the ingredients made it clear they use top-notch products.

However, the cash-only policy is a bit inconvenient, so be prepared. Luckily, there was a consent available, which saved me as my phone battery was running low. The restaurant is connected to Shinjuku station, though the station can be confusing. Still, I reached the 7th floor in about 5 minutes. An English menu is available.

I would definitely return to explore more of their ramen offerings!

🍽️ Order: Yuzu Ramen
⏰ Slightly long wait
🔌 One Consents available
🔠 English menu available
🚃 5 minutes walk from Shinjuku station","Pictured is the 抹茶鶏白湯らぁ麺 / matcha tori paitan ramen.

(ig @wei.oframen to follow my ramen adventure 😚)

09/20/2023

Mensho San Francisco near Shinjuku Station seems to mirror the menu from their Michelin-featured Mensho Tokyo SF location. Since I've never been to the SF location, I can't say how it compares. My order of the day was this matcha green tea bowl. Even though it looks wacky af, it does kinda work. I just can't handle the sweetness of this bowl tho. It's almost like a savory matcha latte imo 🤨","I had the Matcha Tori Paitan Tamen topped with Wagyu Roast Beef after a recommendation from a friend. AND IT DOESN’T disappoint. The noodles were chewy, the soup was rich umami flavored and creamy. If you want to try something new….Definetly try this one! The interior was really minimalistic and in a modern style. The staff was friendly and my food came out quick. I WILL visit again!","Interesting ramen bowl options! Ordered matcha, truffle, and wagyu ramen bowls. With 2 bottled beers and iced coffee coming in around ¥5000. Also provided with paper bibs which was clearly needed! Quite tasty and generous serves. The parsnip chips was quite nice too.","Amazing vegan ramen! There was not much of a wait when we went, which was a plus as it seems many ramen restaurants have long lines. The flavor of the spicy vegan ramen was incredible. Perfect noodles. Staff very friendly. But iirc it is cash only.","I don't understand how this place isn't 5 stars. This food is absolutely incredible with such friendly staff. I have come here multiple times while in tokyo. Genuinely the best ramen I ever had","I went to the ramen that trdned out to be a "YouTube sensation" and a branch od michelin Star restaurant. Out of curiosity, I tried Matcha Ramen because if not there and then, when? …","I ordered a Matcha Tori Paitan Ramen topped with A5 wagyu. Overall, the ramen is a bit salty. The portion is good, and the beef was fantastic.","Very delicious ramen! Matcha and truffle ramen are must try! The broth is very rich and unique. Will definitely visit the restaurant again","They have vegan options","Vegetarian options","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 2","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: This ramen place in Tokyo is a must-visit for its delicious and complex umami flavor. The Matcha Ramen was a hit among visitors, especially with its unique taste. The Yuzu Ramen is another popular option, with a rich flavor and top-notch ingredients. The restaurant has a friendly staff, offering customer service with a smile. The ramen bowls are generously sized, and the atmosphere is modern and cozy. With prices starting from around $8 US, it's a great value for the quality of food. Visitors rave about the unique flavors and delicious noodles, making it a place worth revisiting multiple times.

Name: Age.3
Address: Japan, 104-0061 Tokyo, Chuo City, Ginza, 1 Chome2411  1
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 2,599 reviews","4 stars, 389 reviews","3 stars, 142 reviews","2 stars, 42 reviews","1 stars, 52 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20137 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20137 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20137 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20137 pm","Monday, Closed","Tuesday, 11 am\u20137 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20137 pm"]
Reviews:
["Shortlisted this little shop before our Japan trip, don’t have much expectations but was wow by the simplicity of fried bread with generous amount of fillings!

Greatly recommend everyone to try this out if it is not too out of the way for you - we initially only bought 2 but end up going back for 3 more because it’s really that good! Stand out flavours worth trying are the curry, egg salad and apple pie. We got greedy and added the seasonal spicy curry, and felt that it was way too spicy to enjoy the flavours so do take note if you can’t take spicy food.

They do not have seats or tables available but you can just cross over to the small park to enjoy the breads.","We went on a Sunday around 12pm and it was about a 45 min wait. The queue starts across the road. We didn’t eat it fresh which we should have, instead waited till we got back to the hotel because we bought a set of 4 sandwiches. Even though it was not fresh it was still delicious - the fried bread held its form and was crunchy, the cream although a little split was still perfectly smooth. Don’t let my photos fool you, this was hands down the best dessert we had during our whole trip.","Can be better！ not worth to queue for it. service is slow， which can be improved. You have your order form which can be spread to customer to fill in. and collect the paper to start preparing the bread. 1 person fried ， cut bread. 1 person squeeze in cream and putting on other material. 1 at counter. 1 pass bread to customer ， another arranging queue. should arrange ppl to help more at kitchen
the fried bread with white cream feel greasy after few bites.
wont go for it second time.","oh wow so worth the trip here. the bread is just right amount of crunchy with soft gooey filling. depending on what u pick of course.  I got the spicy curry (sooooo good but definitely spicy), strawberry chocolate cream,  and honey rare cheese! they have everything from sweet to savory! you have to try!!!","Honestly really good! But you can only eat one per person because you'll be full! There's no seating inside (It's a really small and cramped window store). Best to eat in the park/playground next to it and then throw your trash away at the store. Line wasn't long at all (waited maybe 5min).","We had two of their sandwiches and they were amazing! 🤩 The chocolate mint is frozen whipped cream which had a perfect mint balance. It really helped cool us off during a rather hot day. The potato salad one was equally excellent. If you are nearby, definitely check them out!!","it’s worth the hype!! tried 4 different ones and all were amazing. Egg salad, terikayi, curry and the most famous in Instagram, the 100¥ whipped cream fried sandwich. Totally recommended! also there is a park next to the store to enjoy the sandwiches without stress 🤤🤤🤤","OMG, this is one of the best or not the best toast I have ever had in Japan!  There was a long line outside, but in the end, the wait was worth it!  Also be aware that that this only for take aways.The crunch of the bread was amazing and …","This place has gone viral on social media but it was worth the wait! The wonderful staff even provided us UV umbrellas while we waiting in the sun across the road. I ordered the Jam Strawberry and it was delicious! Recommended !","Worth the viral hype. Delicious.
Went for the candied sweet potato.
The fried bread reminds us of Beaver tails. …","Whipped Cream Deep-Fried Sandwhich, Strawberry Chocolate","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 2","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 2","Meal type","Breakfast","Take out","¥1–1,000","Service","Food: 5","Food: 2","Brunch","Lunch"," More","Other"]
AiReviewSummary: This small shop in Japan serves delicious fried bread with generous fillings, such as curry, egg salad, and apple pie. We highly recommend trying them out, but be aware that the shop doesn't have tables or seating, so you'll need to enjoy your bread in a nearby park. The fried bread is crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the fillings are flavorful and generous. Even though you can't eat them fresh, the bread still holds up well after 45 minutes of waiting. Try the seasonal spicy curry and apple pie, and don't forget to visit the shop to get your hands on their famous fried bread.

Name: Kotobuki-sei-an
Address: 2 Chome-7-21 Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0032, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 95 reviews","4 stars, 67 reviews","3 stars, 62 reviews","2 stars, 37 reviews","1 stars, 84 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20135:30 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20135:30 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20135:30 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20135:30 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20135:30 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20135:30 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20135:30 pm"]
Reviews: ["MAR 2024\n\nThe crepe store is a hole-in-the-wall shop located in an alleyway. Ordering is via the ticket machine and you hand it to the staff at the store front. It took less than five minutes to get my crepe as I was the only one at that time. I had the tiramisu crepe; mascarpone cream was rich, covered in matcha powder, and inside is some sponge cake layered with an intense and delicious matcha cream. Towards the bottom there is a bit of lemon jam and sweet black beans which was a refreshing palate cleanser. Overall a strong and tasty matcha crepe.","Waited about 30 minutes to get the matcha crepe. The matcha crepe was smaller than the one I saw on Instagram but it tasted good. It was a bit too sweet for me tho. Also, the price was high. 880 yen for one. All matcha crepes are the same price. The shop is located in a back alley so it might be hard to find.","Tucked away in a tiny alley, these matcha crepes are worth the wait! They have multiple flavors that all looked delicious. We tried the matcha tiramisu crepe and loved it. Make sure to look for the appropriate place to eat, as they will ask you to move from near the restaurant.","The shop is located in a dead-end alley off another through alley.  It can easily be located by the mural of a large maneki neko (beckoning cat) with three smaller cats eating musubi (rice balls) on the shutters of an izakaya at the opening \u2026","Very strong matcha powder flavour. Very nice matcha cream. 900 plus yen for 1 is pretty expensive. I think they use very good ingredient. Among all the crepe I tried. Marion and this taste the best. Do give it a try when u go asakusa. I \u2026","I am not sure why the review is so low here? The matcha crepe is really good! It cost cheaper from the competitor next door, but it is still recommended if you like matcha!! The store only serves take away, but there is an outdoor seats \u2026","Missing Ice cream to balance the bitterness of the matcha. However the cream at the end of the crepe is pretty nice. However 950\u00A5 is a bit expensive, but in the range of \u0022Famous \u0026 Delicious\u0022 Crepe \uD83E\uDD5E","This tiny place inside a dead end alley, sells delicious matcha flavored crepes, stuffed with cream and various other things. We tried the almond one, it was excellent! Recommended! 950 yen.","Lovely matcha stuff and hard to beat. The only one slightly better I was able to find was in Kyoto\u2026.and trust me I\u2019ve tried many other places.","Extremely good matcha crepe. The matcha was intense and it wasn\u0027t too sweet. The overall balance of the dessert was perfect.","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 1","Cream Brulee","\u00A51,000\u20132,000","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Take out","\u00A51\u20131,000","Tiramisu","Service","Food: 5","Food: 2","Brunch"," More","Other"]
AiReviewSummary: The crepe store has a unique location in a small alley, but it's worth the find. You can try different flavors, like the tiramisu crepe, which has rich mascarpone cream, matcha powder, sponge cake, and refreshing lemon jam and black beans. Some people waited a long time for their crepe, but they said it was strong and tasty. The matcha crepe is around 900-950 yen, which is a bit pricey, but many reviewers believe it's worth it.

Name: Kasugatei Akihabara
Address: Japan, 101-0021 Tokyo, Chiyoda City, Sotokanda, 3 Chome112  1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 359 reviews","4 stars, 203 reviews","3 stars, 136 reviews","2 stars, 43 reviews","1 stars, 24 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u201310:45 pm","Friday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Monday, 11 am\u201310:45 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u201310:45 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u201310:45 pm"]
Reviews:
["Fantastic ramen shop offering uniquely thick noodles for those wanting more than the traditional noodle types. You're given noodles and toppings first without broth as well as tons of little toppings that you can add for free to personalise your meal. After your noodles are finished you can get your bowl filled with the broth which tastes amazing mixed in with all your leftover juices from the noodles. My preferred way of eating ramen for sure. Highly recommended as a great place to get good, well priced ramen in Akihabara.","Super delicious, I ordered a soupless pork noodles, the texture of the noodles are think and elastic, the sauce looks oily but actually it's where the favour come from. I'm not really hungry at all, if not, I will side order a rice with an egg together with the sauce, it will be 100% satisfied.","A little confusing ordering situation:
get a ticket inside, leave your ticket, wait outside, get seated and receive food after several minutes.
Well somehow the shop fits into the Akihabara atmosphere.

The Abura soba have been delicious. No complains on the taste.","While I’m personally not a huge fan of oil noddles, this one was actually really good. Strong flavor, great chashu, and the huge portion (375g) of noodles were only 1060¥! Ask for soup after you’re finished to drink up the remainder of the thick soup. Delicious.","This place serves some of the best ramen I've ever had. Got a very large portion the first time with all the toppings and it really was a lot! Went with medium on the next visit and it was more manageable. Very good ramen and great value for money!","The ramen itself in the abura soba was amazing. You can tell it is high quality after the first slurp.  The portion sizes are good for the price as well. The broth I had to add some stuff to get it to my liking, but after I did, it elevates …","This stuff is the best ramen I've had in japan, I got addicted from the first time I went and now look up a Kasugatei wherever I go.
It is extremely rich so you don't need to go with the larger sizes, a regular is …","Very standard 油そば

Not amazing but not bad. It’s a place where you know what to expect.

Good fatty ramen like dish. Never too crowded, decent prices 👌🏽","Super tasty abura soba in Akihabara.

Very small spot with only about 15 or so seats. Ordering is done on a digital …","Maze Ramen sooo good! Service was good quick servic. Buy the ticket on the manchine , offers other languages too.","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Oil Noodle","Service: 3","Meal type","¥1–1,000","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 3","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: This ramen shop in Akihabara is a must-visit. The menu offers unique, thick noodles and various toppings, allowing you to customize your meal. The abura soba, or oil noodles, are a standout dish, with a strong flavor and high-quality chashu. The portion sizes are generous and the prices are very reasonable. You can add broth to your noodles, which makes the dish even more delicious. Many customers recommend this shop, saying it serves some of the best ramen they've ever had.

Name: Chinya
Address: 2 Chome-16-1 Hanakawado, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0033, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 260 reviews","4 stars, 103 reviews","3 stars, 40 reviews","2 stars, 10 reviews","1 stars, 18 reviews"]
Reviews:
["It was a wonderful sukiyaki restaurant which has a history of more than a century.

The waitress was well trained as she served every dishe at proper position to make it look beautiful. Food taste was fantastic and the speed of service was excellent despite they just started their business. Teki Sashi Wagyu Beef from Miyagi Pref or Hookaido, which means the meat has right content of juiciness or it could be said marbled. The beef is not branded like Matsuzaka or Oumi but certified by CHINYA.

It is accessible from Asakusa Train Station of Skytreeline. By car it may not be so convenient as there are not so many coin parking lots.
Chinya's dinning place is upstairs and there is no elevator.

I recommend this place for anyone especially foreginers to enjoy Japanese traditional food.
Wishing good luck to the place to sustain the historical sukiyaki tradition.","Our visit to Chin-ya was truely amazing from start to finish, We were seated in a private room which was very spacious. The lady serving us did her best to communicate even with the lack of English.

The food was amazing, Sukiyaki was one of the foods I was the most excited about trying and it did not dissapoint! The meat was great and the raw egg was scary at first but I would say it was essential.
I'd definently go again.","A sukiyaki fine dining restaurant, the most expensive set is over ¥15000 per person. Recommend to book through their website first.
We ordered 2 x Ekibasha course and the beef is at a very high quality. The service is excellent too, but the set is really expensive for a random walk-in dinner. We feel like it is slightly overpriced.","I had a very nice experience here for lunch one week ago. The environment is fancy, the food is delectable, especially the service is excellent! The staff is friendly and professional. Thanks for providing such good meal for us. CHINYA sukiyaki is highly recommended.","Book for sukiyaki as the name states it’s the oldest sukiyaki restaurant in Tokyo. Reception staff was super friendly. Waitress were all friendly except the older lady, very condescending and ignorant. …","Beautiful space but taste & service is not worth the money. If you are not a sukiyaki expert and would like to experience sukiyaki while in Japan, would recommend to go somewhere else. …","The quality of regular beef is really regular and it is not in one big piece. However, it is still very delicious. Weekday lunch set is the best price of this restaurant.","If you like shabu shabu and wagyu beef then it is a place where you must go. Nice service and atmosphere. Suitable for couples and family","revisited chinya 4pax lunch on 10dec2023

had both shabu shabu & sukiyaki..sukiyaki better cos we ordered more expensive …","It is my first time to this Historic restaurant. Everything is so good, especially the beef and sauces.","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥3,000–4,000","¥6,000–7,000","Service: 5","Aged Wagyu","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: This old sukiyaki restaurant in Tokyo is a great place to enjoy traditional Japanese food. The service is excellent and the food is fantastic, especially the sukiyaki and Teki Sashi Wagyu Beef. They have a special course menu, including the Ekibasha course, which offers high-quality beef. The restaurant has a fancy environment and friendly staff. Some people may find the prices a bit high, but if you like sukiyaki and wagyu beef, it's definitely worth a visit.

["First picture is 2023 for one person.
I was a big fan and very happy to be there. Service was nice.
Full plate of meat, big bowl of rice. Perfection.

Second picture is 2024 for 3 people!

Germany were also disappointed.
5 piece of meat for 3 people
5 pieces of tofu for 3 people.
4 pieces shirataki for 3 people.

We left hungry and sad too.

12000¥ total (roundabout 4000€ each person).

The biggest disappointment","Visited Sat lunch a little past opening, was told it'd be an hour wait but ended up being less than 30 min wait. Meat and service top quality for the price. The building and neighborhood adds historic charm to the dining experience. They have English menu and seemed very used to serving foreign customers. Expect to take off your shoes at entry and pay in cash.","Had a well-deserved meal as a late celebration for my birthday with my wife and in-laws. The meal was great. The quality of the meat was worth it, and the place is not so packed even if it's close to Asakusa. The experience is awful. I will never come back again.","Went there straight without reservation (knowing that imahan is fully booked) and was disappointed, not with the taste but with the ridiculously small portion

But if you are expecting a good quality restaurant experience, it might be better to go somewhere else.","NEED TO TYPE THIS IN CAPITAL LETTER: THEIR SERVICE IS WORST IN JAPAN.

Though I got mixed feelings, because the meat was good, however I got served …","Miso Soup, Beef and Vegetable, Japanese Pickles, Raw Egg","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 1","¥3,000–4,000","¥4,000–5,000","Service: 5","Service: 3","Service: 2","Service: 1","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Food: 2","Food: 1","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: The restaurant has good service and perfect portions of meat and rice, but some customers were disappointed with the amount of food they received, especially when paying a high price. One customer got just 3-4 slices of beef for a high price, while another didn't get enough food for three people. Some people loved the traditional building and historic neighborhood, but others found the environment not clean. The restaurant is known for its high-quality wagyu meat and traditional nabe dishes, but some customers had a poor experience due to the rush service or small portions.

Name: Ningyocho Imahan
Address: 2 Chome-9-12 Nihonbashiningyocho, Chuo City, Tokyo 103-0013, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,017 reviews","4 stars, 471 reviews","3 stars, 117 reviews","2 stars, 20 reviews","1 stars, 28 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u201310 pm","Wednesday, Closed"]
Reviews:
["Top level service here at ningyocho imahan, and also the best sukiyaki I’ve had .
You most likely have to book in advance, and for me I chose the top quality beef they had. And it was extremely good, and in private room , the server dressed in traditional dress comes in to cook it for you .
They speak to you in Japanese and I can understand and speak a little, but they use full 尊敬語 which maybe slightly hard to understand as it is super respectful level of Japanese! But nonetheless I really appreciate this level of service
It’s not cheap but it is well worth. The course meal is also very filling. I also enjoyed the IWA 5 sake they had on menu. Very recommended !","This is one of the most famous high-end Sukiyaki restaurant in Tokyo and we made the dinner booking a month before. Environment is very ancient and we had our spacious private room. Service was exception and we are impressed by the lady who fried the wagyu slices in front of us.

The set meal was in good order from appetizer, sashimi,wagyu beef,vegetables, rice and dessert. Very impressed by the excellent quality of the beef tendered and not too greasy at all - it is a tradition to dip into whisked egg as good pairing.

Nothing to complain at all just the price is on the upper bar in its exquisite service.","Been here many times especially when visit Tokyo. Best sukiyaki ever. A little bit pricey but worth every penny and deserves michelin star. They have specific requirements for meat, vegetables, fruits, anything. So they will serve you best food on the table.
Service was great, they are very polite and attentive. Mrs. Aoyama was very helpful, kind, and care to us. Obviously will be back again soon.
Reservation is highly recommended because it’s always full, but not crowded inside, they have few table only with enough distance with others, so you will feel comfortable and won’t feel crowded.","I’m a sucker for 壽喜燒
I’m also a sucker for old school nostalgia

This was:
Top quality beef
Top service
Top tier sukiyaki

Although the pricing was not too friendly (I ordered two additional prices, 2 for 8500 yens), I knew it was somewhere special and I needed to fulfill that hunger with additional meat. But trust me, 3 pieces is very enough, with three different dishes of accompanying food (lettuce, noodles, veggies, tofu). The rice…made the mistake of ordering additional bowls of rice.

Overall highly recommend if you don’t mind the price. Otherwise just a very exquisite experience.","Came to enjoy sukiyaki with co-workers. Everything was amazing. From the traditional service to the amazing food. The beef just melted in my mouth and the coating of raw egg made it velvety and creamy. The veggies, which were picked during to being in season, was a great pairing to the meat. The last course of rice with lightly cooked eggs was elevated when the waitress told us to pour the remaining raw egg into the rice. I could have eaten at least 2 more bowls of rice!","We visited here in April 2024. One of the best experiences we had visiting Japan. We were welcomed warmly upon arrival and shown to our room. Our hostess was very kind and helpful and spoke good English to accommodate our limited Japanese. We chose the sukiyaki course and it was one of the best meals we’ve had. The sashimi was also really great considering their speciality is meat. We felt honoured to have dined here and would definitely come back again.","This is a sukiyaki restaurant that features wagyu beef at its finest.   This restaurant and its beef is so good that it has its own steak shops around Tokyo selling various cuts of wagyu beef.  This place has great service as the staff actually cooked all of our ingredients according to old fashion sukiyaki style from the past.   Overall, get a reservation and come and taste one of the best beef and sukiyaki places in all of Japan.","The restaurant building and interiors are a bit worn and dated. It's a pricey ($150+/pp) course menu restaurant.

The food is amazing. The presentation is very good. Variety is great and meat is fantastic. They cook it right in the room with you. The service was great too. Tatami mats, shoes off, staff wears traditional clothing","In our own private room, we had an incredible sukiyaki experience! We ordered 2 different set courses with top quality beef and a separate ponzu sukiyaki with top quality beef! All the courses were beautiful and delicious. The meat was perfectly tender and cooked beautifully! What a great meal this was!","We had the Sukiyaki Dan lunch set.  The meal starts with an appetizer plate, and sashimi.  At this location, a staff member cooks all three pieces of meat for you in a thin layer of warashita, followed by cooking eggs in the sauce and fat …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Shabu Soup, Beef","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥5,000–6,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Shabu Soup","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: The restaurant Ningyocho Imahan offers top-level service and the best sukiyaki I've ever had. The set meal is a course selection from appetizer to dessert, including sashimi and wagyu beef, which is tender and not too greasy. The sukiyaki is cooked in a traditional way in a private room, and the server even dresses in traditional clothing to cook the dishes. The reviewers enjoyed the IWA 5 sake and highly recommend it. The restaurant has a high-end atmosphere and serves top-quality beef, wagyu slices, and vegetables.

Their sesame cream sauce is also delicious. Other popular dishes include beef sushi and different parts of beef for BBQ, such as beef tenderloin and beef tongue. The restaurant offers a variety of sets with good value, including lunch sets that meet all nutrition needs. However, the service can be harsh and the ventilation system may not be working well. Despite some drawbacks, the food is impressive, and it's worth visiting.

Name: Tonkatsu Marushichi Ikebukuro
Address: Japan, 171-0021 Tokyo, Toshima City, Nishiikebukuro, 1 Chome12 F 1Esola
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 49 reviews","4 stars, 79 reviews","3 stars, 39 reviews","2 stars, 25 reviews","1 stars, 26 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20138 pm"]
Reviews:
["The restaurant is difficult to find especially the day we went when it was raining. You need to find the Esola Building and then take the lift to the 6F.
As the restaurant is quite small, a bit of waiting time is expected. We waited for about 10mins but staff gave us a menu to look while waiting and we were quickly seated soon after and was lucky to even get a corner table.

They ran out of the premium 300g scotch filet that day so we opted for the 150g premium and the standard 300g loin. Both dishes came out very fast. The egg was smooth and although the meat is thick, it was incredibily tender and soft and melted in your mouth once you bite into it.

There is some wasabi relish that goes really nicely and adds some kick to the dish and you get a little zesty side dish and a bowl of clam soup.","The place was abit difficult to locate, eventually we found a few floors up this shoping center. Roughly ten tables.

We arrived during rush hour, that is, around lunchtime, pretty long queue, we waited for about 30 min. The lady would approach the line and take orders in advance. The communication and english was just enough to make our orders.

By the time we received our table, the food was served within minutes. We ordered the tonkatsu, rice, egg and miso soup which was absolutely tasty.
There was another waitress who spoke proper english. The chef and staff were all genuinely kind and professional.

The wait was worth it and we were satisfied.","High expectations before coming here for the thick tonkatsu. Hubby love it till he bit into a piece which was undercooked. It was pink and not cooked throughly. We feedback to the staff but she told us that it was the oil. We are sure that it was not cooked as we cannot bite through the piece of meat.","At 6th floor of Esola. I ate the smallest one 150gram but for me it was big enough. It was super thick and delicious! You should try the sauce.","Best katsu don I ever had. My friend got the super thick one which was huge.
