The regular size was more than enough for me.","The Best Tonkatsu we ate so far.. we definitely comeback and eat again when we are around here in Japan Tokyo Ikebukuro","It was good.  Price is a bit high.  A little greasy.  It's also a large quantity of food.","Very nice Tonkatsu donburi! The tonkatsu was thick but very succulent and tender. …","It’s quick delicious food. There’s only one thing on the menu and it’s just かつ丼. …","Waited for half an hour, but the food is worth to wait.","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Lunch"," More","Other"]
AiReviewSummary: The restaurant was a bit hard to find, but the staff made up for it with their good service. We waited a bit, but they gave us menus to look at and soon seated us at a corner table. We ordered the premium 150g scotch filet and standard 300g loin, which came out quickly. The egg was smooth and the meat was tender and soft. We also got wasabi relish, a zesty side dish, and clam soup. We had a long wait, but the food was worth it. We tried the tonkatsu, rice, egg, and miso soup, which was very tasty. The chef and staff were kind and professional.

Name: 上等焼肉 ひらく
Address: Japan, 150-0042 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Udagawacho, 3313, Kusuhara Bldg., 3F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 86 reviews","4 stars, 33 reviews","3 stars, 13 reviews","2 stars, 8 reviews","1 stars, 13 reviews"]
Reviews:
["This time, we had the "Advanced Course (8,800 yen)" with all-you-can-drink included.
The all-you-can-drink menu offers over 20 types of beer, sours, shochu, wine, soft drinks, and more, so you can have a lot of fun.

First up is "Kimchi and Namul". The slightly unusual dishes, such as bamboo shoot namul and cherry tomato kimchi, are delicious.

``Hiraku Salad'' is simple, but the dressing is delicious. I want to eat meat while picking to cleanse my palate, so I'd be happy if there was a little more.

Now it's time for the meat! This one, named ``meat appetizer,'' is a large piece of beef sashimi with a heaping amount of yukhoe covered in sweet sauce in the center. An outrageous act of eating yukhoe mixed with egg yolk wrapped in beef sashimi! I'm sure it's delicious.

Next up is two types of tongue: ``Extremely Thick Sliced ​​Tongue'' and ``Devil's Tongue.'' The thick slices can be cut in half and grilled in two ways: well-grilled or rare, and the thinly sliced ​​``Devil's Tongue'' can be grilled quickly. All have different textures and are delicious! Personally, I like thinly sliced ​​meat.

For ``Japanese Grilled Wagyu Sushi,'' only the sushi rice is brought to you, and then the staff quickly grills the thinly sliced ​​Wagyu beef in front of you and places it on the sushi rice. Pop it into your mouth as soon as you can! The meat melts in your mouth.

The ``Assortment of 4 types of carefully selected meat'' includes tomosankaku, rump, chili pepper, and shoulder loin, ranging from lean meat to marbled meat. When you eat these with salt, it brings out the flavor of the meat, allowing you to enjoy the flavor of the red meat and fat.

White rice here. The rice is also cooked in a clay pot, so it's fluffy and juicy. Shiny and sweet.

I was asked to grill the "thick-sliced ​​special liver" properly (in Ostrich Club style), so I wondered if the liver was ever so soft, fluffy, and delicious.

The ``Large-sized Specially Selected Misuji Sukiyaki'' is also grilled by the staff in front of you, mixed with orange egg yolk, and served with rice cooked in a clay pot for a truly delicious meal.

The last dish is ``Kiwami Ichibo and Tokusho Harami.'' This is sauce-based, and there are two types: lean meat and marbled meat, so it's nice to be able to compare the deliciousness of the meat while eating it. As an old man, I don't like greasy foods anymore, so I guess I prefer skirt steak. I want to keep carbohydrates to a minimum at night, but I always end up eating white rice!

To finish off your meal, choose a dessert from ``rich pudding,'' ``crème brûlée,'' or ``warabi mochi (or so I think?)''. I chose the ``rich pudding,'' and since I used the orange egg yolk I'd been eating earlier, it had a really strong flavor. The smooth and slightly firm pudding has a nostalgic feel, but is also very elegant.","I visited a Yakiniku restaurant in Shibuya🚗³₃

There was a shop in a good location, 5 minutes walk from Shibuya station 🚃

When I searched for all-you-can-eat Kuroge Wagyu beef yakiniku on Instagram, I found Hiraku Yakiniku, so I made a reservation and visited 🙆‍♀️

I visited here for lunch on a weekday, and there aren't many places where you can eat all-you-can-eat Kuroge Wagyu beef yakiniku for lunch on weekdays, so I highly recommend it for those who want to have all-you-can-eat yakiniku from lunch.

First, you can enjoy the all-you-can-eat menu after receiving the rare cuts of loin, short ribs, and skirt steak☺️

You can choose salt sauce, but order with sauce𓌉𓇋 ‎🥩

The sauce was delicious, but I wanted salt, so I ordered the additional meat with salt 😍

Both the sauce and salt are delicious ☺️

Salt is recommended for those who want a light meal 🧂

We carefully select high-quality A5-ranked meat, so is it really okay to eat as much as you want? I was surprised...

There aren't many places where you can get all-you-can-eat high-quality meat at this price, and it also comes with a soft drink, so you can enjoy Yakiniku at a very cost-effective price🍖

It changed the concept of all-you-can-eat yakiniku.

I met a really wonderful shop ✨️

It is a restaurant that is guaranteed to be a repeat customer because you can enjoy delicious, high-quality meat at a cost-effective price 🙆‍♀️

The all-you-can-eat menu is for 90 minutes only for lunch, but I was very satisfied with the lunch, so next time I'd like to try the menu for dinner, so I'd like to try it for dinner ✨️

Thank you for the meal🤤","For the lunch set, a set will be given first, and you can choose what you want after eating (you can also drink as much as you want)

You can go alone, the meat is of good quality and you can enjoy the roasted meat by yourself. It's a pity that there are few options, so you may feel a little tired after eating it.","At noon on June 26, 2024, there were five groups of guests, all Taiwanese! Friendly service and exaggeratedly cheap prices. The personal basic plate is as shown in the photo, and the quantity is not large. The drinks are self-service, and there are five kinds.","This was my second visit to this restaurant. I booked seats for welcoming my friends from Sydney. Ordered ¥6600 course and drinks. My friends were surprised about Japanese Yakiniku. If it is possible to have a picturesque of cow with parts …","I used the all-you-can-eat 4,800 yen plan. It is recommended to make a reservation online on tabelog one month in advance. There seems to be a limit to the number of people who can eat all you can every day. In the first round, there will …","You have to finish your food before you can continue ordering
Of course beef is delicious
But it doesn’t feel good to deliberately press time and not let you order. …","I wanted to try a new store so I went there!
Overall, the evaluation is high! I felt that customer service was not attentive, perhaps due to a lack of staff! …","I made a reservation and ordered the Hiraku course from 8pm on Friday.
⬛︎Impressions
In my honest opinion, it was the best... …","My favorite yakiniku in Shibuya, especially all you can eat lunch is valued.","上等コース, ナムル盛り合わせ, 極みいちぼ, ユッケ","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥4,000–5,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "I enjoyed the all-you-can-eat Yakiniku course at Hiraku Yakiniku, with over 20 types of drinks included. The dishes were unique and delicious, such as "Kimchi and Namul", "Hiraku Salad", and the "Meat Appetizer" with yukhoe and egg yolk. I also liked the "Japanese Grilled Wagyu Sushi" and the "Assortment of 4 types of carefully selected meat". The white rice was also cooked to perfection. My favorite was the "Large-sized Specially Selected Misuji Sukiyaki" and "Kiwami Ichibo and Tokusho Harami". I highly recommend this restaurant, especially for lunch, and the service was friendly and attentive."

Name: Rare Tendon Ginza Mitsuyoshi
Address: Japan, 104-0061 Tokyo, Chuo City, Ginza, 6 Chome315
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 72 reviews","4 stars, 27 reviews","3 stars, 11 reviews","2 stars, 5 reviews","1 stars, 4 reviews"]
Reviews:
["The food here was amazing and the chef and waitress were very welcoming. The restaurant looked extremely clean and well maintained.
I am generally not a fan of tempura but I was pleasantly surprised by how light the tempura tasted, it was not greasy at all. The portions were huge and the ingredients tasted fresh. I was skeptical about the fried lettuce but it was delicious!
There were no English menus so we had to use Google translate, but ended up following the chef’s recommendations. Overall a great experience and would highly recommend for authentic tempura.","A newly opened fresh sashimi tempura shop in Ginza is located near the Imperial Hotel Tokyo, accessible from the nearest stations, Metro Hibiya Station or JR Yurakucho Station. They offer an English menu, and the staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming.

I was delighted with their food, especially the delicious scallop tempura and the flavorful sauce on the rice.

The shop only has seats at the counter, allowing you to enjoy watching chefs prepare your dish, making your mouth water as they craft each meal.","Came across this small restaurant and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The seafood and the wagyu was not only delicious but also uniquely special. Each bowl was a work of art and was meticulously prepared . The chefs and staff were very friendly too!","Secretly recommended by a local hairdresser, this is the new hidden gem of Ginza. Interesting concept that I have not seen elsewhere, chef fries sashimi grade fish/seafood and you eat it as a tendon. Food is made fresh after you order but …","A small little hole in the wall we stumbled upon because our first choice restaurant had ended lunch service for the day. We went in with no expectations and were pleasantly surprised by the warm hospitality and the delicious food. Wagyu …","Delicious tempura bowls on rice with dashi soup to pour on leftover rice. Super friendly chef cooked everything in front of us. Its a small restaurant with bar seats only, giving intimate vibes. Would definitely recommend!","The beef and the chicken is nice, but the tuna and scallop just so so.  The chef will only cook one by one according to the ordering, so suggest how through the menu first and order once been seated.","WOW. It really is a hidden gem and I’m sure will be popular soon. The beef wagyu and tempura bowls were so tasty and amazing and well cooked - we wish we could come again!!","Hold in the wall place with extremely limited seating. But the food is amazing…! Will never see tempura the same again.","different … sashimi tempura - yummy and worth a try","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥3,000–4,000","¥2,000–3,000","¥4,000–5,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Meal type","Food: 5…","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner","Brunch"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "The restaurant is clean and welcoming, with delicious food and friendly staff. The tempura is a must-try, light and not greasy, with huge portions and fresh ingredients. The fried lettuce is also a surprise hit! The chef's recommendations are recommended and the English menu helps. Some popular dishes include scallop tempura, sashimi, and wagyu, all cooked to perfection. The restaurant has a unique concept, with chefs preparing meals in front of you and a cozy, intimate atmosphere. Overall, it's a great experience and highly recommended."

Name: Ginza Kagari - Soba
Address: 6 Chome-4-12 Ginza, Chuo City, Tokyo 104-0061, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,722 reviews","4 stars, 691 reviews","3 stars, 279 reviews","2 stars, 120 reviews","1 stars, 192 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm"]
Reviews:
["Wow. Such a disappointment.
ממליצה מאוד להימנע, אוכל פשוט לא טעים. אם בכל זאת בוחרים להגיע, להתרחק מהוונטון המזעזע והסחוסי שלהם.

We came in 20:00 and there were 2 queues- one for ordering and one for sitting in the restaurant after placing the order, there were about 6 groups in each line when we came- it took around 50 minutes till the moment we got our food - reasonable. We ordered the special* chicken paitan ramen, tsukemen ramen and 3 extra wontons.
* (special means with additional chicken wonton - 1 piece, chicken - 2 pieces, soft egg and a few steamed veggies).

Once we got in the restaurant, the food arrived fast to us. I tried the chicken wonton first. Absolutely terrible. Every bite was filled with chicken cartilage. Like they ground the worst pieces of chicken that remained from making the ramen broth and put it inside some wonton dough. We had 2 wontons out of 5, could not eat it. (The second one we tried was only to make sure it wasn’t a one time slip)

Then I tried the ramen paitan itself and it was just meh. Nothing special. Quite anemic. It was very heavy, I barely ate half a dish. We asked if we could have some soy sauce and they said there isn’t. And then they gave the people next to us soy sauce with their tofu dish. Very annoying.

And last, and almost least was the tsukemen ramen which I didn’t like too.

Overall, the prices are pretty high, not a single local in sight (and for a good reason), and the food and the service is lacking. Don’t waste your time, hunger or money in this place. There are way better options in japan.","This place is really something! 👍✨

I went there on Monday, around 4pm and there are no lines at all. I can walk in without waiting and after I finished, there was a  long line of people waiting for the restaurant!! How lucky am I.😳‼️

I tried their recommended dish with an extra chicken. This ramen has a flavor I’ve never experienced before! There’s a mix of flavors in every bite. 🤤👍⭐️ The chicken is really good and smells great, but the best part is the soup with their bamboo shoots! It’s unexpectedly DELICIOUS 😭😭💖 my first time trying bamboo shoots, and it was such a great experience!

I recommend you all to try it out! The taste that could comfort you! 😂✨","Ginza Kagari was the most impressive restaurant I visited on this trip. From the first sip of the rich and creamy chicken soup, I felt an explosion of flavor. I immediately knew this ramen would be the highlight of my trip. I know there are a few negative reviews about this place. This restaurant might not satisfy everyone, but it has succeeded in delighting a few specific people immensely. This type of place is what I want to discover while traveling. If you're looking for something truly memorable, why not give it a try?","Many says that the location is hard to find but it’s management for me. Use google map.

There are 2 queues; one for ordering from a vending machine located inside of the shop and once you have the ticket, u will queue on the other one to be seated and served.

I order 2 bowls with 2 different base. Both is just as good while the thick chicken soup broth is super yummy at the start but it gets too overwhelming towards the end.

I prefer the other clear broth which is nice throughout my meal.","The shop is in a small alley so it might be a bit hard to find, but you should spot a queue in front of the shop. We went at 3pm and it took about 30 minutes to queue. You will order first then continue waiting until there are seats inside. It is not a big place so I suggest not bringing too much luggage in.

The food was excellent. Both the Soya and Original versions were awesome. Apart from the broth, the pumpkin was especially delicious.","This is the best soba I’ve ever had. My mind was blown, I feel like I saw heaven. Make sure to get it with shoyu, you will not regret it. Broth is very rich and heavy, I wasn’t able to finish it but it was delicious. Also they all come with …","The meal was great! Quite unique flavour to typical ramen. It's very tasty. Price is low in comparison to quality. What had caused me to lower the score is air con that was blasted out to maximum and blowing on guests. I understand it was …","The ramen & chicken soup are great,  quality is no doubt super.  However, it became too tourisitic in terms of the price and the service arrangement. The staff are too eager to clean up your table for the next round of customer.","Jun 2024. Must be a popular restaurant. We were greeted with 2 queues, 1 to buy a ticket with your orders, the other was to queue to get into the small eatery.
I ordered chicken ramen with fresh truffle. …","Be aware, there are two lines outside the entrance. Make sure you queue for the line which says ‘Before you buy the ticket’. Or else you have to queue all over again. …","Chicken Breast Meat","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 2","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","Broth Ramen","Service: 4","Service: 5","Service: 1","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 2","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "Many people have mixed reviews about this restaurant. Some people think it's terrible, while others love it. We can try three dishes: the special chicken paitan ramen, tsukemen ramen, and 3 extra wontons. Some people find the wontons terrible, with chicken cartilage, while others enjoy them. The ramen broth is a mix of flavors, with a rich soup and bamboo shoots that are surprisingly delicious. Some people also recommend the clear broth rather than the thick one. Reviewers agree that the prices are high and the service is lacking."

Name: Katsukichi Shibuya
Address: Japan, 150-0002 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Shibuya, 3 Chome910 Kdc B1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 655 reviews","4 stars, 518 reviews","3 stars, 148 reviews","2 stars, 34 reviews","1 stars, 19 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20138:30 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm"]
Reviews:
["This traditional Japanese tonkatsu restaurant is a Tabelog Top 100 spot, and for good reason. The staff is friendly, and the decor is authentically Japanese, with great attention to detail. The portions are generous, and the meat quality is excellent. The shrimp tempura is impressively large. The only downside is that the batter is a bit thick. You can also upgrade to flavored rice, which is a nice touch.","Got the ebi katsu teishoku (shrimp cutlet set meal) plus 1pc of kaki-furai (oyster). The set meal had salad, pickles, rice, and soup. The rice you can opt for shiso rice. I loved it!!! The ebi katsu is so meaty and unlike any ebikatsu I’ve ever tasted. It’s the real deal.

Had to queue for a bit. Super packed even past 7pm. Loved the interior. Would love to go back and try the usual pork katsu","Fantastic restaurant, amazing decor. It’s down the stairs and hidden. I almost didn’t go down bc it looked closed but then the doors opened said we were welcomed in. All the old wood, it’s charming. The tonkatsu is outstanding. I ordered the deluxe set. It was so tender, probably the best I’ve had. Highly recommend this place for single, couples or group dining.","Chanced upon this while researching for Tonkatsu around Shibuya area. Saw good reviews and decided to give it a try! The wait was quite fast, roughly just 5 minutes and we are seated. There was quite a good selection of fried food, from …","Tonkatsu is as good as it is. The shiso rice were really made my day,  giving refresh feeling and never boring during eating rice with tonkatsu.
Staff seems to a bit not enough.
Atmostphere is good and unique.
Toilet is clean.","Definitely the Best Curry Tonkatsu and Juiciest Large Ocean Prawns in all of Tokyo. Best Value , Food Quality, Service & Atmosphere.  Better than many Michelin rated Restaurants in Tokyo.","The salted plum sauce pork loin katsu set is where it is at! I also really enjoyed their pickled seasonal vegetables! Highly recommended if you are in the area!","amazing interior design, this restaurant reminds me of traditional japanese houses. have have booth seats and zashiki (tatami flooring) …","the side dish and pickles are actually good. the fried pock chop not the best I ever had. Just try if you drop by.","Best tonkatsu I have ever had. Also, the salad is amazing. I think we had 3 bowls.","Deep Fried Minced Shrimp Cutlet","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Pork Loin Cutlet","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥2,000–3,000","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service…","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This traditional Japanese tonkatsu restaurant is a hidden gem that serves delicious dishes. The staff is friendly and the decor is stunning, with a unique Japanese atmosphere. The portions are generous and the meat quality is excellent. The shrimp tempura is impressively large, and the ebi katsu teishoku set meal is a must-try. The set meal includes a variety of dishes, including salad, pickles, rice, and soup. The rice can be upgraded to flavored shiso rice, which is a nice touch. The tonkatsu is outstanding, and the shiso rice is a highlight of the meal."

Name: Izumo Ikebukuro
Address: 1 Chome-13-7 Nishiikebukuro, Toshima City, Tokyo 171-0021, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 231 reviews","4 stars, 149 reviews","3 stars, 94 reviews","2 stars, 25 reviews","1 stars, 61 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Friday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Monday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u201311 pm"]
Reviews:
["Nestled in the heart of the city, this Japanese izakaya restaurant offers a culinary journey that delights the senses in every way. From the moment you step inside, you're enveloped in a warm and inviting ambiance The dim lighting and traditional décor create the perfect setting for an unforgettable dining experience.

Their eel dish is a standout, boasting tender, succulent pieces of grilled eel glazed in a mouthwatering sauce that dances on the palate. Each bite is a symphony of flavors that leaves you craving more.

Overall, this izakaya restaurant is a hidden gem that combines delicious food, impeccable service, and a charming ambiance to create an unforgettable dining experience. Whether you're enjoying a meal with friends or celebrating a special occasion, this restaurant is sure to leave a lasting impression.","Ordered unagi with the egg omelette.
The unagi is very fresh and well cooked.
The omelette is a little salty that’s amazing with the unagi that’s with heavy soy sauce.
The skin is great that is tender.
The rice is well cooked but not much fragrance.
The fresh bell pepper is good to go as a cold dish that help to relief the heaviness.
The beef slices are overcooked. Had the strong onion taste.
The shop owner is very cute and very busy.","Had signature huge eel and rice bowl. It was tasty but portion was too much especially rice. You can take smaller portions of rice if you not sure if you eat all. Also had cold Jasmin tea.
Place have really nice vibe. Especially in the toilet there are interesting, old Japanese drawings.
Recommend this place if you’re nearby, need to comeback here to try different dishes.","An absolute gem. It’s an izakaya with all the izakaya goodies but it also serves a really good unagi. You can get the unagi several different ways, but I opted for the beef and unagidon. It was outstanding and I enjoyed every bite. The vibe is laid back, the staff friendly, and the service fast. I will certainly be back and suggest you stop by if you get a chance.","Honestly, is just food for IG. Package eel with omelette with flavor rice. It was ok but nothing crazy. One of those looks better than it taste. Keep in mind the default rice is 700g, we had 400g for 2 ppl and barely finished it. Ask for 200/300g per person would be good. Other than that, yakitori was great. Tiny little spot","Value for money, and deceptively filling, you'll definitely satisfy your wallet and tummy when you dine here. Amazing flavours and wonderfully cooked, the unagi is undoubtedly the star of the dish. Can't fault the fluffy egg too. A great meal indeed.","The food was nice. I'm not a big eater myself, so I only ordered the smallest option available, which was without the tamagoyaki. The eel was of good quality and marinated perfectly, not under or overdone, the right flavour. The rice was …","Incredible food and friendly service! It was very easy to order through their online system which also shows photos. The food was fresh and made to order!","Nice cozy environment serving up unagi specialised dishes. I tried the unagi tamadon and it’s delicious af.","Food was pretty good. But it's very smokey inside from the lack of air circulation","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","¥3,000–4,000","¥8,000–9,000","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Breakfast","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 5","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This Japanese izakaya restaurant offers a delicious dining experience with its warm and inviting ambiance. The eel dish is a standout, with tender and succulent pieces of grilled eel glazed in a mouthwatering sauce. Other popular dishes include unagi with egg omelette, beef slices, and rice, as well as cold dishes like bell peppers. The restaurant also serves yakitori and has a great selection of traditional Japanese desserts. Many customers praise the restaurant's friendly service, cozy atmosphere, and value for money."

Name: Godaime Hanayama Udon Ginza
Address: 3 Chome-14-13 Ginza, Chuo City, Tokyo 104-0061, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 866 reviews","4 stars, 549 reviews","3 stars, 211 reviews","2 stars, 57 reviews","1 stars, 83 reviews"]
Reviews:
["My hotel was close by and there was a long line that starts an hour before they open. I can’t stand and wait an hour for a restaurant but it was raining and the line wasn’t too crazy so I waited about 15 mins and tried it out. The flat udon noodles were the first time for me.  It was like a udon version of pappardelle pasta.  Super yummy and I could’ve ate 2 bowls for sure.  The other side dishes / appetizers was not worth the extra carbs or special in any way but the noodles were worth the 15 - 20 mins wait.  I recommend trying them if the line is not too crazy","Wow, this place was awesome. The noodles were awesome.  The over-an-hout wait was not so awesome. The two sauces were great, one sesame and one dark one. The sets were interesting with tempura and beef etc. I wish I didn't have to wait to eat there again.","Lined up 45 mins before opening and another 45 mins for first round of seats to open up again. Overall the food and service were wonderful. This restaurant specializes in wide-cut noodles (hot or cold). Would recommend if you have time for the wait!","The udon is so great and special but the wait time is unbelievable. I arrived right on their finer opening time 5:30pm and you can see the line, I finally got seated on 7:15pm. So plan your visit if you want to taste the new way of eating udon! 😁","We tried many foods here, really tasty. The noodle is cold and chewy, and the two sauces, especially the Tahini, taste very fragrant. We love it! The service is so good to feel like home. But it will spent quite time for dining after 6pm.","Flat el dente udon noodles were different than the traditional udon. Worth a try but the wait can be long. There is a sign informing customer that the wait time is approx 1 hr from this point. U can decide whether to wait or not to wait","Excellent food! Service was good too. Prepare to queue for about an hour and this place is very popular.

The flat noodles were good, but I liked the "normal" udon noodles more. The tempura was cooked right. :)

IMHO worth the wait.","The Oni set was prepared perfectly from the texture of the flat udon, to the balance of flavours within the broth. It was easily the best udon I've experienced. …","Delicious udon both flat one and regular one! It's totally worth the wait!.

We arrived by 5:15ish, waited for a bit more than an hour, kids love it!","Good things come to those who wait… (for nearly two hours).

Assuming you and your companions are mentally prepared to wait your turn outside …","Noodles, Cold Udon with Soy Dipping Sauce, Assorted Tempura","Noodles, Cold Udon with Soy Dipping Sauce, Curry Udon","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥4,000–5,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This popular restaurant serves delicious flat udon noodles with two tasty sauces, a sesame and a dark one. The noodles are like a udon version of pappardelle pasta and are super yummy. The other side dishes were not impressive, but the noodles were worth the 15-20 minute wait. If you're willing to wait, it's a great place to try their unique udon dishes, such as the sets with tempura and beef. Many diners loved the noodles, calling them cold and chewy, and the service was excellent, making them feel at home. Some people found the wait too long, especially after 6pm, but many thought it was worth the wait."

Name: STABLER Shimokitazawa Meatsand 2nd
Address: Japan, 155-0031 Tokyo, Setagaya City, Kitazawa, 3 Chome1920 reload2-8
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 46 reviews","4 stars, 28 reviews","3 stars, 26 reviews","2 stars, 6 reviews","1 stars, 9 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20138 pm"]
Reviews:
["Really lovely shop with cool decoration and great atmosphere in general. The food looked amazing and was quickly prepared fresh after ordering. Can even watch the boxing training, great location.

With much anticipation I took the first bite, only to find it was extremely chewy beef which I don't like at all. Some pieces were so bad that I had to remove them from the sandwiches. Couldn't even take a bite from the pieces, had to hold it with my teeth and then rip it apart with my fingers. Only one small piece of meat was good.

That's why I usually avoid beef, but the reviews and pictures tempted me to try this shop. Turns out this was a mistake and I will stay away from beef for a while again..","Firstly, it’s not a cheap sandwich! But the sandwich is great, the meat is clearly a good one. Ordered the small one and it’s a good enough for me. The overall vibe of the restaurant is good and it’s located in a newly built-complex, there are lots of nice stores.","Was not attended to at the outlet nearest to the station. Went to the 2nd outlet. Chunky meat. Mediocre service. Meal was 1800 yen wrongly charged 3700 yen. When i enquire in English. The female cashier just walked away for the male staff to handle.","Big and yummy sandwiches! Went during a rainy weekday and had the whole place ourselves, nice. Beef steaks needed a bit strong chewing. Bread toasted to a crispy outside but still soft inside. Runny eggs soft and pretty fresh. Enjoyed a nice lunch.","The sandwich was amazing, the meat was juicy and tender, the mustard sauce was also delicious. I also liked the way the shop is decorated and the waiters were very kind. I'm very happy I found this place, I will go back for sure!","300g steak sandwich is amazing. the meat is well cooked. Soft, juicy, cut in smaller pieces what makes it easy to eat.
However, be prepared to smell like your sandwich after you leave the restaurant :))","Overall decent sandwiches but slighty overpriced (Cajun and Stabler) $1450 and $1850 yen (300g larger portion).  Great store/area in Shimokitazawa.","Meat sandwich is so good. If you order for takeaway, you will get discount 100yen to 1750 yen for meat 300g","Visited this cute American-style bistro and tried their famous steak sandwich and fried oyster sandwich. …","Disappointed. It wasn’t so good especially the bread, and the meat was too chewy, wasn't juicy","Egg Sandwich, Meat Sand","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 2","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 5","Food: 1","Food: 2","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This shop has a unique atmosphere with a cool decoration and friendly service. The dishes seem great, especially the sandwiches. The meat is usually juicy and tender, but sometimes can be too chewy. The price is a bit high, but the atmosphere and the sandwiches are worth it."

Name: Stabler Shimokitazawa Meatsand
Address: 2 Chome-12-15 Kitazawa, Setagaya City, Tokyo 155-0031, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 63 reviews","4 stars, 51 reviews","3 stars, 26 reviews","2 stars, 25 reviews","1 stars, 46 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20138 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20138 pm"]
Reviews:
["The worst food I have eaten at Tokyo so far. Look interesting and very meaty, however, the meat was too thick and wasn't chewable at all. Couldn't finish the sandwich.

The staff was rude. It says ¥100 off on takeaway at front but was charged full and when I asked, simply replied that the promo ended. I saw him put out a sticker on that sign after when passing by after a while.

As soon as I ordered on take-away and paid, I felt like being chased out immediately while there wasn't anyone inside at all. I didn't mind since it was on takeaway but the staff can be more polite to ask.

Also as it was ready, it was passed to us and we were being ask to go. There was a sign no eating there at outside seat.

Never come back here anymore.","When I walked in at about 7:30. I was asked to have my meal as takeout. I was able to have it as dine-in after telling the cashier that I was going to eat fast. She was very accommodating. The double Shimokitazawa beef sandwich was very tasty. If you are looking for some protein, this is the place for you! It was very tasty with the added toppings of garlic and vegetables. I think one sandwich could be shared between two people, but I eagerly ate both halves. This was an awesome meal!","So so … instagram-able but unfortunately not more. It’s a standard beef sandwich that lacks flavor and is relatively hard to chew (tough meat). We were glad that we shared one. It’s not horrible but definitely not worth the hype. We were lucky that there was a free table when we arrived. After us a queue started. I would not like to queue for that sandwich.

If there is a queue and you really want to try their food - there is another store of them  a 5min walk away.","I had by far the worst food I have ever had in Japan and also the worst service.
The man at the checkout counter was rude as soon as we walked in the door for no reason at all.  The meat in the sandwich was not cooked, we chewed it for a long time like chewing gum and we couldn't eat half of it. I definitely don't recommend it.","Really love the food here. The sandwich was well-seasoned and not too buttery. Still crispy. The meat is the star ⭐️ We ordered the cajun and hot Mexican and I love both. Perfectly cooked, not too tough and chewy. I love the Cajun as it was …","A savory meat sandwich shop that is a must try. The delectable and tender beef sandwich, along with the creamy egg sandwich was perfect. Stabler has a very unique atmosphere representing retro American culture. There are only 8 seats if you …","A very enjoyable steak sandwich. I was a little gluttonous and went for the double, which was a lot of meat. It was really tasty though, with nicely seasoned meat and a mustard that went well with it. The bread is also good. 8 seats inside …","This place did not disappoint. After seeing it on Instagram I went with my friends after a long day in Shinokitazawa and the meat was amazing. It was a perfect sandwich, not overpriced, and the vibe was amazing all around","Should've trusted the negative reviews. I felt like I was an inconvenience to the man behind the counter by eating there. The meat was chewy and all you can taste is the mustard, as the beef had little to no flavour.","Meat isn't freshly cooked and stinks, taste is pretty vile, steak is extremely chewy as it's a very cheap cut I'm guessing beef cheeks. …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Sandwich","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "Some people loved the food at Tokyo, saying it was tasty with nice toppings like garlic and vegetables. They liked the double Shimokitazawa beef sandwich and thought it was worth trying. Others had a bad experience, saying the meat was tough and hard to chew, and the service was rude. Some people felt like they were being rushed out of the restaurant. However, many people loved the sandwich, saying it was well-seasoned and had great meat."

Name: TokyoFishermansWharf UOHIDE
Address: Japan, 150-0042 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Udagawacho, 356, Udagawa Shimoda Bldg., B1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 95 reviews","4 stars, 58 reviews","3 stars, 35 reviews","2 stars, 11 reviews","1 stars, 25 reviews"]
Reviews:
["The food was okay. Not that amazing but kind of interesting meal. Rice was too hard for Sushi / Donburi.

The worst thing was we were sitting at counter seats so we got a chance to see how they cook. I saw a chef eating left fish/rice on his finger several time and the climax was he linking salmon roe left on the spoon and place it back to the box that use to serve a customer. what a disgusting man. If you cook in the open kitchen like this be sure to behave better than now.

I understand that in many restaurants there might be more disgusting action than this happend in the kitchen but now you are in front of customers dude!!!","Such a huge tourists trap.

They jacked up the price for the English menu, so it was extremely pricey.

Also maybe they naively think non-locals can’t differentiate the quality of sushi and sashimi, what they gave us were worse than what you can get in a supermarket in Europe.

They gave us two small bowls of soup (more like water, just like the 1st picture below with just two clams) that we did not order without saying anything, so we thought its free. Turned out they charged us about 700 yen for that.

The moral standard of this restaurant is such a shame for the Japanese people.","The sushi was very bad. Tasted bad, not fresh, and all stringy. Cut in all the wrong places. I was astonished that I was in a restaurant in Tokyo, the place was strange and I am still in shock at the taste and overall preparation of the sushi. I took a photo for proof.","Located not far from Shibuya’s famous Scramble Crossing. This place is fantastic for a traditional Japanese style meal.

I came for lunch and selected the 8 dishes option. The fish and seafood was fresh and each dish offered a variety of flavour.","Went there because of good Google comments. Bit over rated as the food quality was believed at fair / normal level only. Sashimi are not very fresh at all. Believed there are other better choice of restaurants at this price level.","Staff are friendly and helpful, manager can speak English well, if you are seated in the bar, you can see the chefs cooking in front of you. The atmosphere is great.","This restaurant was very popular so we made reservation online. The staff was very friendly, great vibe and good food. We will go there again next time.","Wandering around Shibuya late at night trying to find a meal - luckily I walked by here and it was still open for service. The food was happiness.","Beautifully presented meal with a nice assortment of food. Really enjoyed the atmosphere. Great and fast service 👍 …","Not a good experience due to the lack of skill of the staff with many errors in the order, even if they were kind. …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 1","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 4","Service: 2","Meal type","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Food: 1","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant in Tokyo has mixed reviews. Some people enjoyed their meals, especially the variety of flavors and freshness of the seafood. However, others were disappointed with the quality of the sushi, sashimi, and rice. Some even complained about unhygienic practices in the kitchen. The prices were also a concern, especially for the English menu. Despite some friendly staff, the restaurant's reputation was damaged by these issues. Some popular dishes mentioned include sushi, sashimi, donburi, and rice."

Name: Red Rock Harajuku
Address: Japan, 150-0001 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Jingumae, 3 Chome2512, Hulic Aoyama Building,
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,147 reviews","4 stars, 708 reviews","3 stars, 318 reviews","2 stars, 98 reviews","1 stars, 101 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11:30 am\u20139:30 pm","Friday, 11:30 am\u20139:30 pm","Saturday, 11:30 am\u20139:30 pm","Sunday, 11:30 am\u20139:30 pm","Monday, 11:30 am\u20139:30 pm","Tuesday, 11:30 am\u20139:30 pm","Wednesday, 11:30 am\u20139:30 pm"]
Reviews:
["Our second time to Red Rock. It’s still very good. I got the roast beef which is tasty, tender and flavorful bowl. The white sauce is good addition and wish they gave more. My wife got the steaks which looks tender, feels very tender with the fork but quite tough when biting in to the meat. Still very tasty dish.

Although I can’t shake the feel that it has become more of a fast food style restaurant and not as wow as our first visit in 2022. Our waitress was very nice but we didn’t really have any special requests.","Visited on a Sunday around 1:30PM. The line up was about 30 mins which was not too bad.  I ordered the roast beef donburi, and the beef was very tender. There was plenty of rice and mayonnaise so you should mix it very well as you are likely to run out of beef before rice.

At this price point, you get a very good deal in terns of portion and flavour. Pretty good place to grab a filling lunch.","Came here on the rainy morning just after opening hour, plenty of seats but soon after it gets very busy. Locate the basement along a small staircase, you can order at a kiosk machine just outside the door. Afterwards wait outside for the …","This place was recommended to me by someone I respect greatly. I am so glad that I took the time to go. Initially I was intimidated by the extensive wait to get in, but it was easy ordering at the kiosk (which you are supposed to do in …","Worth the queue! We chose a very filling and delicious sliced beef don, that comes with horseradish and an egg yolk. Reasonably priced for what you get at around ¥1000. You order at a kiosk outside the restaurant before you enter.","This a must of you are in there area! The roast beef bowls are to die for. Expect a bit of a wait when you are going around lunch time. Wasn't game enough to go the large one but saw people getting it and it looks phenomenal!","The steak bowl was okay. It was very soft, but the pepper was too overpowering. The taste is nothing special. Went in here just because of BTS Jimin and Jungkook.","can never go wrong with beef and rice.  rice with tender and juicy meat, topped with green onions is like match made in heaven.","**menu ordered: roasted beef don bowl ¥1,300

initially, i intended to order the roasted beef set, having had a fantastic …","There are relatively steep stairs to the entrance, and no alternative route. There is no wheelchair accessibility.","Ordered waygu beef don with miso soup. It is not bad, just average","Wheelchair accessibility","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Roast Beef Bowl","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Service…","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "Red Rock is a great place to grab a delicious and filling lunch. Their roast beef dishes are popular, with tender and flavorful meat, and tasty white sauce. Some dishes like the roast beef donburi and sliced beef don with horseradish and egg yolk are highly recommended. The service is usually good, but the atmosphere has changed a bit from the first visit. Overall, it's a great value for the price, with large portions and good flavors."

Name: Asakusa Unana
Address: 2 Chome-7-21 Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0032, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 280 reviews","4 stars, 160 reviews","3 stars, 91 reviews","2 stars, 13 reviews","1 stars, 18 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 9:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Friday, 9:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Saturday, 9:30 am\u20136:15 pm","Sunday, 9:30 am\u20136:15 pm","Monday, 9:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Tuesday, 9:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Wednesday, 9:30 am\u20135:30 pm"]
Reviews:
["Delicious Unagi with no frills attached.

Efficient que system with only 2 options. An eating area just a few meters down the track. Vending machine ordering

The 600yen option you can get straight away, but if you wanted more unagi in the box option - had to wait 30mins for that (you can comeback later for it)

Overall tasty and juicy unagi in a semi-fast food type setting.","Not worth it. I came here because of Paolo from Tokyo yt vid. The rice is not crispy and the unagi is quite plain of taste. The eating area is also a few shops further which was quite confusing at first. When I attended the eating area there was no one from this shop there — looks abandoned. It was just me and a few other customers","Came here based off recommendations online. Surprised there was no line, we just walked up to the counter and ordered. The worker directed us to the eating area which was just down the street. Unfortunately the unagi didn’t taste that fresh and neither did the rice. Overall, below expectations but at least we didn’t have to wait.","Delicious unagi! Very efficient ordering system where you line up to order and then they give you a time to come back to pickup your food. Great chance to find some other street snacks in between. Was personally greeted by the chef on food pickup which made it extra special.","The system is terrible! So be prepared to be patient and the staff are not kind either. With little to no directions on the system. Basically, you get a ticket from vending machine, then if you want to eat in or takeaway you still have to …","This store located near the famed sensoji temple specialises in eel (unagi) rice balls (onigiri). Order via the vending machine and there is a little wait at the time but occasionally if it’s too busy they will tell you to come back at a …","Walked to a small little shop that sells Unami onigiri (eel rice ball). Planned the morning as snacks Sunday after our morning coffee. Just bought one to share. A nice piece of unagi together with the onigiri.  Quite nice.","Delicious unagi! I remember the sauce was also great. Super popular spot so had to wait ~30 mins for our order but there was a virtual queue system in place so could pick up the order within the estimated time slot.","The eel rice ball was good, but the pictures make it seem bigger than it is in reality. You can easily palm the whole ball. We luckily came when there was no line.","MAR 2024

The line wasn't long when I went to order the unagi rice ball. After ordering …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 5","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Meal type","Breakfast","¥1–1,000","Food: 3","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Brunch"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This eatery serves delicious unagi with no fancy atmosphere. You can order and pick up your food quickly, or wait a bit longer for more unagi. The rice is not crispy and the unagi is plain tasting. The eating area is a short walk down the street, but sometimes the staff is unfriendly and the system can be confusing. You can also find other street snacks while waiting. Some people loved the unagi and sauce, while others thought it was just okay. The eel rice balls are good, but look smaller than expected."

Name: Kaiten Sushi Toriton
Address: Japan, 131-0045 Tokyo, Sumida City, Oshiage, 1 Chome12 6F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,027 reviews","4 stars, 688 reviews","3 stars, 236 reviews","2 stars, 84 reviews","1 stars, 62 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20139:30 pm"]
Reviews:
["This is one of the better conveyer sushi places, where the sushi is (mostly) made to order. The quality is very good, especially the seasonal menus are great. There is usually a queue even on a weekday unless you line up before opening time (11am). They don’t take reservations and you have to take a number for the queue. If you have the “line” messaging app you can get notifications when your number gets called, so you don’t have to stay in the area when the wait is too long. In my experience, on weekdays the wait was around 30min, but on a holiday evening I have waited almost 3 hours. I think this place is worth the wait but if you don’t like waiting, there are other sushi restaurants of similar quality in the area and Kinshicho that are usually half empty.","Came across this sushi joint because we wanted to and were craving sushi. There was an hour wait at around 1pm + so our expectations were pretty high!
In summary, really fresh and thick cuts of sashimi! Service staff were attentive but not hovering. ( which we introverts love )
Would highly recommend if u like fresh sashimi but do take note of the wait and it is considerably more expensive. ( we paid 7500 yen for 22 premium plates. )","First time here and had to wait about two and a half hour to get in to Kaiten Sushi Toriton, didn’t realize this restaurant was that popular. After eating 20dishes worth, now I know why. And once again the sushi/sashimi is extremely fresh and tasty here in Tokyo Japan. Bonus, only about $81.00 Canadian, what a bargain!!! This amount of food in Vancouver would easily be $150.00. Highly recommended if you can wait the wait…","No1 turning sushi in Hokkaiddo, this is 1 of their 2 Tokyo branch.
Waiting time was 80mins on weekday dinner and up to 4hrs on weekends..

Very fresh and generous cuts! Chefs prepare orders while saying out loud the delicious items they are preparing helps create a very buzzling atmosphere~~","Sushi is excellent and very fresh. Very well prepare, it is slightly more expensive than normal sushi train resturant such as Kara, but the quality here is top node and very much better. Highly recommended to order scallops here. Super yummie.","Nice sushi restaurant! They welcomed us strongly just like the Japanese way. Sushi is really fresh and nice quality. There are really many kinds of sushi so you can have fun to select what to order. I tried various sushi. My recommendations …","One of the best meals during my Japan trip ! We had to wait ~80 mins for our table but definitely worth it. The restaurant is in a cute mall so we just walked around in the shops while waiting. You can order plates using an iPad (not a ton …","Got food poisoning and the sushi did not even revolve, which would’ve been fine but they advertise it as such and there is always such a long line simply for that aspect.","Picked the ticket at 15:00. Was able to enter at 19:30. Make sure you have something else to do. You can monitor the queue online though. Located 6F in the Skytree. …","The conveyor belt here had no food on it, but that doesn't stop you from ordering on the tablet. The food is good! I liked the wide selection of options.","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥5,000–6,000","¥4,000–5,000","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner"," More","Rolls","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This place serves high-quality conveyor belt sushi with many seasonal options. The sushi is usually made to order, and the fresh sashimi is a highlight. You can expect to wait a bit, around 30 minutes on weekdays and up to 4 hours on weekends, but it's worth it. They have a wide selection of sushi dishes, including premium plates with scallops that are highly recommended. With prices ranging from ¥3,000 to ¥6,000 per person, it's a bit more expensive than usual, but the quality makes it worth it."

Name: Burger PRINCE
Address: Japan, 150-0047 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Kamiyamacho, 1110  1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 101 reviews","4 stars, 20 reviews","3 stars, 9 reviews","2 stars, 2 reviews","1 stars, 4 reviews"]
Reviews:
["2 words: Luxury burger

Those craving for a good juicy burger, would find pleasure here. Ordered the one that comes with truffles, it was a feast for the eyes when the chef comes and shave the truffle right infront of you unto the burger.

First bite into the burger, burst of flavours accompanied by the fragance of the truffles. Decadence in its finest.

The fries/chips were crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside. Simple sides done to perfection.

The only drawback is the long walk from Shibuya Station, and the hot sun wasn’t helpful either. Fortunately when we reached, there was no queue at all since it’s well hidden in the residential area.","I wanted to try the Fried Shrimp Croquette Burger with Caviar. The caviar is just the right amount for one person, and you can put it on the burger or taste it as it is. For 25 euros (current exchange rate) it is worth a try, there are VIP seats (partitioned by curtains) and I guess celebrities come here. The tables are cheap, the restroom is tiny and the stairs suddenly appear when you open the entrance door, making it a bit inconvenient. I guess it can’t be helped that it is on a back street in center of Tokyo. The staff is friendly, and even if you come alone, you will feel relaxed and enjoy your meal.","Absolutely stunning service and food all the way from walking into the restaurant to leaving at the end of a perfect meal.

You'd think a truffle burger would be overwhelming but I urge you to come try it once and you'll be thinking about this meal at least once a week for the rest of your life.

Innovative, yet simply perfectly executed food makes this a 10/10. I can't wait to come back soon.","Great wagyu beef burger. I ordered the version without the BBQ sauce as I prefer to taste the beef; the taste was excellent. I was also able to order medium rare and the cooking was pretty good. Fries were also crispy and tasty (although a bit too salty). Ambiance is smooth and elegant. Dessert was also delicious. Bravo!","Incredible food (we had the tuna tartare with the truffle and foie gras burgers) and with great service by a very kind and inspired chef. I've had many burgers in Tokyo and abroad and this is simply the best in my opinion. Beer with Tangerine was also great and fries were on the same level as the burgers.","Can we give more than 5 stars!? Everything was wonderful! Hamburger's bread, fries and zucchini were so crunchy but also tender inside. Moreover, a wonderful patty of wagyu beef, so tasty! Such a surprise! Finally, the host was friendly and very welcoming!","Best burgers ever, I stayed in Tokyo for almost 2 weeks and I ate here 3 times. Incredibly tasty appetisers too and the chef is not only talented but also very kind and friendly: my girlfriend is vegetarian and she was with me on the first …","This this a place that worth to try it out when visiting Tokyo!
I don’t normally eat burger and chicken liver, but the burger and chicken liver brûlée is amazing! Love it!","I had the classic burger plus cheese and the fries drink set for lunch.

The bbq sauce was really good probably one of the best I’ve ever had. I couldn’t …","I'll be dreaming of this meal for a long time. The moody and elegantly understated decor sets the tone for a truly special eating experience. …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","キャビアシュリンプバーガー","Atmosphere: 5","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "The restaurant serves luxurious burgers, including one with truffles that's a feast for the eyes and taste buds. The fries are crispy and fluffy, and the sides are done perfectly. The burgers are decadent and flavorful, with toppings like truffles, caviar, and even foie gras. The service is friendly and top-notch, making it a 10/10 experience. Diners can also try innovative dishes like tuna tartare, burgers with zucchini and wagyu beef, and even a veggie option."

Name: Udon Shin
Address: Japan, 151-0053 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Yoyogi, 2 Chome2016  F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 2,123 reviews","4 stars, 965 reviews","3 stars, 535 reviews","2 stars, 214 reviews","1 stars, 273 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Friday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Monday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u201310 pm"]
Reviews:
["Visited this place on July 2024 attracted from the many positive customers reviews but my experience here was a letdown. We waited almost 1.5 hours as this place only have 12 seats and during peak period with tourist crowd it’s very hard find a spot quickly. Regardless the waiting time (that may be understandable for such places), the Udon quality and tempura preparation was not so great, I did eat many other Udon here in Tokyo and this was just average. Moreover, this place does not accept credit cards and any electronic payment - please make sure to have some cash with you otherwise you will be stuck here. It’s a shame not accepting credit card in 2024, especially in a restaurant located in the Tokyo city centre. As a last downside, the prices are very high compared to similar options.

Overall, I do not suggest this place - strongly recommend to find alternative options!","It’s good but way too overrated!

I heard so many great things about udonshin so I wanted to try for so long, luckily the day I went the queue was short so I get in pretty fast.

Once I got in, one of the staff trip and drop hot soup over my shirt and then he didn’t even apologize or offer help. The staff just brushed it off like nothing happened. Hmm… not the best service mind in my opinion.

I ordered the cold udon with beef and yuzu. Overall it tasted nice and the udon was cooked perfectly but for almost 5000 JPY, I don’t think it worth that much money.

If the line is short, I might come back again but if the line is long, I wouldn’t bother queueing for it.","Man oh man, Udon Shin was well worth the wait. I tried to come last May but the wait was too long so I was so happy to learn that they started taking reservations!! We booked an early reservation at 6pm, but it was so amazing to just walk right in! We were seated at the counter and ordered 3 different noodles. The tempura bacon, cheese and egg was everything I hoped it to be! I’d gladly come back (if I could get another res)!

*Buy a t-shirt for memories of this incredible Udon spot!","I must say this is the best udon I have ever had before… the wait is very long since there is very little seating inside. The line you see outside the door is AFTER you received a text telling you to wait in line. We arrived, entered our names, received a ticket, waited for 30 minutes at the Family Mart on the corner, received a text, waited ANOTHER 30 minutes. Udon was delicious. I would do it again, but bring a stool to sit on in line.","Cold Udon noodles with shrimp & vegetable tempura . Get there , take a ticket and they will tell you via email when to come back. Was about a 60 minute wait. Well worth it. Very small and quaint inside . They take your order outside and your food is almost waiting for you once you sit down. Would recommend","They only have 12 seats total so seating comes in waves. As a solo diner, I waited 2 hours from 12:30-2:30pm on a weekday. I appreciate the staff who show you how to utilize the queue system. If your wait is more than an hour, I would …","Really enjoyed the food here, carbonara udon lived up to its hype, but still not worth the queueing time. Queueing system can be improved. We got the ticket from the machine around 19:30 and then left to walk around. Received the …","Had the udon noodles + butter + pepper + soft boiled egg + seasoned cod roe and the takamura collaboration special dipping noodles (upgrade) with pork and soft boiled egg tempura. …","So worth the wait. The udon is so soft. Remember to get there before they open and get a ticket to be in line. We reached right when they opened (11AM) and had a 30 minute wait.","Tip:
1) Get a queue ticket via the machine located outside the doorstep.
2) Register your email/line account using the QR code from the ticket so that …","Bacon Tempura, Noodles, Soup","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","¥4,000–5,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Noodles","Food: 3","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "I visited Udon Shin after hearing great things, but my experience was a letdown. The place is small with only 12 seats and the waiting time was almost 1.5 hours, which I could understand for a popular spot like this. However, the Udon quality and tempura preparation were just average, not great. It's a shame they don't accept credit cards or electronic payment, so make sure to have cash with you. The prices were also very high compared to similar options. I wouldn't recommend this place and would suggest finding alternative options."

Name: Katsudon-ya Zuicho
Address: Japan, 150-0042 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Udagawacho, 4126
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,002 reviews","4 stars, 388 reviews","3 stars, 151 reviews","2 stars, 50 reviews","1 stars, 43 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11:30 am\u20136 pm","Friday, 11:30 am\u20136 pm","Saturday, 11:30 am\u20138 pm","Sunday, Closed","Monday, 11:30 am\u20136 pm","Tuesday, 11:30 am\u20136 pm","Wednesday, 11:30 am\u20136 pm"]
Reviews:
["Came here because of the great ratings and it didn’t disappoint! Despite waiting in line for 25+ minutes in the rain, I was pleased with how the staff kept the line so organized and running efficiently. We were told how the line operated and placed our order outside with a kind man prior to entering. They present you with an English menu if needed. Once inside, you’re seated at 1 of 8!bar chairs and quickly served your dishes. The one dish they offer of Katsudon over scrambled eggs and mouthwatering soy soaked rice was divine. Truly, one of my favorite meals in Tokyo and so well priced! I’ll definitely make a point to stop by again whenever in town.

Pros: incredibly well priced & delicious food
Cons: always a line & Cash 💴 only","This got recommended to me quite a bit so was definitely on the top of my list when I went to Tokyo! And boy did it hit the mark! Such a well prepared and flavorful dish! Paired with a nice broth, beer and tea 👌🏼

Also our first counter dining experience which was just lovely.

They seat around 8 people and there's usually a line. We were there at around 12:30 and were able to put our name down so we could come back at 14;50. Which turned into 15:10.

Worth the wait though!","It was a really good bowl of Katsudon, especially the sauce was great. The seating was squeezy but it was a quick meal so it’s okay. I went at 1130am and waited for a few minutes to register our name with the friendly staff to come back at 12.30pm. We walked around abit before we came back and waited another 10min or so before we entered and the food was served almost immediately. It was a good queueing system as we did not wait long there under the sun.","The queue is usually quite long, but once they come to take the “reservation” and you tell them the time and how many people there are, you can leave and come back later. For me it was a little over an hour and a half
While reserving they ask you for the size (only the amount of rice will change), if you want extra egg, and if you want a beer
Then you spend around 10 minutes eating but it’s very delicious!","Highly recommend to have dinner/lunch here at 3:30p.m, then you don’t have to wait too long (I got there by 3:30 and waited for 15m). Since all sizes have the same price, you should order the L one, the M size has really really little rice (same amount of meat to other sizes). About the food, it’s good but not really mind-blowing compared to 1500yen. Worth trying once but i’ll never come back again.","We showed up 20 minutes before opening and there was a line outside. A staff member came out and had us write our names down along with our orders and provided a time for us to come back (super efficient). Once we came back, we were seated …","March 2023: would’ve given them 5 stars in a heartbeat. This was my favourite meal from my entire trip, I came and willingly waited in line on two different days in a 5 day Tokyo trip. I was drooling thinking about this meal ever since I …","They do only one thing here but they do it perfectly. The pork is juicy and well seasoned and the sauce marries everything together perfectly. The whole meal tastes lovingly made and was one of the more homemade tasting things I had in …","Small restaurant with only pork katsu and egg don in the menu. There are only 6 or so seats, so there’s a line outside and you’ll have to get a time to come back, but the food is seriously good. Highly recommended!","Ate the katsudon on December 2023 and come back on April 2024 !
This is one of the best katsu ive ever eaten on Tokyo !
100 yen is paid in front if you want add egg and per bowl of katsudon is 1500 …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 3","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This small restaurant in Tokyo serves one dish only - Katsudon, a delicious combination of pork katsu, scrambled eggs, and soy-soaked rice. Despite the long lines, the staff is efficient and organized, and the seating is cozy. The dish is well-priced and absolutely divine, making it one of the favorite meals in Tokyo."

InputString: Hitsumabushi Bincho Tokyo Marunouchi Building Japan
Name: Hitsumabushi Bincho Tokyo Marunouchi Building
Address: Japan, 100-6306 Tokyo, Chiyoda City, Marunouchi, 2 Chome41, Marunouchi Building, 6F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 166 reviews","4 stars, 99 reviews","3 stars, 22 reviews","2 stars, 10 reviews","1 stars, 3 reviews"]
Reviews:
["We ordered Miyabi at lunch. This is the first time we have eel rice bowl in 3 different ways. The eels we had at other restaurants were covered with heavy sauce, but the eel here is light but tasty.

In addition, deep fried fish bones and eel liver are new to us and are very special and yummy!","Always a pleasure. I come here every time.im in Tokyo.

This time I was in a rush arrived 2pm, by the time food came I had to get it all down  before they rest at 2:30pm. Still worth it imo. Hitsumabushi is supposed to be enjoyed slowly but better than not.","Tried the 3/4 unagi Hitsumabashi set. Was tasty and eel was crispy, but there was too much skin on the eel vs meat for the price point. Might be a personal preference but this was much less juicy than other unagis I’ve tried in Tokyo. …","Highly recommended! Really delicious grilled eels. Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Wonderful three ways of eating. I enjoyed eating with the soup too. Really soothing.

Make sure to make reservations","Extremely generous portions of melt-in-your-mouth grilled eel, liver and bones.  A bit heavy on the sauce at times.  The Kaiseki probably should be shared.  Pleasant, attentive staff and a bright, clean location","I was definitely delighted to finally enjoy a great set meal.  Follow the 3 examples of enjoying the eel.  My first day in Tokyo and it's a great start.  I definitely recommend it 👌","My favorite unagi hitsumabushi style (nagoya style)
You first eat it as it is
Then eat with little bit of wasabi and crush it w rice and nori …","I booked a table in advanced and got a nice room!

Their service is really good and consult you for every possible add-on to make …","The best eel rice ever! Our must go every time in Japan. The eel is crispy and you can see the grilling at the shop.","Very amazing and tasty experience, first time in japan and first time trying it. I will come again for sure😍 …","上 ひつまぶし 鰻, Deep Fried Fish Bone, A Set Meal with Grilled Eel","Eel-Don, Grilled Eel","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","¥6,000–7,000","¥2,000–3,000","¥8,000–9,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "The reviewers loved Miyabi's eel rice bowl, which is unique because it's served in 3 different ways. The eel is light and tasty, and they enjoyed the deep-fried fish bones and eel liver. The grilled eel is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and it came with a delicious soup. The portions are generous, and the service is attentive. Many reviewers recommended this restaurant, especially for its unagi hitsumabushi style, which is a must-try. They also praised the atmosphere, which is bright and clean."

Name: Rokurinsha
Address: Japan, 100-0005 Tokyo, Chiyoda City, Marunouchi, 1 Chome91  B1
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,910 reviews","4 stars, 1,518 reviews","3 stars, 698 reviews","2 stars, 144 reviews","1 stars, 124 reviews"]
Reviews:
["As others have said, the style here is separate noodles to be mixed/dipped into the soup. The broth is fairly thick. Line up, and right before going in you order from a machine - just one noodle type, and options are for regular, large, XL etc sizes and some additional sides. Fairly straight forward.  It does not accept credit cards but does take IC cards (can tap). Pick up your paper tickets and hand it to the lady who will seat you. They will bring you your food in about 5min.  Not a lot of space, so if you have luggage or bags, you may want to store them in the paid lockers in the station first.","Two of us kept seeing a long queue for this store the 3 nights we were on this street
So we decided to queue for it . Best decision ever.

We ordered two Special dip noodles regular ¥1050, two special ( soft boiled onsen egg with a special spice mix) ¥200
I ordered extra seaweed (¥100)

Mixed the black ball (special paste) into the noodles , proceed to dip noodles in broth ,

We are from Singapore and discovered the store‘s Chilli paste and added it to the noodles for extra kick

Boy … we had a sure winner with the chilli !

Craving satisfied .
Must try !","We reached the restaurant on weekdays about 9am. There was a very long queue. Queue time about 45 minutes to get a table. Self ordering at the machine.

The tsuganmen (dry noodle) was way too salty to our liking. The noodle was not bouncy. The noodle was cold and should dip onto the warm soup. We noticed that the next table could ask for a refill of the soup, but when we requested, we were asked to order extra souo and pay at the machine. What a discrimstion against us tourists who didn't speak Japanese. 1 star","The place is very accessible at Tokyo station ramen street. The restaurant is not very big and there’s always a queue so is quite stressful to eat in there as you are afraid of hogging the table.

You have to wait in line until the staff calls you to order from the ticket machine before rejoining your queue again.

About the food. Portions are huge. The regular size is more like large size and the large is a mountain of noodles.

The Tsukemen tasted great. The soup ramen is passable. More details in my blog.","Jun 2024. Famished after Disney trip, reached here around 10pm, let's see what this packed restaurant offer.
They were generous with the ramen and I loved the pork slice. However, I felt the soup was a bit too salty.
You should use the apron they offer, the soup really would splatter.","Absolutely worth the 1-hour wait! I'm not one to enjoy waiting for food, but Rokurinsha's specialty dipping noodles are truly exceptional. The noodles were perfectly chewy and the dipping sauce/broth filled with umami flavor. A must-try for …","This place is located inside Tokyo Ramen Street. When we were there, there were a lot of people waiting in line for their ramen. We ordered the ramen (served cold) and ramen broth (served hot) and you needed to dip your noodles into the hot …","This restaurant came highly recommended and I had it marked in Google maps for months before coming to Tokyo and perchance we were in the area so I decided to follow the little green waypoint. It took a little bit to figure out that it was …","A famous tsukemen restaurant that is open from early in the morning at Tokyo Station. Even at 7:30am, there is a line of several people. This is the only restaurant that is open from early in the morning on Ramen Street at Tokyo Station. U …","Very popular and busy ramen place.  It’s not the typical ramen.  The ramen is cold and to be dipped into a hot and quite concentrated soup.  It tasted good overall but be prepared to line up for a while.","Ramen, Pork Broth, Special Dip Noodles","Dip Noodles, Special Dip Noodles","Recommended dishes","Ramen, Dip Noodles","Price per person","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 2","Atmosphere: 1","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 3","Service: 1","Meal type","Breakfast","¥1–1,000","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Food: 1","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This popular ramen restaurant in Tokyo Station's Ramen Street is a must-try. It's self-service, where you order from a machine and pick up your paper ticket. The noodles are separate from the soup, which you dip them into. We ordered the special dip noodles, which came with soft-boiled eggs and a special spice mix. We added seaweed and chilli paste to make it extra delicious. The noodle size is huge, and the soup is thick and flavorful. The atmosphere is busy and stressful, but the food is exceptional."

Name: PATISSERIE TEN&
Address: 1 Chome-7-1 Uchisaiwaicho, Chiyoda City, Tokyo 100-0011, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 238 reviews","4 stars, 68 reviews","3 stars, 31 reviews","2 stars, 10 reviews","1 stars, 8 reviews"]
Reviews:
["Possibly the BEST choux cream puff in Tokyo. The choux is delicately thin but still firm and dry, not too moist so that it holds its shape in your fingers when you hold it up to take a bite.

As your teeth sink in you’re greeted by the scent of fresh vanilla as the abundance of delicately sweetened custard explodes out of the shell. This bliss is then interrupted by the realisation of another dimension to the puff with its crispy cookie shell that adds just the right amount of crisp to the soft custard and firm pastry.

The vanilla is most popular but I preferred the chocolate version which was just perfectly sweetened with a slight bitter after note that is just divine in how balanced it is. Just the right amount of sweet richness with a light hand that doesn’t ever make it too sickening for a second helping.","This is tucked away in some indoor complex under the rails.

The ambience feels high class which I guess warrants the high price.

I think this might be the best cream puff you'll ever have. It's extremely dense and the only downside is that each bite will squirt out filling from the bottom so make sure you don't eat in front of a laptop like I did.

However, the chocolate puff was quite average. I would recommend sticking with the original.","Overall an enjoyable dessert place. We have made reservations to try the dessert. The puffs are yummy and crispy. The parfait is an miniature assortment of what they make in house, it’s good if you want to try a bit of each.

The seating is for 1 hour. (We were promptly reminded that” it’s receipt time”). Time passes really fast so we felt like we need slightly more time if having 2 desserts each person (puff + parfait)","The on-site meals were limited to a single dessert option that didn't interest me, so I opted for takeout. In that case, you can eat at the outdoor tables. They offer some French sweets here, like cannelés, but especially cream puffs. These are large puffs, generously filled with delicious vanilla cream. It's a bit pricey, close to 800 yen, but it was so good! I wish I could find ones like that in France.","I seldom give 5 star rating but this pastry totally deserve it! Cream puff is full of fillings, you can see vanilla seeds and smell the fragrance. I prefer dessert which is less sweet and the puff is right on the spot ❤️
Takeout and dine-in offers different menu, dine-in is mostly set menu and at least order one drink. I got takeout and there’s plenty of outdoor seat right in front of it.","Best cream puff in Tokyo.

Thin puff pastry, with a nice crunch on the top and the filling is absolutely divine; velvety custard and right tinge of sweet and don’t miss out on a life changing piece of goodness here.

Only take out… take this amazing experience out (I have one too many puffs to know that this is out of the world).

To sit in, there is a separate menu.","I bought the cream puffs, financier and canele for take out. Everything tasted amazing 🤩💯
The cream puffs were the best I've ever had.

Do take note they do not accept cash payment!

The shop is located under the railway tracks, look out for signage to enter “Hibya Okuroji” 😬

Next time I would love to dine in instead!","more than full score💯
it's my second visit during my short 10-day trip....
The outside of the puff is crispy and is not too hard, crispy and fragrant
The filling is very full, fragrant, and creamy, but not too sweet.
The texture and taste match perfectly. really love it!
can't wait the next time to Tokyo.","Here, we've enjoyed amazingly delicious and beautiful plates! I usually drop in when I'd like to purchase a gift for important occasions, but if possible, please take a moment to taste the eat-in dessert to be cooked in front of you!
I definitely believe this is the best canele shop in Tokyo.","Cream puff is absolutely delightful.  Texture of crust is great and the filling is velvety smooth, generous, and full of real vanilla taste. Got it to takeaway (sat outside the shop) and price is slightly steep - 630 yen. However, still definitely worth a try.","A really popular puff place in the Taiwanese community. The puffs there were really delicious. The pastry was extremely crunchy and remained crunchy for a long time, even when not in the fridge. The puffs were fully filled with creamy …","A very unique take on the parfait and a taste that was worth the amount paid. The canelé is one of the best that I have had so far and the sit in experience was worth it as you watch them create the parfait step by step.","Now, it has always been said that japan is the place to find the best pastries.
