Having said pastries originated from France and Italy, but it is also possible that Japan can also rival the original makers of pastries. …","Truly a treasure trove of sweets underneath the track.
The set menu is about ¥4000, and completely worth it. They make it all directly in front of you. It includes a lemon or dragon fruit cream chocolate, fruit …","Staff was rude, puff was so so, over hyped esp for this price…. Do not recommend coming all the way to hibiya only for this puff. Plus the chef is going back to France in April, no point coming after that.","It is the world best cream puff indeed!!!!! You must try if you are in Tokyo!! I was there in 9pm but the skin of the puff was still crispy! The custard is just speechless.","Only outdoor sitting area, was a little hot in summer. The puff was $5USD/ piece but flavour didn’t disappoint at all.","The best puff I have tried ever. The custard sauce is extremely smooth, not too sweet or greasy inside of the puff.","The best cream puff ever.

Visited at 5pm on a Friday. There was a short queue at the takeout counter. The …","canele is amazing good
will get a box of it next time …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 2","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","¥1–1,000","Take out","Food: 5","Service","Dine in"," More","Other"]
AiReviewSummary: "This cream puff shop is considered to be possibly the best in Tokyo. The choux pastry is thin and crispy, and when you bite into it, you're greeted by the sweet and creamy custard filling. The vanilla flavor is the most popular, but I preferred the chocolate version, which was perfectly sweetened. The puffs are generous in size and filled to the brim with delicious vanilla cream. The place has a high-class atmosphere and is a bit pricey, but worth it."

Name: Chaka
Address: 31-7 Senjukotobukicho, Adachi City, Tokyo 120-0033, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 286 reviews","4 stars, 220 reviews","3 stars, 89 reviews","2 stars, 25 reviews","1 stars, 38 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 10 am\u20136 pm","Friday, 10 am\u20136 pm","Saturday, 10 am\u20136 pm","Sunday, 10 am\u20136 pm","Monday, Closed","Tuesday, Closed","Wednesday, 10 am\u20136 pm"]
Reviews:
["Nice pancake shop.
It's  a little tricky to get a reservation.
You must enter the web page one day before at 8pm or go the day you want to go to the shop. You can check Twitter also to know if there are Reservations available.
I say tricky because it can get pretty full really fast on weekends.
The pancakes are really nice. They the fluffy type, in short, merengue ones. So a little eggy flavor it's in there.
The toppings are simple but delicious.
They have drinks that you can order and they also sell scones.
The place is small so jot recommended for large groups or more than 4 people.  They have seats for 1 person. 😀
Nice place  to visit 😊","It serves great pancakes. The cake is fluffy and it has been well dressed. Overall it taste good. However, I can’t tell there’s big differences between Chaka and happy pancake. It may not be worthwhile if you have to spend up to an hour coming from city Tokyo to Kita-senju. Still, if you have been eating happy pancake for long and wanna try something new, Chaka is a good option.","🤤Taste- so good! The banana caramel pancakes had banana slices under the cream. The honey pepper comes with melted cheese on top, which was a nice pairing and meant that one was not overly sweet, and I could actually taste some egg flavor …","One of the cutest and lesser known to tourists pancake places! Very accomodation staff even though I dont know much japanese - no english menu and cash only! Very easy to translate and order and the staff were helpful :) just be nice! One …","Here is just a fraud store.

The staff over there instruct us to make a reservation through out internet, and …","Very fluffy, sweet and delicious🍎
Worth going if you like pancakes🍇
You need to make a reservation🍋 …","The taste is just right sweet, soft, and you'll love the taste.","Delicious pancakes, friendly staff. Reservation is required.","Homemade pancakes with good price. You need to book a table.","The Greatest pancake in Tokyo I have so far!","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥1,000–2,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Brunch"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This pancake shop is nice and serves fluffy pancakes, like merengue ones. They have simple but delicious toppings and you can order drinks and scones too. However, it's a small place and not suitable for big groups. The pancakes are tasty and well-dressed. They have nice original flavors, like banana caramel pancakes with banana slices and honey pepper with melted cheese. The staff is friendly, even if you don't speak Japanese, and the prices are good for the quality. The place isn't as famous as Happy Pancake, but it's a good option if you want to try something new."

Name: Onodera
Address: Japan, 104-0061 Tokyo, Chuo City, Ginza, 5 Chome1414 III 2F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 564 reviews","4 stars, 132 reviews","3 stars, 51 reviews","2 stars, 12 reviews","1 stars, 29 reviews"]
Reviews:
["From the careful selection of ingredients by the chef to the perfect pairing of sauces, each dish showcases their dedication and skill. Their food and service definitely deserves a five-star rating. The chefs are very friendly and can speak some English.
What impressed me the most was the monkfish liver (あんきも) from Yoichi, Hokkaido. It was absolutely delicious! Monkfish liver is considered a winter delicacy and is hard to find in the summer. Known for its rich flavor, this dish provided a unique and delightful taste experience that lingered long after, leaving me wanting another serving.","Perhaps the coolest, most special dinner experiences I’ve ever had.  The chef was incredible and personable.  Recommended a lovely sake for my girlfriend and I to drink with our food.

We decided to continue the meal with a couple more add-on courses.  He brought out some eel that was now in season.  It was tremendous.

Couldn’t recommend this restaurant more.","The 13-pieces Omakase lunch is a fantastic deal. All the dishes are fresh and delicious. It's awesome watching the talented chef in action. The timing between courses is spot on, with a personalized touch for each diner, and everything flows smoothly. And to top it off, the green tea pudding is a perfect way to end the meal.","Omakase course for lunch. One thing I could not really accept was the sushi rice kept falling apart. The taste was okay but not much to expect. Ingredients are fresh but nothing quite stands out. One thing earns the credit was the atmosphere. The AC was not powerful enough so it’s not airy inside.","Visited here with my wife and we LOVED this spot! It was high end but also a relaxed feel, and the sushi chef made you feel at home. He even took a picture with us at the end. Every dish and piece was delicious and the chef explained them in English as well. Highly recommend!","One of my best omakase experiences in Tokyo. A friend recommended this place and managed to get seats at 5pm. We didn’t feel rushed at all though the booking was a two hour slot. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Blown away by the food.","This place has multiple branches, and today I visited the main one in Ginza. I had to wait a bit even though I had made a reservation beforehand (don’t forget to reserve or you might miss out). Most diners here are tourists, so the staff …","My husband and I ordered the same omakase as the next chairs but obviously we were treated differently (I verified with the person next chair what kind of cuisine they selected). We sat on B/1 floor on 29 Jun. The master chef obviously …","Food was amazing, sake was beatiful, chef and staff were kind and humorous. The omakase was absolutely perfect. You should visit here if you want feel genuine Japanese gastronomy.","The booking system is foreigner-friendly; I was able to make a dinner reservation just three days in advance. The restaurant had plenty of seats available. …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥9,000–10,000","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "The restaurant impresses with its carefully selected ingredients and perfect pairing of sauces. The monkfish liver dish, a winter delicacy, is a highlight, with its rich flavor and unique taste experience. The omakase lunch course is a fantastic deal, with fresh and delicious dishes, and the green tea pudding is a perfect ending. The chef is personable, explaining dishes in English, and the atmosphere is high-end but relaxing. The service is friendly and accommodating, making it a highly recommended spot."

Name: Kaiten Sushi Ginza Onodera
Address: Japan, 150-0001 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Jingumae, 5 Chome16
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 442 reviews","4 stars, 289 reviews","3 stars, 184 reviews","2 stars, 65 reviews","1 stars, 71 reviews"]
Reviews:
["I’m more than happy to leave this review as it’s the best revolving sushi I had in Japan. The quality and seasoning of sushi is extraordinarily amazing, and with most seats facing the chef making sushi, it has no differences even compared to many omakase experiences.

Have visited twice and each time we enjoyed every bite of it. I’m a fan of shrimps and scallops while my girlfriend loves salmon belly and chu-toro. We are both satisfied for what we are offered over the counter! Incredibly fresh and tasty, it gives us taste beyond all previous impressions. I will strongly recommend 赤えび、ホタテ、車えび which are definitely fascinating. Not gonna lie but we actually took 50 dishes, gonna cancel our eating plans for the next 24 hours lolllll.

I’d also like to recommend the Chef’s choice three pieces. It costs only ¥1300 but serves as a delicious mystery box which you would not know until dish is in front of you. It’s a good choice to try those you wouldn’t risk to directly order, but will eventually broaden your choices. The two of us ordered 5 times of this mystery box, and it came out fascinating every single time.

The best time to come is from before it opens to 12:30 on weekdays, when there will not be a waiting line. Going for a dinner might be risky as the line is long and would take extra long time. It does offer the choice to notify through phone calls but not sure if foreign phone numbers would work.","We were craving sushi while shopping around Omotesando/Aoyama, so we decided to swing by. The line was out the door, so we hopped onto the virtual queue. We finally got seated after waiting nearly an hour, but it was totally worth it. We got seated in a back room away from the main dining hall, so it was more private and omakase style, instead of the conveyor belt sushi we were hoping for. Despite that, the sushi prepared was extremely fresh and high quality, and the menu had a large and varied selection. Halfway through our seating, one of the chefs carried in a whole amberjack fish on his shoulder. All diners at the time had the option to guess its weight, and the closest ones were able to get a free sushi of fresh amberjack. We got lucky and were rewarded 1 piece each.

Really had a great experience, and would highly recommend if you’re looking for a solid sushi spot. However, minus 1 star for the excessive wait time and slightly disordered queuing guidelines and process","Social media hype. This got to be the worse sushi I've ever had at any price range. The fish has so much tendon, I felt like I was chewing on a plastic bag. Rice was not cooked also. Everything felt extremely not fresh. I had better fish from local supermarkets. The seating was not comfortable and very cramped. Most customers were foreigners. All I see ppl busy posting on instagram. Save yourself some money and go to any local sushi restaurant and you'll have better quality food at the lower price and more comfortable atmosphere.","Extremely fresh seafood and tasty sushi served in Tokyo. This sushi restaurant was known for the Michelin Star which was given to the Ginza shop and it is very well known by the locals. In addition I would suggest that english translation be provided as I cannot understand what the chef was talking about when he was talking on the mic.","Freshly sliced if you’re having the raw stuff, great variety and efficient service. The place is able to cater to both sashimi and non sashimi eaters. I enjoyed myself even with my pickle sushis, chawanmushi, tempura scallop and karaage while my partner enjoyed himself with the variety of fish, squid, prawns etc.","We only waited for 15mins for line up during lunch time. It’s a very nice experience sitting in front of the chief and watching her making sushi that I just placed. They were more tasty than Midori ones. The private room dinning is a bit pricey than the ones in the public area.","Great sushi place ! My daughter recommended this sushi place for its freshness. It belongs to the same group that provides omakase dinner. We enjoyed our lunch as the food was excellent (sushi was full of freshness!), service was great and …","Just a stone's throw from Omote-Sando Station (or a short walk from Harajuku Station), Kaiten Sushi Ginza Onodera is a fancy/upscale conveyor belt sushi establishment.  They include some more exotic or luxury items on their menu. …","Delicious and fresh sushi, good location and the restaurant is very spacious and our seat was comfy! Sea urchin sushi platter is highly recommended","The best conveyer belt sushi in Tokyo! So fresh and yummy at affordable prices. Really quick service too.","茶碗蒸し, Bluefin Tuna, Fish","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 2","Atmosphere: 3","¥5,000–6,000","¥4,000–5,000","Service: 4","Service: 3","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 1","Food: 4","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This revolving sushi restaurant in Japan is a must-visit. With most seats facing the chef, it's like having an omakase experience. The quality and seasoning of sushi is amazing, and the freshness of seafood is incredibly high. The staff offers a variety of dishes, including shrimps, scallops, salmon belly, and chu-toro. The chef's choice three pieces is a great option, with a surprise each time. For a more private and unique experience, sit in the back room and watch the chefs prepare your meals. Recommended dishes include 赤えび (shrimp), ホタテ (scallop), and 車えび (shrimp), as well as the exclusive chef's choice three pieces for ¥1,300."

Reviews:
["■Ginza Onodera
■12/17 (Monday) Lunch
■Daily set meal 1,300 yen
We had lunch at Onodera, a Japanese restaurant.

The lunch menu is in the 1,000 yen range.

I ordered the daily set meal.
Today's dish is ``Oyster Yanagawa Nabe Gozen,'' which is perfect for a cold day.
A small bowl of dried daikon radish is also included.

Yanagawa hot pot topped with egg is filled with large oysters.

Dessert is almond tofu.

The rice was very delicious. You can get second helpings of rice.

There is also a private room that can be used for entertaining, making it quite relaxing.
Lunch is in the 1,000 yen range, so it's a high-end restaurant that costs over 10,000 yen for dinner, so it's highly satisfying, 3.5 stars.

★★★

Ginryokukan 7F, 6-12-14 Ginza, Chuo-ku, Tokyo
The location is here.
[Mon-Fri] 11:30-13:30 17:30-23:00
Closed on Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays","This is my second visit! It's definitely delicious! !
I highly recommend ordering to compare the tastes of sea urchin.
The craftsmen were friendly and talked to me, and the two hours went by quickly …","All good were prepared by the female owner. Sashimi and fish was fresh. Would be more exiting if there is any meat dish in the course.","This is my second visit, this time
I was asked by 3 people,
Just like last time, all the dishes have a gentle taste. …","I brought a foreigner with me. I was very pleased.
I was also very impressed with the care given by the landlady.","was delicious. A space with 😌. …","Bowl of rice topped with sashimi","Top notch food and hospitality","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Service: 4","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "We had lunch at Onodera, a Japanese restaurant, and ordered the daily set meal. The meal featured \"Oyster Yanagawa Nabe Gozen\", a hot pot filled with large oysters, served with egg and a small bowl of dried daikon radish. The rice was very delicious and you can get second helpings."

Name: Ginza Onodera Tempura
Address: Japan, 104-0061 Tokyo, Chuo City, Ginza, 8 Chome510  6F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 111 reviews","4 stars, 31 reviews","3 stars, 12 reviews","2 stars, 1 review","1 stars, 1 review"]
Reviews:
["We decided to spoil ourselves with a high end tempura experience for a special occasion. We found Onodera Namiki Dori after some research. It's the newer of two branches in Ginza. Located on the 6th floor of an unassuming building, once you go in, you're greeted with a very high end traditional Japanese setting. It's a small venue that can maybe sit max 10 to 12 customers.

We opted for dinner which is an omakase course. We also booked early (they open at 6pm for dinner service) and were very lucky to have the restaurant to ourselves for the first hour before the next guest arrived. This made it a truly memorable experience for us.

Suzuki-san, the head chef, was an absolute delight, taking the time to explain each dish and engage in small talk while effortlessly preparing and making each dish.

The quality and execution of each was immaculate. Even though many of the dishes were deep fried, we didn't feel as heavy by the end as one would think.

Would highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for high end tempura. Yes, it's pricey but worth the experience as you'll walk out having tried the best possible versions of tempura classics like prawn, mushrooms, eggplant but will have also tried tempura you'd likely never have before, ranging from unique fishes we had never had before to uni being wrapped in shiso and fried.

You'll need to book in advance and can do so online. Suzuki-san and his team all speak some English, which is great.

Also worth mentioning that the last dish before dessert was a true highlight, you get to pick how you want your kakiage. Believe there were 4 or 5 choices ranging from having it as a rice set to being set on top of soba noodles. We opted for ochazuke (rice with a tea-based dashi broth) which was sublime!","Had an absolutely wonderful experience here. I recommend making reservations due to limited seating and timeslots.

Manager and Sommelier Yuki Inoue was very friendly and informative (Spoke English). He helped suggest a few sake pairings that went well with the tempura omakase lineup.

Executive Chef Yuya Uchi and his team were exceptionally coordinated and did an excellent job delivering delicious tempura and informing us on how it should be eaten. The food was exceptional. The batter was light, hot, and crispy. The ingredients were fresh or prepared with care.

My wife and I could've kept to ourselves, and dinner would've been great, but we chose to engage with the staff, and our experience here was elevated. I would suggest that you also choose to engage with wonder and an open mind.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a fantastic and unique experience!","Wonderful dining experience with incredible tempura. The staff and chef were so friendly with my wife and our 3 children and they all had an incredible experience. We would recommend this to anyone coming to Tokyo. The tofu tempura and mushroom tempura were favorites. Thank you again!","Definitely one of the best tempura place in town.  The seafood and veggies is super fresh, especially the shrimp, as it was still alive.  The food was  served one at a time, cooking in from of you. Last but not least, the bowls and cups are so pretty.","I had a reservation at 11:30am on December 11, 2023, and it was the best meal and service we had in Japan during our family trip. The manager who greeted and hosted us was so kind, considerate, and attentive, and we were able to communicate …","This is one of the best restaurants I’ve been to in Tokyo. The most obvious thing is that the tempura dishes are the best I’ve tasted. Unlike others, the food isn’t oily, the coating is fresh and barely touches the underlying item. The chef …","a delicious tempura restaurant,  the food is so fresh!  The way that the chef handle the tempura is amazing, it is super crispy but not oily at all! Enjoy tonight dinner a lot and I will for sure come back again .","Love the tempura here.  I could taste the natural sweetness of the seafood. Not greasy at all. Atmosphere was relaxed and not overly formal. Chef was friendly and took pride in the food he made.","Great dinner experience here last week. We really enjoyed everything that was given to us. The atmosphere was very relaxing. Great sake and beer choices to go with our tempura omakase.","Famous restaurant offering very high quality tempura made right before your eyes. Expect ritualistic service and a meal priced on the high end.","Sea Urchin Tempura, Mushroom Tempura","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This high-end tempura restaurant, Onodera Namiki Dori, provides an exceptional dining experience. The omakase course we chose included tempura classics like prawn and mushrooms, as well as unique seafood and dishes like sea urchin wrapped in shiso leaves and fried. The batter was light and crispy, and the ingredients were always fresh. We enjoyed the interactive experience, watching the chef prepare each dish and engaging with the friendly staff. The atmosphere was elegant and traditional Japanese, with a small venue that felt intimate and exclusive."

Name: Makiyaki Ginza Onodera
Address: Japan, 104-0061 Tokyo, Chuo City, Ginza, 5 Chome1414 III 9
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 85 reviews","4 stars, 15 reviews","3 stars, 3 reviews","2 stars, 1 review","1 stars, 0 reviews"]
Reviews:
["Lunch was delicious and of good value. Many dishes have a fragrant wood-fire touch. Especially delicious were the wagyu bite, the hairtail fish (I would have preferred the sauce sour instead of sweet, but the fish was perfectly cooked), the clam ramen (deep yet delicate flavor) and the madeleine accompanied by tea roasted on the spot. Service was top-notched and the chefs were really friendly.","A great experience at this  Michelin Star restaurant. Food was exquisite and the service was spot on. The staff spoke a bit English and they did their best to entertain. The restaurant is on the 9th floor, but main room has no view - the main attraction is the open space kitchen and the cooking wood fire.  Great value for the food and service (in the context of Michelin restaurants).","The food, service & ambiance were all spectacular. The menu was unique and suited my palate perfectly. Every dish had a concept and purpose. I found all the dishes to be absolutely delicious. I have been lucky enough to sample many tasting menus over the years and I would say my overall experience at Makiyaki Ginza Onodera ranks amongst the top","We went for dinner and it was an amazing experience. Every part of the meal was so good that it was hard to pick my favorite course. I did the pairing with my meal and the pairings were exceptional. We will definitely be back the next time …","Dining theater! We got to watch the chefs make our meals at the fireplace in front of our faces. The small, dimly lit dining counter felt like we were at someone’s home and hearth. The food was classics that I would want to revisit again …","We went there for a dinner. The chef is nice and friendly and the food was so good. Flavour from the wood oven was just right. all the dishes were delicious and our favourite was the taro! Will definitely come back again!","This was one of the best meals we've ever had.

Every dish was delicious and thoughtful, the chef was a delight, and the intimate setting made it a special experience.

Truly five stars. Come and you won't regret it.","Great course menu experience and excellent wine list. Service staff, sommelier and the chefs are all extremely friendly. Love the flavour of dishes here.","With around ¥8000 (excluding the wine) you can enjoy a one-star Michelin French lunch. A very good deal. Full of passion and energy. Very worth trying.","Overall, this meal was disappointing. Our sous chef and staff were kind, attentive, and knowledgeable (and spoke english to us) …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Noodles","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This Michelin Star restaurant served delicious and good-value lunch with fragrant wood-fire touches. The wagyu bite, hairtail fish, clam ramen, and madeleine accompanied by tea roasted on the spot were especially delicious. The chefs were friendly, and the service was top-notch. Other dishes mentioned include wagyu bite, hairtail fish, clam ramen, and madeleine."

["Small cosy typically Japanese restaurants, clean , tidy  and comfortable
