Chef is serving very carefully without any oil spilled out and not allow any tiny a bit different presentation in between and rectify at once .
Reasonable price with great service , yummy food, simple and enjoyable.
Specially the toilet is small but functional and hygienic
Highly recommended this restaurant","Restaurant is placed on 4th floor. Elevator is small and smell inside is not very pleasant/food smell. Restaurant looks quiet nice. There are approx. 12 places around counter (maybe there are more other rooms but I haven't seen). I was alone and would like to eat dinner (at 7pm). I was told that the only option is to order menu 22.000 YPN per one person. Maybe dinner here is worth of it but I decided not to stay.","Amazing food. Chef would tell you which salt/sauce to go with. Friendly staff. Almost every staff speaks conversation-level English (understandable considering they pride themselves as a global chain). Lively atmosphere throughout the whole …","Was a lovely experience. It's a tiny place, seating maybe 8 people at the counter. The staff were all absolutely charming, every single course was delicious and delightfully presented. Not cheap, but when is quality ever cheap?","5.0 Divine experiences are rare and that is what you get when you come here. One of the best things about restaurants in Japan is specialization. It's an art form and here, they elevate Tempura to new heights. Outstanding","Incredible food. Delicious and incredibly fresh. Friendly service and outstanding quality. One of the best Restaurants I have been to in Tokyo.","I have tried a lot of high-end tempura restaurants, and the seafood ingredients here are really fresh. …","One of the most delicious Tempura restaurants in this area, lunch time is reasonable!","Good quality tempura. Particularly like the sweet potato and uni.","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Good quality","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This Japanese restaurant is cozy and clean with friendly staff who explain each dish in detail. The chef is very attentive and serves each course with care. Prices are reasonable for the great service and yummy food, although the only option for a solo dinner is a fixed menu for ¥22,000. The food is amazing, especially the tempura, and the staff speak English well. It's a small place, but the lively atmosphere makes up for it. Some reviewers found the prices high, but said it's worth it for the quality."

Name: Kaiten Sushi Ginza Onodera Kyoto
Address: Japan, 600-8021 Kyoto, Shimogyo Ward, Junpucho, 305, Shijo Kawaramachi Bld.,
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 636 reviews","4 stars, 190 reviews","3 stars, 66 reviews","2 stars, 18 reviews","1 stars, 33 reviews"]
Reviews: ["Seriously, just give this place a Michelin star. Kaiten Sushi Ginza Onodera Kyoto was definitely a highlight of my trip. Often, people say sushi is amazing in Japan. There is a stigma that conveyer belt sushi is cheap and average. This place served up some of the most amazing sushi any of us had to date. Compared to the fish market in Tokyo, this would be rated as number one. I can describe this place, but it would not do it justice. It is a must try and let their food speak for themselves. It is currently on the Michelin guide, and prices average 450 to 600 yen per plate. Both the service and atmosphere are amazing, no need for any improvement.","Really nice for a quick dine-in or extensive lunch/dinner, alone or with a group. The order process is straightforward and multiple languages are available. The staff is very kind if you need anything. The food allergies tables are very clear and extensive, which is nice. With two people we spend about 7000 Yen total, which is about 40 Euros.","Gorgeous sushi restaurant with fresh and delicious fish. Prices are from 500-990 yen per fish (can be 1-3 pieces of sashimi or 6 if a roll) but it felt very reasonable for quality and experience. We came on a Saturday at 13:30 and walked right in - no reservation. English menu easily available. Highly recommend!","Coming to Kaiten Sushi was a lovely and cool experience. The restaurant itself was quite fancy looking and you order your food on a tablet and then it came out on a conveyor belt. My favourite things were definitely the seared salmon and \u2026","This is a chain sushi restaurant from Ginza.   Its claim to fame is that it uses the same quality of ingredients as its flagship sushi restaurant.   You order from the tablet and they serve you the dishes from a conveyor belt.   So it is \u2026","During our recent three-week trip to Japan, we had the pleasure of dining at Kaiten Sushi Ginza Onodera Kyoto, and it quickly became our favorite sushi spot in the country. Our single visit to this restaurant was exceptional and left a \u2026","This is an upscale revolving sushi restaurant. The quantity is small and prices are high. I felt some of the items like the Nori and Uni were not that fresh as i fell sick after that. Service was very good.","Waited about 1 hour. The best I think it\u2019s the prawn sashimi, it tastes better than the New Zealand scampi. Absolutely amazing. Better go there earlier, because many items sold out early.","There was a wait here when we came at an off time (~8:30pm), but it was worth the 25 mins we waited. \u2026","Disgusting.\n\nThey served spoiled Uni. The waiter initially refused and said it\u0027s normal. The \u2026","Extensive allergy table available in the menu screen.","Limited vegan options and halal options not there","It is easy to access as it is on ground floor","Somewhat difficult to find parking","Fried Chicken, Sesame Ice Cream","Wheelchair accessibility","Dietary restrictions","Recommended dishes","Tuna, Octopus Legs","Vegetarian options","Price per person","A few items only","Paid parking lot","No valet parking","Kid-friendliness","Parking options","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Parking space","\u00A53,000\u20134,000","\u00A58,000\u20139,000","\u00A55,000\u20136,000","\u00A57,000\u20138,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Meal type","No issues","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Parking","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This wonderful sushi restaurant, Kaiten Sushi Ginza Onodera Kyoto, serves the most amazing sushi with fresh and delicious fish. Try their seared salmon and tuna sashimi, which were the highlights for many visitors. The service is excellent, and the atmosphere is very nice. You can order using a tablet, and the dishes come out on a conveyor belt. Prices are reasonable, ranging from 500 to 990 yen per piece of sashimi or rolled sushi."

Name: Tachigui Sushi Ginza Onodera
Address: 5 Chome-1-6 Jingumae, Shibuya City, Tokyo 150-0001, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 8 reviews","4 stars, 5 reviews","3 stars, 2 reviews","2 stars, 2 reviews","1 stars, 1 review"]
Reviews:
["I come here because it's close to my house, but...they order drinks in front of me...and they serve a lot of sushi before the drinks...

I don't look at the customers at all...I don't even talk to them...

In the end, I ordered conger eel and pudding...and the pudding came before the conger eel came out...but I still didn't care lol, even though I was watching it right in front of me...

Well, I guess they do business with foreign tourists.
Isn't it okay to do that?

I used to go there often in Hawaii...lol
Sushi and Teppanyaki...

Good luck to the Japanese staff who are so low-minded 👍
Sushi is only accepted around the world, but not you guys lol","4 is definitely not there. The price is reasonable, but it's only reasonable. If you want to fill your stomach with drinks included, you should be prepared to spend 10,000 yen, but you won't get the atmosphere of a high-end sushi restaurant.
The level is different from stores that sell for 15,000 to 20,000.
It's not rotating, so the signboard is also deceiving.","I like pleasant customer service!
I thought it was amazing that even the employees who were about to take a break didn't forget to provide hospitality even just before entering the employee space.

The cry roll really made me cry (lol)

I want to go again.","I visited a little early in the evening with my baby. The tables were all occupied, so I was thinking of having a quick meal at the counter and heading home, when the receptionist told me to go to a private room in the back as it was empty. …","There is a touch panel with numbered tickets at the entrance, and you can select either standing sushi or conveyor belt sushi and completing the registration process. It's nice to be able to leave the area and wait. I chose Tachibumi Sushi …","The Omotesando branch of the Ginza Onodera main store is structured so that if you go to the left from the entrance, you will find Kaiten Sushi, and if you go to the right, you will find Tachikui Sushi, two different stores in the same …","It was the best sushi experience of the year. About 3,500 yen for 10 pieces and red soup stock. I was more satisfied with this restaurant than BULLPEN in Togoshi Ginza.","The waiting time when I arrived at 11am on Saturday was over 30 minutes. Since the stay is short, you will be able to turn around more than you would expect.","There were a lot of foreigners on holidays, and there was a tuna butchering show.","It's not delicious at all. All the sashimi has tendons.","There is also information for vegetarians.","You can choose to remove the rice","Dietary restrictions","Vegetarian options","Price per person","Atmosphere: 3","¥9,000–10,000","Atmosphere: 5","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 1","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Food: 1…","Food: 3…","Food: 3","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "The reviewer visits a restaurant close to their home and finds the service lacking. They don't get attention from the staff and have to wait a long time for their food. The reviewer orders conger eel and pudding, but the pudding arrives before the main dish. Despite this, they seem to enjoy their meal and praise the friendly service. They also compare the restaurant to another high-end sushi place, BULLPEN, and find it to be more satisfying. Some dishes mentioned include sushi, conger eel, pudding, and red soup stock."

Name: Unagi Toku
Address: Japan, 150-0002 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Shibuya, 2 Chome211  6
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 84 reviews","4 stars, 107 reviews","3 stars, 63 reviews","2 stars, 20 reviews","1 stars, 25 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Friday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Monday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u201310 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u201310 pm"]
Reviews:
["When I was in Tokyo, I listed down all the type of food that I wanted to eat - shabu-shabu, ramen, sushi, etc - and unagi was one of them. To be honest, I hardly find any good restaurant in KL that serves good unagi due to the fact that most of them use local variety that has muddy taste in it. Since I was heading to Shibuya one evening, I found one in Unagi Toku located in the famous Shibuya Hikarie building, a few minutes walk from the Shibuya station.

It was still quite early for dinner so the restaurant was quite empty. Famis

I had to say that so far this is the best unagi I'd tasted in my life (read my life.. not yours). Famished but didn't want to stuff our stomach too much, we settled for one of their signature dishes and one basic dish.
◾Unagi Chazuke Tokujyou - costing 5200 yen, this set was meticulously prepared and beautifully presented in front of us. The grilled unagi was served together with the rice in wooden bucket. The instructions clearly stated that to enjoy the dish we must (1) taste the original taste of unagi first; (2) pair the unagi with shallot and wasabi, and lastly (3) pour the homemade tea into the rice bowl containing the unagi, shallot and wasabi and eat it Ochazuke style.
◾Shirayaki Gohan - simple lightly grilled unagi on rice with Japanese pickles and soup. Oh my god I simply love this as I could definitely taste the original flavour of the unagi without any marinade or flavouring. Just dip the unagi into their soy sauce and eat just like that.

The unagi was very tender and the sauce (from the set) tasted just right - not too sweet nor salty - price-wise just remember that this is Tokyo. Another food checked from my list.","Not the best hitsumabushi but definitely not the worst either (I'm a bit biased with Nagoya style of unagi). Keep in mind that it's on the expensive side. What I enjoyed here was the fluffy and juicy umaki (eel rolled omelette). Ambiance is good and service was exceptional. I will still come and dine here for the umaki and probably try other stuff on their menu.

Foodibear gives Unagi Toku a decent 4/5.","No waiting time. Staff was friendly and approachable. They’re used to tourists. So information on how to eat the Unagi comes in English, Chinese, Korean and French. Unagi was really soft and well worth its money! Can be abit boney for some, but the trick is to eat the Unagi in small bites. Worth its money for its quality!","Great unagi sets at a decent price! The best was the unagi chazuke set. This place takes a while to prepare the food, but it’s because they prepare everything almost from scratch, so you might end up waiting 30-40 minutes to get your food. …","Feels very bony compared to other places, not sure if this is because it wasn't grilled properly. Tasted pretty average, with the sauce on the lighter side. Quite expensive and the portion wasn't that big.","A nice lunch after walking all morning. Unagi is tasty and soft. You are able to order half portion of the unagi or the whole unagi. Service is prompt and polite. Overall a nice experience.","Portions are the same for both number 5,6
Whole meal was poorly put together
Tea wasn’t poured in some of our cups
Overall not worth the price","Unagi only. Not very customer friendly as they insisted everyone must order something.
Not a fan of unagi any way.","Every pieces of eel sticks were covered with burnt sauce and tasted awfully like charcoal, poor experience.","Very good and tasty grilled eel! The service was very polite and fast!","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 2","¥3,000–4,000","¥4,000–5,000","Service: 5","Service: 1","Meal type","Food: 4…","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 1","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "I recently visited Unagi Toku in Shibuya, Tokyo, and it was a highlight of my trip. The unagi or Japanese eel was cooked to perfection and served with a variety of dishes, including shabu-shabu and sushi. The unagi chazuke tokujyou, a signature dish, was beautifully presented with grilled unagi, rice, and tea, while the shirayaki gohan was a simple yet flavorful combination of lightly grilled unagi and Japanese pickles."

Name: Unagi Toku Ginza
Address: Japan, 104-0061 Tokyo, Chuo City, Ginza, 5 Chome21  11F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 80 reviews","4 stars, 78 reviews","3 stars, 48 reviews","2 stars, 6 reviews","1 stars, 13 reviews"]
Reviews:
["I recently dined at Unagi Toku and had the chance to try their unagi. Overall, it was a decent experience.

The unagi itself was well-prepared, with a nice texture and flavorful meat. However, the sauce was just okay – it lacked the depth and richness that I’ve enjoyed at other places. While the taste was decent, it didn’t quite stand out.

In summary, the unagi was good, but I've had better. If you’re in the area and craving unagi, it’s worth a try, but it may not be the most memorable dish you’ll have.","A very quiet restaurant. I was here on a weekday at 7pm and was the 2nd customer. Not sure why it wasn't more crowded because. the grilled unagi rice is really awesome. I swear I can have one more serving if I am not already that full","tokyo plaza ginza is nice but this unagi rice shop is not the greatest, the unagi is little bit burnt and smaller than the menu, staff was courteous but a bit hasty and forgot to serve my macha, hope can improve","The ochazuke set was delicious : adding tea to rice with the delicately cooked eel. One of the better eel restaurants in Tokyo. Slightly expensive but for the location, it’s not so bad.","This is probably the worst and most disappointing unagi meal. The unagi was overcooked and did not have good flavor. It is overpriced and incredibly disgusting food.","The unagi is melt in the mouth, and nice food  worth the price.  Service is ok, staff not so friendly tho","Tasty unagi and rice, but the miso soup and the Japanese pickles were quite bland for the price we paid.","Eel cooked in traditional style and you can have three ways to eat for one set of meal.","The quality of unagi is not good. The size of the unagi is small. Too many spikes.","The food is soooooooo good!
All spot on, one of best unagi dish in Tokyo …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 1","Atmosphere: 2","¥5,000–6,000","¥7,000–8,000","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 4","Service: 1","Service: 2","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 1","Food: 2","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant, Unagi Toku, serves good but not excellent unagi. The unagi's texture and flavor are decent, but the sauce is just okay. The grilled unagi rice is really tasty and can be served as one more helping if you're not full. The ochazuke set with delicately cooked eel is also delicious. Some customers had better experiences while some found the unagi overcooked or expensive."

Name: Unagi Toku Osaka
Address: Japan, 530-0001 Osaka, Kita Ward, Umeda, 3 Chome13 10F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 35 reviews","4 stars, 30 reviews","3 stars, 25 reviews","2 stars, 7 reviews","1 stars, 18 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Friday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Monday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u201311 pm"]
Reviews:
["I had an exceptional eel dish that was grilled to perfection. The outside was satisfyingly crunchy, creating a delightful contrast with the smooth, juicy interior. The crunchy layer wonderfully absorbed all the sauce, ensuring that each bite was bursting with flavor. This was sea eel, which was notably devoid of the sometimes off-putting taste that freshwater eel can have. Although it was on the pricier side, it was absolutely worth it for the quality of the dish and the excellent service. A truly memorable dining experience that I highly recommend.","Today is June 21,2024.A tall man around 18-30 years old takes a very bad service attitudes.we are foreigners, not Japanese. a)We want to ask a cup of tea, the man actually notice us, but ignoring our requests. He is racists.
b)we want to make sure what we ordered, he cannot understand, not try his best to listen,and reflect annoying attitudes.
He is only one person who gives us a bad and annoying attitudes in Japan

High price with bad attitudes.
Not recommend this restaurant.","Worst service ever experienced in Japan. We had a party of 2 with a 5 year old. And were told we need to order a main meal for each of the three. There was no menu option for kids, so we said no, we will be sharing with our 5 year old. We asked for additional condiments such as wasabi. And was told no, we cannot get any more.

No line and no line for a reason, don't expect good service or any above expectation for food.","We did not experience any of the bad services we saw on the reviews. We dine here also because, unlike all the other restaurants on the 10th floor, this one has no queue. We thot the food is expensive. But the lunch set ranges between 2200¥ …","We arrived at the restaurant a bit late, so many dishes were sold out except for the expensive ones. We still ordered expensive sets and expected to be served soon. However, we waited for 40 minutes for it to be ready. During this 40 …","The environment is nice with a view of the station. Not busy on Friday lunch time. The eel is thin with a "standard" taste. Service is kind of mechanical, if you need something you need to ask.","It’s nice with a window seat that allows us to observe the Umeda station. The food was just so-so. But no long queue to get a seat was a great reason why we stepped in.","Very delicious eel, must try it when you visit Osaka. The restaurant located on 10th floor. It took me an hour to search for it but taste worth it.","What’s not to like about unagi (other than the price..).","Only the female staff has nice service…","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","¥9,000–10,000","Atmosphere: 1","Atmosphere: 5","¥3,000–4,000","¥6,000–7,000","Service: 5","Service: 1","Service: 3","Meal type","¥10,000+","Dine in…","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 1","Food: 3","Food: 2","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant had a mix of good and bad experiences. Some customers enjoyed the grilled eel with its crunchy outside and juicy inside, saying it was worth the higher price. However, others had poor service, feeling ignored and disrespected by one of the staff members. Some guests even reported being turned away because they didn't order main meals and had to share with a child. The food overall was just okay, with some dishes being too expensive and others not as good as expected."

Name: Unagi Toku
Address: 1-1 Hakataekichuogai, Hakata Ward, Fukuoka, 812-0012, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 164 reviews","4 stars, 160 reviews","3 stars, 112 reviews","2 stars, 48 reviews","1 stars, 33 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20139 pm"]
Reviews:
["Went to an up class looking restaurant looking for eel. Chanced upon unagi toku. Atmosphere was well done with piped slow music.

Service wise was left to be desired. I always expected Japanese service to be impeccable. However this proved me wrong. Possible due to part timers. Not really attentive to the needs of customers or setting the table for that matter.

Food wise, it was average. Did not see fresh eel pepper prepared upon order as mentioned in their menu…   Everything came out of the fridge, large pot…  For an up class restaurant if there is nothing to show, don’t….. I expected better…. not so for this one unfortunately.","The food is minimally okay but the price is maximally not okay! I mean, come on, I can find a similar place serving similar food in Fukuoka but with half of the price they charge. 9000 yen for two eel dinner sets and one small beer was insane! The white eel’s texture was inexplicably weird. It tasted almost flakey without the firm texture eel should have! Just being in a prime location didn’t justify how exorbitant its price was!","Eel rice box specialist restaurant. Steamed then grilled unagi is done very well with traditional sauce. Tasted quite good even for none eel eaters. However, the portion of the food is disappointing for the higher price tag. You may enjoy many other fulfilling choices with the same price menu within the restaurant floors.","The eel is great. They suggested 3 ways to taste the eel with rice. Original, with green union + wasabi, and with added soup. All tasted excellent.","Tastes reasonably nice. It’s even better if it’s fatty enough. Portion is quite small and pricey though","Very delicious! but the price is very high that i thinck the CP value will eventually become normal.","Really delicious unagi resto on top of Hakata station.","Very delicious and special eel steamed rice!","Just not my type and it’s expensive.","Best unagi you can ask for~","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥4,000–5,000","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 1","Service: 5","Meal type","Dine in…","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "The reviewer was disappointed with the service at Unagi Toku, a high-end restaurant serving eel. The atmosphere was nice, with slow music, but the service was lacking. The food was average, with the eel's texture being inexplicably weird. While the steamed then grilled unagi with traditional sauce was tasty, the portions were small and the price was exorbitant, making it hard to justify the cost."

Name: Unagi Toku
Address: Japan, 600-8001 Kyoto, Shimogyo Ward, 52
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 101 reviews","4 stars, 118 reviews","3 stars, 51 reviews","2 stars, 13 reviews","1 stars, 24 reviews"]
Reviews:
["Went there with my parents for dinner today (Sunday at 6pm), it was not packed full, and we got seated right away. Since it's on the 7th floor of a building, that wasn't a surprise.

From what I can see, the restaurant is pretty small; full capacity is at probably around 20-25 people. There was about 4-6 wait staff. So plenty of people to help out. -- yet our tea was only filled once during the whole meal. Considering we paid over 8500 yen for 3 set dinner meals, in addition to the fact that most of the time the staff was just loitering around (again, not full).

The meal I had was the set meal with a bento box, 2 pieces of ungai, soup, steamed egg with unagi, and some sides + random salad. -- 3250 yen. --- the portions were regular Japanese meal portions; but what made me bitter is the fact that I can easily tell, that, the unagi in my bento was significantly smaller than the one for the customer next to me. No, it wasn't just 'cause in their bento they ordered a 4 piece one. But I literally could see, one piece of theirs = 50% bigger and thicker than mine. And my meal wasn't even a cheap meal!

It's not fair. The sizes should be similar.

But, redeeming points: they do taste fresh, it's nothing like the microwave frozen ones. Though I cannot say for certain that the TOKU ones taste /BETTER/. It did taste fresh and different. It is well cooked, seasoned, and flavoured. The white rice is of good quality. The atmosphere was also pretty good, ideal place for a date or even dine alone. You can see where the unagi is cooked and grilled; the whole process while the chief is working on it.

Other than the poor cost/portion value ratio; and the disparity in the amount of unagi that's served (even the cheaper bento of my parents, they had bigger ones too)... and slow service; everything else is fine.

Though I would not go again.","I had lunch here today, the eel quality here is really bad with LOTS OF FISH BONES. It is super unusual. There is a fish bone stuck in my throat at the moment and I will need to visit the hospital tomorrow and see if it can be removed.
Kindly suggest ppl to avoid this restaurant and find a better place for eel.","I have walked for quite a long time in Gion district, Kyoto to find a Unagi restaurant. Finally, i decided to have it here. Price is quite moderate to high, but still acceptable coz in the department store. Unagi size is okay in price 2,900 yen something. It is tasty. Good place to try.","Not recommended for foreigners. As soon as they know you don’t speak Japanese you’d be immediately downgraded to the “second class customers” category. Table seated beside and behind us were served before us even though we ordered first. …","The unagi was crisp on the outside with a tender meat texture, which was great. The portion was a bit small. The service was okay, and there were no issues at all with foreigners at the time.","Excellent eel rice served in a variety of sizes (including double layer inside the wood pot) and ways.  The tea soup eel rice is a highlight.  Efficient service.  Kyoto branch of a chain.","Bad Service, rude to customers, not considered for foreigner customers need to charge the phone also not allowed. Have socket next to the table.","Price more expensive than Singapore but did not feel it is any better than the unagi I get to eat back home. Ambience is good.","Excellent unagi! A little on pricey-side, but a rare treat for all of us well-worth the price!","Quite expensive but delicious japanese Elle can be enjoyed.","Price per person","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 5","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 3","Service: 5","Meal type","Food: 1","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant on the 7th floor of a building has small capacity, but friendly staff. We ordered set dinner meals, which included bentos, ungai, soup, and sides. However, there was a big difference in the size of the unagi between the meals. Despite paying over 8500 yen, our tea was only refilled once. The unagi tasted fresh, not like microwave frozen ones, and was well-cooked. The white rice was good quality and the atmosphere was great for a date or solo dinner. The whole process of cooking and grilling the unagi is visible from the dining area."

Name: KOFFEE MAMEYA Kakeru
Address: 2 Chome-16-14 Hirano, Koto City, Tokyo 135-0023, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 348 reviews","4 stars, 54 reviews","3 stars, 13 reviews","2 stars, 3 reviews","1 stars, 23 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20136 pm"]
Reviews:
["This is a unique cafe that combines the omakase culture with coffee. It's not just a cafe where you drink coffee, but a unique space that guides you to a deeper understanding of coffee. For around 5,000 yen, you can experience a variety of coffees, from drip coffee to lattes and espressos. They also recommend coffees that suit your taste. Reservations are required. The experience takes about 1 to 1.5 hours. It's an interesting place that combines Japanese high-end sushi restaurant culture with coffee. However, the price is quite expensive, and the language barrier made it difficult to get more in-depth explanations, which was a bit disappointing. Most of the baristas are proficient in English, but knowing Japanese would definitely enhance the experience.","Koffee Mameya really did live up to its hype. As soon as you enter the place it really did feel like a coffee place of worship. Jetlagged yet exhilarated we stepped into this calming and welcoming atmosphere which is characteristic of a Japanese establishment. We went for the coffee Omakase experience and it exceeded expectations. Presentation, taste and service 10/10. Though I must warn it was a lot of caffeine for a caffeine sensitive heavily Jetlagged individual!","This was an absolutely fantastic experience. My group and I all had a wonderful time. We tried both the Seasonal Special and the Signature course and had a wonderful time. All of our drinks were delicious.

Our barista Hazuki was excellent, and answered all of our questions thoroughly while preparing our drinks carefully and precisely.","The friendly staff really made my experience very special!

I was able to learn and ask so many questions about coffee and various processing techniques.

I had the seasonal special which showcased 2 types of beans in many different kinds of preparations.

If you really like coffee and speciality roasts, I highly recommend this shop!","My first high-end coffee tasting and it was worth the 5000 yen spent. Will definitely come again. Tasted a variety of coffee types in many different unique ways on how it is prepared. All tasted distinctly different and the vibes and staff were chill","If you’re not a coffee snob you can ignore this. We did a curated coffee tasting in Tokyo. You have a barista that’s assigned to you that will make you coffee 5 different ways. The coffee we had was from Rose Coffee Roasters in Zurik. This …","Did not know that reservations must be made  and was asked to wait for 30 mins before they could find me a seat. The wait did not disappoint. I was greeted with a friendly and knowledgeable barista who walked me through my coffee drinking …","KOFFEE MAMEYA Kakeru is a coffee shop located in Tokyo that offers a unique coffee experience. The shop has the following features: …","MAR 2024

Made a reservation in advance to try the coffee course. The interior looks very …","One of my best coffee testing experience.

Many beans from many origins for selection. …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥5,000–6,000","¥8,000–9,000","¥7,000–8,000","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 5"," More","Other"]
AiReviewSummary: "This unique cafe in Tokyo offers a special coffee experience. For around 5,000 yen, you can try different types of coffee, including lattes, espressos, and more. The baristas will help you choose which ones suit your taste best. The atmosphere is calm and welcoming, making it feel like a coffee \"place of worship\". Most of the baristas speak English, but knowing Japanese can enhance the experience. We tried the coffee Omakase experience and found the presentation, taste, and service to be excellent. We also tried the seasonal special, which featured two types of beans prepared in different ways. The staff were friendly, and we learned a lot about coffee and its processing techniques."

InputString: Blue Bottle Coffee - Shinjuku Cafe Japan
Name: Blue Bottle Coffee - Shinjuku Cafe
Address: Japan, 160-0022 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Shinjuku, 4 Chome16 NEWoMan SHINJUKU 1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,657 reviews","4 stars, 1,322 reviews","3 stars, 595 reviews","2 stars, 141 reviews","1 stars, 118 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 8 am\u20139 pm","Friday, 8 am\u20139 pm","Saturday, 8 am\u20139 pm","Sunday, 8 am\u20138:30 pm","Monday, 8 am\u20139 pm","Tuesday, 8 am\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 8 am\u20139 pm"]
Reviews:
["Spacious cafe that is light and bright. The food was not remarkable (3 stars). The drinks were okay (3-4 stars). Loved the contrast of this cafe to the dark Starbucks across the street. We had a 20+ year reunion and felt comfortable enough to have a private conversation for about 80 minutes.","Blue Bottle is always a good blend of modern atmosphere and great coffee.  This location features the coffee bar in the center of the room with seating around the outside. They have a couple of desserts available, but a large selection of various blends and your choice of brewing method.","Nice cafe serving genuine expresso.

Service is pretty friendly and informative.

Seating is fairly spread out but its quite crowded when we visited.

Highly recommended for a quick coffee break.

Price however comes at a slightly high premium circa JPY600 per serving.","As a foreigner, they provided exceptional service which I am giddy about. They complimented my Japanese and has stuck with me. Wish I got the name of the person I spoke to! Also coffee is nice and the waffle is nice also. Will be coming back !","It is located on level 1 of the building. They have access from inside and outside. Easiest is to get in from the corner closes to the main road. No dedicated parking available but there are parking lots around. Plenty of seating inside and …","I have been to three other Blue Bottle locations and love coming because I think they have the best cappuccinos I’ve ever had. Unfortunately, the two cappuccinos we got did not have the thick foam that I get at other locations. This was the …","While the service and atmosphere of the cafe was lovely, I couldn’t quite agree with the taste of the coffee. With so many other amazing cafes nearby, only go here if you really want to try Blue Bottle once. …","Coffee and choc drinks are very nice but the place is way overpriced. We were lucky finding a seat for our family of 3. Range of pastries and cookies quite limited but drinks were top notch.","Come here often to work and chill with my iPad. Here is my third time this week. Love how the barista process the coffee. Bella Donovan will be my highest recommendation for you. …","I ordered their best seller the iced mocha Coffee and it had a strong dark roast taste. A bit pricey at 720jpy. The long lines tempted me to try their coffee.","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","¥1,000–2,000","Drip Coffee","Service: 4","Service: 5","Meal type","¥1–1,000","Take out","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Food: 4","Food: 5","Other"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This cafe has a spacious and bright atmosphere, making it a comfortable spot to chat with friends. While the food isn't exceptional, the drinks are decent and they have a variety of coffee blends and brewing methods. They also serve some desserts and have a nice selection of cakes. The service is friendly and informative, and seating is spread out, although it can get crowded. It's a good place to grab a coffee break, but it's a bit pricey, with a single serving costing around 600 yen. They also serve waffles, and their coffee and chocolate drinks are good."

Name: Fuglen Tokyo
Address: 1 Chome-16-11 Tomigaya, Shibuya City, Tokyo 151-0063, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,729 reviews","4 stars, 794 reviews","3 stars, 265 reviews","2 stars, 101 reviews","1 stars, 91 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 7 am\u20131 am","Friday, 7 am\u20131 am","Saturday, 7 am\u20131 am","Sunday, 7 am\u20131 am","Monday, 7 am\u201310 pm","Tuesday, 7 am\u201310 pm","Wednesday, 7 am\u20131 am"]
Reviews:
["Had a pretty cool time at Fuglen Tokyo over the weekend! Popped in around 1 PM and it was buzzing, had to wait about 15 minutes to get in, which wasn't too bad.

Last time I hit their Asakusa spot, I walked right in, no wait.

Definitely go for their Fuglen iced coffee if you visit, it's their thing and totally worth it.
My friend grabbed a caffe latte and loved it.

The staff were super friendly and spoke great English, so ordering was a breeze. Lots of seating too, so you can find a spot to chill.

Highly recommend to anyone who loved coffee. Please check it out! ⭐️","Had this coffee on our first day in Tokyo and we thought about it so much over the next two weeks that we had to go back. No other coffee in Japan compared. The service was exceptional and the drinks tasted amazing. We got a single latte with their special beans and a single cappuccino. You could definitely taste the difference between the beans but both were amazing. As a barista their milk quality was the best we had in Japan. Amazing texture and the perfect temperature for both a latte and cappuccino","A unique cafe experience. Hand brew for the coffee Connoisseur’s. Beautifully made mocha. Real coffee promptly made with flair and a welcoming staff.
It feels like a vintage 70s home. Music set the mood, 3 points of light for texture and the mood for your peaceful moment with a lovely drink is set!
Please travel far and wide to visit this cafe. We did and it was worth it.
No labtops allowed so it is a place for quiet contemplation and enjoyment (leave your work behind).","The brown cheese slice was quite delicious.
I like this coffee shop very much. When I enter the shop, I can find a position before ordering food. There are some outdoor seats where I can easily sit and order a cup of coffee and chat with friends","It was August in Tokyo and bloody hot, but that didn't stop me from checking out this must-visit cafe. After a quick train ride from Shinjuku, we walked about 8 minutes to get there - the walk was proper nice, passing all these little shops …","An amazing place for coffee and snacks. Line can be long due to its popularity. There are seats inside and outside as well. Their cakes are amazing. I had the Vegan New York crumb cake and it was fluffy and light.","MAR 2024

Ordered a double café latte which came in a tall glass. Coffee was mild and tasty without being milky. Service was good and staffs and baristas were polite.","A highly rated coffee shop in Tokyo originated from Oslo, Norway. It seems that there is always a long line, and trust me, the coffee is worthy of the wait.","I ordered a flat white, the milk is stronger than the coffee. For those who like a pinch of coffee in milk, this one is for you! For me, this is 無咖啡味。","Nice coffee house in Tokyo.
Very crowded even in weekdays afternoon time. …","Vegan New York crumb cake","Cafe Latte and Croissant","Pastries, Brew Coffee","Recommended dishes","Vegetarian options","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Meal type","¥1–1,000","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Other"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "I had a great time at Fuglen Tokyo, where you can enjoy their famous Fuglen iced coffee. My friend liked their caffe latte too. The staff is friendly and speaks good English, making it easy to order. The cafe has plenty of seating and feels like a vintage 1970s home. You can try their hand-brewed coffee, special beans, or mocha, and even enjoy a delicious brown cheese slice. It's a peaceful spot to relax and enjoy your drink."

Name: Hatoya
Address: 1 Chome-23-8 Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0032, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 54 reviews","4 stars, 42 reviews","3 stars, 28 reviews","2 stars, 2 reviews","1 stars, 0 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 10:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Friday, 10:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Saturday, 10:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Sunday, 10:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Monday, 10:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Tuesday, 10:30 am\u20135:30 pm","Wednesday, 10:30 am\u20135:30 pm"]
Reviews:
["5 minutes walk from Ginza Line Asakusa Station
Founded in 1928 [Coffee Hatoya]
What time is it open?
It looks like it opens at 10:30, but the opening time on this day was 11:30.

You can enjoy the retro atmosphere when you enter the store.
There was even a record

Of course I ordered
pancakes
¥600
boiled azuki
¥500

Two nostalgic pancakes with fluffy and moist batter.

The size of the dough is over 10 cm ♪ It is quite thick and filling.

It's served simply with butter on top of the dough, but it had a nice salty taste.
There is maple syrup as an extra, so please use it if you like.

Why I chose boiled azuki for my drink
① Curious
② Since the pancakes are simple, I thought if I added red beans, it would turn into butter.

When I asked the shop owner, it seems that boiled azuki beans were popular during the war, so it's just sugar and azuki beans.
I hope you can think of it as a sweet and dilute shiruko.

I made it into an butter just in case.
If this is the correct answer, is it correct?

When I ordered coffee, I looked closely at the cup and it looked like two pigeons kissing, and it turned out to be a heart♡, which was so cute.

Although the pancakes don't look good, I was able to go to a valuable shop, and I'm grateful to my followers for following my hobby.
thank you

It was delicious
Thank you for the meal","Until recently, coffee was 350 yen, and now it's 400 yen. You can drink real coffee. Moreover, the food is cheap. Toast comes with jam for 250 yen. I always order these two and they are very delicious. There are six tables, and the restaurant can accommodate up to 20 people.
As is the case in Asakusa, this restaurant attracts a lot of foreign tourists, so I feel a bit hesitant to enter alone on Saturdays and Sundays, but the owner welcomes me in a pleasant manner. She loves her grandchildren, and when they come home from daycare, the store closes temporarily and reopens when she's gone. He prioritizes time with his family and doesn't care about making money. As long as this master is around, I will continue to visit this store.","Came across this cafe while I was walking along the street in the afternoon and decided to try their pancakes and coffee. The pancakes was adequately fluffy but slightly overcooked on the surface, giving it that charred flavour. The coffee was okay. My only real gripe was that the seats are pretty small which can be quite uncomfortable for the burly, or maybe it's just that I don't conform to "Japanese dimensions"...","Really cosy little cafe that hasn’t changed in years. The service was very nice and the atmosphere was lovely. The hot chocolate tasted like it was made with cocoa powder and hot milk rather than being made by a machine. The food was delicious.","Came here for a quick break and sat inside for around 15 minutes and enjoyed my coffee. As a Melbournite, we know our coffee and it wasn’t too bad. Prices were okay. It high for my level but that’s Japan and what I expected. …","A hidden coffee shop...☕︎The prices were reasonable and the atmosphere inside was relaxing. The staff were also friendly and it was very heartwarming to see them conversing with the customers. …","The food is ok. The coffee is good. The standard of service here is averagely good by Japanese standard. I kind of regretted ordering the pancakes. I should have ordered something else.","Good place to enjoy local style cafe.","Nice pancakes and lemon squash!","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","¥1,000–2,000","Great food","Service: 4","Service: 5","Meal type","ホットケーキセット","¥1–1,000","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Food: 4","Food: 5","Brunch","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This charming cafe, founded in 1928, is a 5-minute walk from Asakusa Station. When you enter, you'll feel like you're stepping back in time with its retro atmosphere. The pancakes are a must-try, with fluffy and moist batter, served with a nice salty taste and a side of maple syrup. You can also enjoy boiled azuki, a sweet and creamy drink made with azuki beans. The cafe has a cozy atmosphere, with small tables and a friendly staff. It's a great place to relax and enjoy a meal, with prices ranging from ¥600 to ¥1,000 per person."

Name: Hatoya Asakusa
Address: 2 Chome-14-3 Hanakawado, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0033, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 168 reviews","4 stars, 52 reviews","3 stars, 27 reviews","2 stars, 4 reviews","1 stars, 13 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Saturday, 10 am\u20136 pm","Sunday, 10 am\u20136 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20136 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20136 pm"]
Reviews:
["MAR 2024

Ordered a premium iced matcha latte with matcha whipped cream topped with a matcha financier. It took a few minutes to prepare the drink and the staff will ask if you want any sweet syrup to be added. The matcha flavor of the latte was strong and is enriched with the additional whipped cream; very tasty. The financier was good to have with the whipped cream if you want more than just a drink. A bit pricey but worth it for the high quality matcha. Also tried the matcha and houjicha gateau chocolate which were soft with a fudgy center, both were quite sweet with a strong tea flavor.","Authentic flavors of Matcha from Kyoto.

There is huge queue to enter the store. We waited around 30mins to enter. So expect long waiting at the cafe.

There is no seating space for the cafe. Still few people can stand and have the dessert.

They have various matcha drinks, smoothies and dessert with mochi available.

The staff prepare the matcha drink right in front of us, so it is very good for us to enjoy seeing the making desserts.

Cafe is near to the Sumida river bank, so you can enjoy the drink, by having slices of Tokyo Skytree.","Hand drop Japanese green tea, unsweetened but you can add sugar by your own. not close to the main business area but a great shop to taste Japanese green tea. They also have several kinds of toppings so you can also make your own one. It’s the store when o want some “real” Japanese green tea then I will go.
They don’t have complicated decoration but simple and clean. Not too many indoor seats so sometime you might need to wait a little be.","We tried both matcha latte and hojicha latte, I have to say I preferred the latter one. There is just standing table, so if you are tired, take it with you to the Sumida park not far away from this shop. Staff is very friendly, speak good English.","I visited this cafe on a Sunday morning and didn't have to queue up, but I saw a sign outside asking customers to queue on the other side of the pavement so as to not block the way, so the situation might be different later in the day. The …","We visited Hatoya Asakusa on a Thursday around 1 PM and it was not busy.  However, they did have signage outside of the shop telling people where to line up so I expect it gets busy. The shop has an English menu which includes tea, …","Authentic matcha latte and dessert. Super friendly people. Just be mindful when you ask for the level of sugar, these are much less sweeter than the versions from United States.","An absolute must-visit for matcha lovers! The taste here is incredibly authentic, and the staff goes above and beyond to ensure a fantastic experience. Oishi indeed! 🫶👏","Authentic. Ordered two roasted matcha latte. The ice cream isn't very sweet！ If they could offer high chairs, it would be a lot better.","Very delicious and just the right amount of sweetness, allowing me to taste the rich flavor of matcha. I will definitely come again.","Parking not available for the store","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Meal type","¥1–1,000","Take out","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Parking","Other"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "The cafe serves high-quality matcha drinks and desserts, such as a premium iced matcha latte with matcha whipped cream and a matcha financier. The staff prepares the drinks in front of customers, and the cafe has a simple and clean atmosphere. You can enjoy your drink near the Sumida river bank and take a break at the nearby park. The staff is friendly and speaks good English. They offer various matcha drinks, smoothies, and desserts, including a matcha and houjicha gateau chocolate."

Name: I'm donut? Harajuku
Address: Japan, 150-0001 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Jingumae, 1 Chome1424 1F2F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 144 reviews","4 stars, 76 reviews","3 stars, 65 reviews","2 stars, 28 reviews","1 stars, 55 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Friday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Saturday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Sunday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Monday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Tuesday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Wednesday, 10 am\u20138 pm"]
Reviews:
["Amazing donuts and a must try if you're in Tokyo!

You won't have donuts like these ever, such a unique texture and a well balanced flavour in each of the donuts

Luckily they have other branches, and when we went around 2pm, the small line was moving relatively quickly and we were able to enjoy these delicious donuts.

My favourite was the Strawberry donut with white choc, but all the other flavours we got were nice too.

But ultimately, you're here for the soft and fluffy donut texture!","I’ve only bought donuts to go so not sure about the eat in space. I have heard amazing things about this shop. Whenever I passed by after work, it would always be sold out. However, I have recently been able to get my hands on some.

I am not usually a donut person. The only donut I eat are the Krispy Kreme glazed donuts. However, these are even better! They are so soft and delicious! Will definitely be back for more!","The lines can get crazy honestly but they also go by fast. If you happen to make the wait and go to this branch of i'm donut?, I highly recommend ordering their branch exclusive donuts that they serve fresh and in separate packaging. The boxed donuts are good too but the we really were shocked with the Harajuku Branch donuts and would come back for those. We ate our donuts in the park beside the store.","My first donut place in Japan, and I was very pleasantly surprised! The texture of the donuts is quite different from those you might find in the US; it reminded me of French beignets. The donuts practically melt in your mouth. Honestly, it’s one of my favorite donuts I’ve ever had.","Donuts come in many shapes, flavours and textures. These are small, filled with creamy filling and slightly chewy. They're okay. Enjoyed the pistachio but the matcha white chocolate didn't taste like much. Wouldn't line up again even if the line moved quickly.","The takeaway menu from 1F has different choices compared to dine-in menu at 2F. You can buy from 1F and bring up to 2F, but to sit in you will have to buy a drink. The donuts are soft and fluffy and worth the queue.","This place lives up to all the viral hype. We went with the classic I am donut, the pistachio, and the fig & cream.
The wait was only about 15 minutes, we were served well with staff giving us …","Interesting donuts, definitely not traditional. We got four donuts, the matcha, a fig & lemon cream, a cacao, and a chocolate strawberry crueller.  Our favorite was the chocolate strawberry. …","Donuts made from pumpkin flour so soft . Not oily at all . I had the chocolate and the pistachio . I ate that immediately post lunch  it’s worth every calories pls !!!","Again this is just hype.
The taste is not bad though, apart from that we need to stand in lengthy queue, no seating area and only limited number of doughnuts. …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 2","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Take out","Service","Food: 5","Brunch","Donuts","Other"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "These donuts in Tokyo are amazing and a must-try! They have a unique texture that's soft and fluffy, and a well-balanced flavor in each donut. My favorite was the Strawberry donut with white chocolate, but I also enjoyed the other flavors I tried."

Name: All Seasons Coffee
Address: Japan, 160-0022 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Shinjuku, 2 Chome77 1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 571 reviews","4 stars, 255 reviews","3 stars, 84 reviews","2 stars, 14 reviews","1 stars, 40 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 12\u20137 pm","Friday, 9 am\u20137 pm","Saturday, 9 am\u20137 pm","Sunday, 9 am\u20137 pm","Monday, 9 am\u20137 pm","Tuesday, 9 am\u20137 pm","Wednesday, 9 am\u20137 pm"]
Reviews:
["Great coffee with an amazing flan/pudding

You can tell they take pride in their coffee. They were a few employees working by the roaster and tasting a new batch for quality control. The latte itself tasted great, and the espresso tonic was an interesting cold drink. As for the flan, it was one of the best flans we had in Japan.

This shop is definitely worth a stop, but I'd recommend planning accordingly.  We came in on a weekday a few hours after prime lunch times, so there was no wait. However, we initially came by on a weekend, and there was a large line out the door.","Aromatic and delectable - the perfect words to describe the coffee and dessert on offer here at All Seasons Coffee.

Came just a little before 1pm, a little busy but not too long of a wait as you would be a little later.

Got the affogato - one with dark caramel and the other with bitter espresso to top them off. Recommend the caramel if you can't handle the bitterness. The vanilla ice cream and sauce balances out the flavours of the pudding without overpowering it.

Recommended for all coffee and dessert lovers alike.","Saw this cafe on IG so went later on a Saturday afternoon. Waited in line outside for almost 40 minutes but it was worth it. Iced lemonade was OK, soy latte was good & affogato pudding was incredible. Cafe is cute & clean. There are about 15 seats in the cafe & a washroom. If you just want takeout you can bypass the line and go right in to order. Staff are happy & friendly. Glad we checked this cafe out!","I got the flan like twice. Once by myself and twice with my sister. Very delicious flan and the atmosphere was very retro and pleasant. The cold brew was delicious but the matcha latte was lacking as I cannot taste the matcha properly only the strong flavor of milk. But overall 10/10 recommended.","I went for a pudding, they asked me also for a drink. I added a drink, and they told me we should buy 1 drink and 1 meal per person if we wanted to stay inside. We asked for take away and they told us the pudding n not for take away. too many restrictions to get a pudding. We left the place.","The classic pudding was sold out so I got the seasonal Strawberry Affogato and it was delicious ! I had a cold brew with it which was also good. The staff were very nice and the place was cozy and friendly. I definitely recommend if you want to try Japanese pudding in a nice atmosphere :)","Warm staff and a good coffee place to visit. We ordered their hand drip coffee and pudding. Good thing the pudding is available today as it was sold out on our first visit. As usual, the place is full of people but you can still find a spot to dine. This is their first branch.","Depends, if you come to take a picture, it’s all good; if you come to take a coffee, you better not come. Even the convenience store are better than their own roasted and house blend coffee, too milky for the latte and hand drip taste like Chinese medicine.","MARCH 2023

The cafe latte and pudding affogato was very tasty. The seasonal strawberry pudding was also good but could of went without it as it was too much pudding in one sitting. Didn't have to wait long and everything was served at the same time.","This beautiful little coffee shop packs quite a punch with its wide range of coffee and delicious snacks. We had the classic pudding and rib melt, both very tasty. Finishing off with two iced americanos and it was the perfect way to start the day.","Quite a small space, so if you're taking over 2 people, be prepared to either split up or wait a little longer. There is a policy that you must order a drink, so be cautious. Food and drink were so so so good though, so well worth any flaws.","This little hole in the wall coffee shop is adorable. It’s very accommodating for foreigners and accepts both cash and visa, with an English menu as well. This place is jam packed with locals in the morning and their pudding is absolutely …","Chill little cafe, located on the east side of Shinjuku. Eclectic hipster vibes, with a large coffee grinder at the entrance, and smooth tunes playing overhead. Some bench seating along the wall, and some bar stool seating in the middle. …","This is great coffee at an excellent location! Because I visit The park often, this is the perfect place to stop and get a coffee on the way in. They usually have some seasonal drink choices, such as iced beverages, which are good. The …","I got a classic pudding for take out. At first, I did not like the pudding — but this is because I ate each component separately — there’s whipped cream, the flan, and the fruity espresso shot. It’s confusing if you eat it separately. …","I waited for around 20 mins. It was my third attempt. The staff were all friendly and the coffee was also good. The pudding/custard was just ok for me. It was not too sweet and it has a slight bitter aftertaste.","Great coffee and polite stuff however we waited 10min while there was 6 free tables super super suuuuuuper slow with cleaning the tables to seat new clients, 2 people walked off and I almost did the same. …","i loved this place so much!! inside was so pretty and the atmosphere was great (very nice music). the pudding was not too sweet and the coffee was absolutely delicious!! our espresso was from guatemala :)","We loved All Seasons Coffee so much we came two days in a row! Wish we could’ve come again, but we had to fly home. Beat espresso tonic I’ve ever had and delicious sandwich. Very friendly staff.","Great coffee roasted and served here. A good selection of beans from Africa and central America at the time I visited.
Coffee is roasted on a 2kg Diedrich roaster ensuring fresh brew daily. …","the matcha was not too sweet just right. yyou can also get the pudding to go which is nice. so after I finished my pudding I ordered one for to go to share with my family","Came here at 9:30am in a Sunday. No wait with only a few people inside. Got the cold brew float and iced mocha. Drinks tasted fine. Wouldn’t wait long for it though.","Love the pudding, it pairs perfectly with the dark caramel and my double shot latte. Should have discovered this cafe earlier as it was right opposite my hotel.","I visited this shop on a Wednesday morning, there are some available seats.

We ordered one Hand Drip coffee, Ice Latte and the Pudding Whip Cherry. …","Good beans, nice retro ambiance, they roast their coffee beans in store. Pudding is a popular item to order and it did not disappoint.","A cozy cafe with the essentials. Service was patient and welcoming.  We were given a lot of time to think about our order. …","Great coffee with good vibes in the area!
Just what I was looking for - great coffee and something sweet after a long day.","Lots of options for hand drip coffee, latte was great, even without any flavor! Not bitter at all!!","Local coffee shop in Shinjuku Ni-Chome. They are very welcoming and make great coffee / espresso.","+ Good プリン (pudding)
+ decent coffee
- need to order one drink per person $$ …","Cold Brew Ice, Classic Pudding, モンブランプリン","They have oat milk!","Recommended dishes","Vegetarian options","Price per person","Classic Pudding","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Service: 3","Service: 4","Meal type","Breakfast","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Pudding","Food: 2","Food: 4","Brunch","Other"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This cafe serves amazing coffee and desserts. Their flan/pudding is one of the best in Japan, and it's perfect with dark caramel and vanilla ice cream. The atmosphere is cozy and retro, making it a great place to relax with a cup of coffee. The staff is friendly and welcoming, and they take pride in their coffee-making process. The cafe also offers a variety of drinks, including cold brew and matcha latte, and their oat milk option is a plus. Overall, it's a great spot for coffee and dessert lovers, and definitely worth a visit."

["it's a cafe & bar, both the menu and interior is targeting the adult customers. with classic deep coloured wood. i was here for a dinner. so i picked their signature pasta and a caramel pudding. the pasta was quite big and i could hardly finish it. the caramel pudding was good, it's with more bitter brunt caramel and overall it's less sweet. the cubic was cut very sharp and looked very tidy. nice vibes here. i also had an alcoholic drink here to enjoy the evening.

hope you find the photos i took beautiful & useful ;)
follow me on ig: food.n.cats.not1less","Spaghetti Tokyo neopolitan was delicious. The bitter bell pepper and savory sausage counter the sweetness of the sauce. The pudding is wonderful too. A delicious bitter espresso chocolate sauce on top makes it an adult dessert that is complex.

I recommend the meal set.","Cafe Bar is located on the connecting passageway from Marunouchi to Yaesu in Tokyo Station, with a menu that focuses on pasta during lunch hours. Dessert did not disappoint and coffee was very good and strong. A must visit when one is at the Tokyo Station","Long que (15 mins), service is lower than Japanese average and the custard pudding is not so soft and smooth as expected.
For 650 Yen it isn’t worth it.","Excellent place for pudding and japanese style Neapolitan pasta. High cp value. AiReviewSummary: "This cafe and bar in Tokyo Station has a cozy atmosphere with dark wood interior, perfect for adults. The pasta is big and filling, and the signature caramel pudding is a must-try, with a bitter caramel flavor and creamy texture. The Tokyo Neapolitan pasta dish is also a standout, with sweet sausage and savory bell pepper balanced by the sauce."

Name: AIMU
Address: 3 Chome-11-1 Koenjikita, Suginami City, Tokyo 166-0002, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 85 reviews","4 stars, 18 reviews","3 stars, 9 reviews","2 stars, 0 reviews","1 stars, 0 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, Closed","Friday, 11 am\u20134:30 pm","Saturday, Closed","Sunday, Closed","Monday, Closed","Tuesday, Closed","Wednesday, Closed"]
Reviews:
["The best pancakes 🥞 Please note that there is a pancake day and a cafe day 🧐

This is located about a 300m walk down Central Road after getting off at Koenji Station.

The days are divided into pancake days and cafe days.
I wanted to try AIMU's pancakes at least once, so I went there on Pancake Day🥞😋

We do not use additives such as baking powder, and each piece is carefully baked after receiving your order.
Eggs are from free-range chickens that eat natural food.
There is no odor and the yolk is a beautiful lemon yellow.
Pancakes with a fluffy texture that float on the plate are at their best when freshly baked.
First, take a bite and leave it as is without adding anything. ．． ．．

picture? Ah, I suddenly ate it with cream on it~🤣

Afterwards, enjoy it with Canadian pure maple syrup or genuine fresh cream if you like.

I even added Suzukura's red bean paste and homemade jam to TOPPING😍

Anyway, fluffy pancakes!!
It comes in three stages🥞🥞🥞😋

Up until now, I've always preferred firm pancakes to fluffy pancakes.
I have become a fluffy person!! So fluffy😍

By the way, this store was a store that handed out numbered tickets when I checked in advance, so I was excited to go there even before it opened!!
Apparently, starting in April, there will be no numbered tickets distributed and it will be on a first-come, first-served basis.
Indeed, when I came to the store, there were about two other people who came just before the store opened, so if you arrived at the opening time, it felt like you got in in the first round.

It seems like you had to wait a long time before you could get in, so now might be the time to go for it 🧐
I wonder if the number of customers has spread out because there are many other attractive cafes in Koenji.

Anyway, these were the best pancakes!!
Next time let's go to a cafe day 🤗","I visited AIMU after a morning of shopping in Koenji and felt so relaxed the moment I stepped in.

The café decor is beautiful and creates a wonderful ambiance. The latte I ordered was really tasty and comforting as well.

The highlight, though, was the staff. They were so, so patient, kind, and helpful with me despite the language barrier. I was very touched by it and it will definitely be one of the most memorable moments of my trip to Japan for me.

Please note before visiting that they only accept payment via cash and PayPay (an app that is only available through the Japanese app store).","Beautiful cafe with great ambience and decoration. Food is also top notch and beautiful. The owners are also incredibly friendly and accommodating to my subpar Japanese despite speaking limited English.

I was looking to get pancakes here but it wasn't on the menu, so I settled with their Aimu cake. The menu seems to be changing regularly. But there was no disappointment at all because the cake was incredible. Soft and light exterior with a rich savoury pistachio cream and sweet strawberries, it was an all-in-one package. Amazing! And did I mention beautiful?","The best cafe I have visited in Tokyo!

The cafe was simply designed with plants, and the cakes, tea were awesome.

There are some handmade foods for takeaways, but most of the cakes are only for dine in.

Staffs here are very kind also:)

They post their working days and menus on the day in instagram, @aimu_tokyo , should check it out in advance:)","This might be the best Café I have visited so far. Me and my girlfriend went there in the morning and had to wait about 25 minutes to get in, but it was absolutely worth it. When we were close to getting in, the staff was friendly enough to …","So peaceful and clean. Staff was friendly even though we couldn’t speak much Japanese. Food and drinks were divine. 100 stars for the pudding and cake. Cake was so light airy and flavorful 🤤🤤🤤 …","We walked by this cafe, despite some waiting time (around 15 minutes), it was definitely worth it. The place is small but has a really great atmosphere. The staff was incredibly helpful, too","This shop is popular for its healthy snacks that don't use additives!
30 minutes before opening on weekdays, there were about 4 groups waiting. …","Looking beautiful in my next visit to Japan i will test and experience your dishes","one of best pudding in tokyo","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Meal type","aimuパンケーキ","¥1–1,000","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Other"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "I went to AIMU cafe on Pancake Day and tried their fluffy pancakes. They use free-range eggs and no additives, and the yolks are a beautiful lemon yellow. The pancakes were so fluffy that they floated on my plate! I added cream and Canadian maple syrup, and even red bean paste and homemade jam. The texture was amazing, and I became a fan of fluffy pancakes."

Name: 29 Terrace

I ordered the beef tongue with scallions and the premium cut beef. I would definitely just stick to the premium cut beef, it grilled quickly and just melts in the mouth. To die for!!! And my wife loves the beef tongue! Taste good.","Extremely disappointed with my recent experience, would have given a ZERO star if I could. …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 1","¥4,000–5,000","¥8,000–9,000","Service: 5","Service: 1","Service: 4","Meal type","¥10,000+","Food: 5","Food: 4","Service","Dine in","Food: 1","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant is a great spot for beef lovers! They have a variety of dishes, including the popular beef tongue with scallions and premium cut beef. The premium cut beef is a must-try, as it's grilled to perfection and melts in your mouth. The beef tongue is also tasty, but a bit tough. The staff may not always speak English fluently, but they're very accommodating. There are also great value set menus and A5 Wagyu options available. Overall, it's a great place to indulge in delicious beef."

Name: Ginza Kimuraya
Address: 4 Chome-5-7 Ginza, Chuo City, Tokyo 104-0061, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 910 reviews","4 stars, 792 reviews","3 stars, 258 reviews","2 stars, 49 reviews","1 stars, 41 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Friday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Saturday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Sunday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Monday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Tuesday, 10 am\u20138 pm","Wednesday, 10 am\u20138 pm"]
Reviews:
["After watching Paul Hollywood visit here we just had to visit too. We went upstairs so we could enjoy the food sitting down. Tip there is a list where you write your name and the number of people in your group so they call you when a table is ready. Luckily we didnt have to wait too long. We had a delicious club type sandwich and then tried the famous ampan and melon bread. I wanted to try everything, especially the fruit sandwich. If I went back to Tokyo I would definitely come back here. When we left we bought some scones to take back to the hotel. Everything is delicious.","Love love love their Ebi sando with crispy and thick and tender patty made of shrimp on soft shokupan that is toasted on the outside only. So delicious and perfect portion for one or two. Their chai tea latte is so warming and delicious albeit quite sweet. Still a great option for breakfast.

The anpan available downstairs in the bakery is also great and very soft but nothing spectacular.

Came right when they opened so no wait.","We only got the bakery stuff on the ground floor. Didn’t have time for the cafe upstairs. Took almost one of every type of buns to try. My favorite was of course the red beans. The cream cheese was also very good. The fig jam was underwhelming. The mix beans was also right up there as a favorite. It’s really packed if different type of beans of variety of tastes. Hopefully we can try the cafe for our next trip.","One of my go to breakfast place during my trip to Japan. Can’t go wrong with the sandwiches and you can make it a set by including a drink (coffee and tea). Came here twice during my one week stay and would definitely miss their breakfast.","Good bakery with cafe on level 2 and 3. At level 3 cafe, we enjoyed free flow of freshly baked bread along with a main dish and beverage. The whipped butter they gave with the bread was super good with any bread you spread on. The wait …","Whenever I visit Tokyo, I try not to miss on Kimuraya’s red bean bread. Any kind of it has a plentiful filling. This time I bought a corn bread, which also gave me as big a pleasure as red bean bread. …","the bread here is really yummy and fresh!
i really enjoyed having the カレパン (curry bun) with the egg. i didn’t have a red bean bun but i saw them and they looked great! If you’re in ginza, drop by!","Happened to stroll by in the morning and pictures of bread caught my eye. Wanted to simple do a grab-and-go for the Curry Buns, but ended up on the second floor Cafe. …","🟠 Ginza Kimuraya / famous bread pastry store.

🟨 Kimuraya Sohonten is a bakery which was first established in 1869 as Buneido …","Here on the cafe of second level. The shrimp sandwich is good, but the pork cutlet sandwich is just average. …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Assorted Bread","Red Bean Bread","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Breakfast","Take out","¥1–1,000","Service","Food: 5","Dine in"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "We visited Kimuraya Sohonten, a famous bakery and cafe in Ginza, Tokyo. We sat down upstairs to enjoy their delicious food, including a club-type sandwich and the famous ampan and melon bread. We also tried the Ebi sando, a shrimp sandwich with crispy and tender patty, and their chai tea latte. The cafe has a great selection of sandwiches and drinks, and we enjoyed their bakery items, especially the red bean bread and cream cheese buns."

AiReviewSummary: "I went to Kimuraya bread on the second floor of this famous bakery in Ginza. I had a simple lunch and it was great. I tried the ebi fry sando and it was delicious. I also bought some buns to take out, like the red bean bun and the chestnut bun. Some other customers recommended the tea-cake and Rosinenbrötchen. There were also foods like curry bread and apple pie. The price was ¥4,000-5,000 per person, which was a bit expensive. The atmosphere was nice, and the service was okay."

Name: Ginza Kimuraya Sohonten TOKYO DAIMARU
