Reviews:
["I tried it for the first time.
The taste was okay.
Melon Pan Chocolate is made with Belgian chocolate, but the taste and amount of chocolate was not that great.
The star one was delicious. The chocolate was contained properly and the flavor was good.
There are other Japanese-style dishes as well, so I would like to try them next time!
The store staff's response was good.
I thought there would be a line of people if I went after 12:00, but that wasn't the case, so that was a relief!","Anpanya, a long-established store.
Nowadays, you can buy it in various places, but during the Taisho era, my grandmother would come to my house in Nihonbashi to sell anpan! I recommend the Sakura Anpan.","For bread lovers, it's like a Ryugu castle 😋 All of these 👍 The number and variety were less than I expected, so I deducted one star, and next time I'll definitely go to the main store. …","You don't have to go to the Ginza store, you can buy Anpan on the 1st basement floor of Daimaru.
If you buy Kimuraya's anpan bread as a souvenir and take it home, it will be …","It's great to be able to take Kimuraya's anpan home as a souvenir without having to go all the way to Ginza, and people are happy to take it back to the countryside.","The wine cheese CREAM bread is really delicious. I should have bought more and brought it back to Taiwan to eat.","When I visited in the evening, Mr. Sasaki who served me was very polite and I was happy. thank you very much.","I was attracted to the retro feel of the signboard = the feeling that it has been loved for many years... …","It's nice to be able to buy it easily.
It was nice to have individually wrapped items.","All breads are delicious.
I especially like the butter whip!","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","Service: 4","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Take out","¥1–1,000","Service","Food: 3","Food: 5"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "I tried Kimuraya's Anpan for the first time and thought the taste was okay, but the Melon Pan Chocolate was disappointing. However, The Star Anpan was delicious and had good flavor. I would like to try other Japanese-style dishes next time. The store staff was helpful and the atmosphere was nice, especially the retro signboard. I liked the individually wrapped bread and especially the butter whip. The Sakura Anpan is also a must-try."

Name: Katsukichi Shibuya
Address: Japan, 150-0002 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Shibuya, 3 Chome910 Kdc B1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 655 reviews","4 stars, 518 reviews","3 stars, 147 reviews","2 stars, 34 reviews","1 stars, 19 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20139 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20138:30 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm"]
Reviews:
["This traditional Japanese tonkatsu restaurant is a Tabelog Top 100 spot, and for good reason. The staff is friendly, and the decor is authentically Japanese, with great attention to detail. The portions are generous, and the meat quality is excellent. The shrimp tempura is impressively large. The only downside is that the batter is a bit thick. You can also upgrade to flavored rice, which is a nice touch.","Got the ebi katsu teishoku (shrimp cutlet set meal) plus 1pc of kaki-furai (oyster). The set meal had salad, pickles, rice, and soup. The rice you can opt for shiso rice. I loved it!!! The ebi katsu is so meaty and unlike any ebikatsu I’ve ever tasted. It’s the real deal.

Had to queue for a bit. Super packed even past 7pm. Loved the interior. Would love to go back and try the usual pork katsu","Fantastic restaurant, amazing decor. It’s down the stairs and hidden. I almost didn’t go down bc it looked closed but then the doors opened said we were welcomed in. All the old wood, it’s charming. The tonkatsu is outstanding. I ordered the deluxe set. It was so tender, probably the best I’ve had. Highly recommend this place for single, couples or group dining.","Chanced upon this while researching for Tonkatsu around Shibuya area. Saw good reviews and decided to give it a try! The wait was quite fast, roughly just 5 minutes and we are seated. There was quite a good selection of fried food, from …","Tonkatsu is as good as it is. The shiso rice were really made my day,  giving refresh feeling and never boring during eating rice with tonkatsu.
Staff seems to a bit not enough.
Atmostphere is good and unique.
Toilet is clean.","Definitely the Best Curry Tonkatsu and Juiciest Large Ocean Prawns in all of Tokyo. Best Value , Food Quality, Service & Atmosphere.  Better than many Michelin rated Restaurants in Tokyo.","The salted plum sauce pork loin katsu set is where it is at! I also really enjoyed their pickled seasonal vegetables! Highly recommended if you are in the area!","amazing interior design, this restaurant reminds me of traditional japanese houses. have have booth seats and zashiki (tatami flooring) …","the side dish and pickles are actually good. the fried pock chop not the best I ever had. Just try if you drop by.","Best tonkatsu I have ever had. Also, the salad is amazing. I think we had 3 bowls.","Deep Fried Minced Shrimp Cutlet","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Pork Loin Cutlet","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥2,000–3,000","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service…","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This Japanese restaurant is a must-visit for its delicious tonkatsu and friendly staff. The shrimp tempura is impressive in size, and you can upgrade to flavored rice, like shiso rice. The ebi katsu teishoku set meal is a crowd-pleaser, with generous portions and excellent meat quality. You can also order the salted plum sauce pork loin katsu set, which is a highlight. The restaurant's atmosphere is unique and charming, with traditional Japanese decor and a cozy interior."

Name: Katsukichi Suidbashi
Address: Japan, 113-0033 Tokyo, Bunkyo City, Hongo, 1 Chome41
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 394 reviews","4 stars, 360 reviews","3 stars, 101 reviews","2 stars, 37 reviews","1 stars, 29 reviews"]
Reviews:
["What a cute little restaurant in Tokyo! My husband and I were trying to find a place that serves katsudon and this place did not disappoint! The ambiance was really cool especially if you want to experience an authentic Japanese dining. It was a little hard to communicate with our server though since she can’t speak English. If you are visiting for the first time, know enough Japanese words and phrases or use some app that will help you translate things off the menu to order food successfully. Otherwise, great food and amazing ambiance!","It’s a Katsu (pork cutlet) restaurant nearby the Suidobashi station. Its doing business for 70years and the famous Japanese novelists also arrived. The main menu is pricy they has a cheaper lunch menu. The Katsu was crispy and fresh but it was a bit too fatty for me. I like that the rice and soup were free for refill.","Went two times in row to that place while staying at Tokyo Dome Hotel.
Both of the menus were so delicious!
The meat was meltingly soft and fried outpart so crunchy and crispy!!
Best Donkatsu so far :)","An unexpected but really good place for Tonkatsu (pork cutlet) hidden in the basement on the opposite side of Tokyo Dome. Just a few minutes walk from Suidobashi station. …","Their pork katsu is really good and melts in your mouth. The atmosphere is also very unique, making everything feel super large","The portions are generous and the fried pork chops are tender and juicy. Highly recommended!","Their pork is excellent. I love their rice. The ceramic decorations are amazing.","Very good fried dishes. Nice ambience and reasonable prices.","Kinda expensive, but their quality of rice is so damn good.","Had the dinner course set.
Food was alright.","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥2,000–3,000","¥4,000–5,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Service…","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 3","Brunch","Cutlet","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This Tokyo restaurant is a hidden gem serving delicious pork cutlet dishes. We went there because they have katsudon, and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere is unique and authentic Japanese, but be prepared to use a translation app because the staff doesn't speak English. The katsu was crispy and fresh, and we liked that the rice and soup were refillable. Donkatsu was also excellent, with tender and juicy pork. The ambiance was spacious and priced reasonably."

Name: Katsukichi Shin-Marunouchi Building
Address: Japan, 100-6505 Tokyo, Chiyoda City, Marunouchi, 1 Chome51  5F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 268 reviews","4 stars, 179 reviews","3 stars, 58 reviews","2 stars, 18 reviews","1 stars, 4 reviews"]
Reviews: ["A great spot for some tasty tonkatsu. It\u2019s on a floor with many other restaurants and can get crowded, but they take reservations which I would recommend. I think the hire (\u30D2\u30EC) is the best cut of pork, so I always end up getting it. And this place didn\u2019t disappoint. The coating on the pork was light and not greasy, while the meat was cooked perfectly. The crab croquette is worth trying too. The \u30ED\u30B9 katsu is a solid option if you want a bit more for your money. The sides are delicious and are refillable. Great service and ambiance. Check this place out if you\u2019re in the area.","Juicy hirekatsu, great kaki-fry, and the special winter offering was voluminous: lots of plates as you can see in the photos. You can get a refill of pickles, cabbage and rice. The rice here today was flavored with pieces of shiso leaves, giving it an additional, welcome taste.","I visited here with my friend, who really strongly recommended their katsu. Okay, no other place provides the one like theirs. The pork is thick and juicy, fried to the best extent with their marvelous skills. I will recommend this to others when asked.","Very good quality pork with a variety of side dishes and sauces. The service is good and quick as well. The staff are all polite and friendly. There is English menu available as well. It is a bit to the pricier side but the quality matches the price.","We were walking near Tokyo Station and decide to google for a nice Katsu restaurant and ended up here. The pork loin Katsu here is really delicious and juicy!! It\u2019s tender with a good amount of fats to meat ratio. The panko coating is light \u2026","I had a dinner with my colleague at this restaurant tonight.  I ordered their \u30D2\u30EC\u30AB\u30C4 and \u30A8\u30D3\u30AB\u30C4.  The hire katsu was crispy on the outside and tender inside.  The ebi katsu was also very tasty.  Both went well with their special sauce. I found \u2026","One of the best tonkatsu restaurants I\u0027ve had for a while. Tonkatsu is crispy and no oily. Cutlet is not terribly fatty. I ordered tonkatsu with mountain yam which was delicious. Side appetizers and salad were fresh and crunchy.","This was a fantastic find. Don\u0027t be fooled by the department store location.\nSuper great service, nice ambiance, and big portions delicious katsu are here. We really enjoyed this meal and experience.","very trying-worthy fried pork. They were really combination of juicy and crispy. different sets came with yam, cheese and pickle that were all nice matches with pork.","Excellent food, great professional and smiley stuff, but a little bit too expensive to the level I got used to in Japan","Fried, Fried Pork Cutlet, Fried Lain Park Cutlet, Japanese Pickles, Pork Cutlet","Japanese Pickles, Pork Cutlet, Salad","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","\u00A52,000\u20133,000","\u00A54,000\u20135,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant is a great spot for delicious tonkatsu. They have many options, including tonkatsu with hire (pork loin) which is cooked to perfection and not greasy. The coating is light and crispy, and the meat is juicy. The side dishes are also refillable and taste great, especially the rice flavored with shiso leaves. The service is good and the ambiance is pleasant. Some must-try dishes are the hirekatsu, kaki-fry, and the special winter offering."

Name: Katsukichi
Address: Japan, 103-6106 Tokyo, Chuo City, Nihonbashi, 2 Chome51 S.C. 6F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 64 reviews","4 stars, 51 reviews","3 stars, 22 reviews","2 stars, 3 reviews","1 stars, 1 review"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Sunday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20138 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20133 pm, 5\u20139 pm"]
Reviews: ["The staff here can speak english fluently. They even recommended us what\u2019s best in their menu. We ordered the assorted fried cutlet. I love the service here. Every time they put something on our table, they say what they\u2019re putting in our table in english and japanese as well. Their sauce is also great. We arrived here 40mins before they closed and were worried that we might not get served, but our orders came at the right time. The food is great, probably the best katsu I had in Tokyo.","Hi.\nDue to Covid, the sauce come in glass container, you have to ask each time you want a refill. You can still ask for free refills (rice, pickles and Cabbages). They used to have a big bowl in front of you. But the taste is still the same. Very good!!","The pork completely changed my entire perspective of the meat! Absolutely phenomenal!!! Nice and cosy little restaurant constantly with a queue so book ahead if you can. Big servings and outstanding quality of food!!","Had a low-temp fried pork filet and a seafood croquette. Heavenly. The restaurant is on the last floor of one of their malls close to the Tokyo station. Great experience.","A very nice place to eat which had a great variety of tonkatsu paired with an assortment of delicious side dishes. Friendly service and an English menu option.","Dined here after our first choice restaurant was closed nearby for new years holiday. \u2026","Shrimp Cutlet Combo, Pork Loin Cutlet, Deep-Fried Minced Shrimp Cutlet and Pork Fillet","Has an English menu and really kind and helpful staff","Simply the best katsu we had on this trip. Must try","The meat quality is really good. Friendly staff.","Deep-Fried Minced Shrimp Cutlet and Pork Fillet","Fresh flied pork they serve.","Parking is unavailable","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Parking options","Atmosphere: 5","Parking space","Atmosphere: 4","\u00A53,000\u20134,000","\u00A55,000\u20136,000","\u00A51,000\u20132,000","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Not sure","Dine in\u2026","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant serves delicious tonkatsu, a Japanese dish, with a variety of side dishes. The staff is friendly and can speak English fluently. They even recommended their special menu items, including the assorted fried cutlet. The food is great, and the sauce is amazing. It's a cozy place with big servings and outstanding quality of food, and it's a must-try. Some popular dishes include shrimp cutlet combo, pork loin cutlet, and deep-fried minced shrimp cutlet and pork fillet."

Name: Katsukichi
Address: 1 Chome-21-12 Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0032, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 270 reviews","4 stars, 93 reviews","3 stars, 41 reviews","2 stars, 12 reviews","1 stars, 16 reviews"]
Reviews: ["Cozy, small vibe. The service was wonderful and the food is worth the price. However, the table are a little small (for example I am 6\u201D1) and I was a little cropped. In general, I would go again if I went to Tokyo once again but with a higher budget as the price is a little higher than some other place (20,000 yen / plate ) compared to the one we go usually (15,000 yen /plate). Also a small menu but each item are really worth it even. It\u2019s not like those big restaurants with a huge menu. In any way, I highly recommend to foreigner and other.","No queue here and the door was closed so it looked like it wasn\u0027t open, but the lovely staff opened and came inside to a calm and lovely little restaurant. My wife is vegetarian and they had an off-menu set meal with the best breaded tofu she\u0027s had, and I had the juiciest, tastiest tonkotsu I\u0027ve eaten, and I\u0027ve had my fair share. Food came out quickly and we had a great time. Would definitely recommend.","We visited the restaurant in January 2023. We ordered their most famous miso pork cutlet set and the scallop set. The food was really really good and the staff was friendly. I don\u0027t know why this place has so few reviews. Also the miso and breading were all made in-house. It was a cold day and the server even offered hot packs to us when we left!","This tiny little eatery is a hidden gem! It is truly one of the best tonkatsu that I have eaten, if not the best! It is so soft and tender the you can cut it with a chop stick and so tasty that you don\u2019t need any dipping sauce. I highly recommend the miso, oh, so delicious!","Referring to the good reviews I decided to eat some Tonkatsu at Katsukichi. I ordered from an English menu card, but unfortunately I forgot to take a picture from it. Nevertheless, I took the basic Miso variant. The whole set of food as \u2026","We came in expecting to get turned away due to it being close the the end of lunch time. The staff warmly greeted us and we didn\u2019t have to wait long until we were seated. The kind staff who let us in spoke English, and they also have an \u2026","The best katsudon you\u0027ll find in Tokyo.\nThe \u0022basic\u0022 katsudon is mixed with some miso sauce and the result is a crispy and light bite that melts in your mouth. \u2026","I am obsessed with this place. The food, delicious! The owner super cute and told us what was the best choices were. I loved it and I really recommend it!","Great place for katsu. Highly recommend the wasabi tonkatsu. We were seated upstairs, where it was less crowded. I would definitely return.","Tonkatsu was nice, however I\u2019d have preferred a thicker loin cut. Multiple fillings are available. Owner was able to speak English well. \u2026","They have a vegetarian set menu with tofu.","Recommended dishes","Vegetarian options","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","\u00A52,000\u20133,000","\u00A51,000\u20132,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Dinner","Cutlet"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This cozy restaurant serves delicious food at a reasonable price. The service is excellent and the staff speaks English. They offer a limited menu, including tonkotsu and miso pork cutlet, which are highly recommended. The best breaded tofu and juiciest tonkotsu make a great combination. The restaurant has a calm and lovely atmosphere and offers off-menu options for vegetarians."

Name: Katsukichi
Address: Japan, 100-0011 Tokyo, Chiyoda City, Uchisaiwaicho, 2 Chome23  B1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 55 reviews","4 stars, 59 reviews","3 stars, 28 reviews","2 stars, 8 reviews","1 stars, 4 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 11 am\u20132:30 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20132:30 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Saturday, Closed","Sunday, Closed","Monday, 11 am\u20132:30 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20132:30 pm, 5\u20139 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20132:30 pm, 5\u20139 pm"]
Reviews:
["A tonkatsu restaurant that I pass by every morning but have never been to before. I never looked at the menu because it didn't look very appetizing.

When I was having lunch at around 12:30 after the meeting, I was tired and wanted to eat pork cutlet nearby, and I wanted to eat some more at a nearby Starbucks on the way home, so I decided to go there.

Hmm, the menu is generally priced at over 2,000 yen. After thinking about it, I ordered a 3-piece set for 2,300 yen, which included fried shrimp, minced meat, and pork cutlet. For the rice, you can choose between white rice or green shiso, so I decided to go with blue shiso.

There was a long wait, maybe because of the tonkatsu dish, or maybe because it was crowded. Despite that, the shrimp fries were thin, the tonkatsu batter peeled off...I was expecting rice, but there was almost no flavor...which was quite disappointing. The only thing that was delicious was the nameko soup with red soup stock. If I'm going to pay 2,300 yen for this, I wonder if I'll eat something else in Ginza. Although it's in the neighborhood, I probably won't visit again.","I was here at lunchtime on Tuesday, they were swapped but staffs still kept smiling with great attitude. As their recommendation, I ordered something called ‘tokujo katsudon’ (the biggest one). I also got salad and pickles for free when I waited for my main food, it was all good thou. Btw, I was surprised when i got that katsudon. Firstly, a bowl was so big, its pattern looks like the traditional thing of Japan, it impressed me. And that food was so delicious, pieces look a bit thick, but fr, it’s easy to bite because of its tender, I wished I asked for more rice or they would have a bigger meat size to choose. Then, I got hot tea when I finished my meal. Restaurant’s atmosphere was fresh and the design was pretty too. My day was so perfect thank for Katsukichi, I’ll come with my friends and family the next time. High recommendation !!!!!!!!!","Available for lunch on weekdays. There was a line around 12:00, but it was empty as it was around 1:30pm. It's a bit slow, but it takes about 15 to 20 minutes for the food to arrive.
Ordered the loin cutlet set meal. It might be rude to say that it was worth the price, but it was very delicious.
I changed the cabbage!
Apparently they have chilled katsudon in the summer, so I'd like to try the chilled katsudon next time.

at a later date
Added a photo of chilled katsudon.
It was a refreshing bowl of Japanese ginger, plums, and perilla that was perfect for the hot summer!","We were not impressed by the food or the atmosphere. The service was good.

The pork was dry and overcooked. The rice was also dry; the soup had no flavor. We had a combo plate and our favorite thing on the plate was the pumpkin and the crab croquette.

We came for dinner on a Wednesday evening, and we were 1 of 3 tables occupied in the restaurant. The restaurant does not have a good atmosphere.

We would not recommend this place and we wouldn’t return.","Available for lunch on weekdays.
On this day, I will eat 150g of pork cutlet set meal. 2300 yen too.
Considering the location, the price is pretty good.
Satisfaction level is a little low considering the price.
Refills are available for rice, cabbage, and miso soup.
Is the cabbage cut too thin? Feels a little dry.
The waiting time from being seated to being served is also relatively long.
The taste of pork itself is not bad.","A favorite lunchtime restaurant of Japanese businessmen. The filet cutlets are exquisite! The fried oysters, a limited-time menu item from fall to spring, is a must-try. Free refills of rice. The hot jasmine tea after lunch is the best.","Very good quality Tonkatsu. (even though a bit pricy)
Just try to order bigger Tonkatsu rather than small cheaper one, which enable you to savor the true Tonkatsu flavor.","Excellent and delicious Katsu lunch. Had the 3 types of cutlet set which was really good. Love the Shiso Rice and Miso Soup too! Will definitely be back again :)","Fillet Cutlet Combo","Recommended dishes","Pretty good katsu","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 2","¥2,000–3,000","¥4,000–5,000","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 4","Service: 3","Meal type","Good food","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Food: 2","Food: 4","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "I tried a tonkatsu restaurant for the first time and ordered a 3-piece set menu for 2,300 yen, which included fried shrimp, minced meat, and pork cutlet. The shrimp was thin and the tonkatsu batter peeled off, but the nameko soup with red soup stock was delicious. I also tried the \"tokujo katsudon\" which was a big bowl of tonkatsu with a traditional Japanese pattern, and it was very delicious."

Name: Katsukichi
Address: Japan, 813-0034 Fukuoka, Higashi Ward, Tanotsu, 4 Chome723  1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 52 reviews","4 stars, 24 reviews","3 stars, 16 reviews","2 stars, 7 reviews","1 stars, 4 reviews"]
Reviews:
["Business run by the owner alone.
Although there was a signboard, the restaurant was reserved for private use, and there was no electricity, so I was unable to visit Katsukichi even though I lived in the neighborhood.

I ordered the special loin cutlet set meal (1100 yen excluding tax).
The fluffy and fragrant pork cutlet had a nice aroma of lard and pork, and was just the right thickness, and I ended up eating almost all of it with salt and mustard.
With this, you can also get a free refill of rice, and if you use the LINE friend coupon for the first time, it's only 910 yen, which is like a god.

Next time, let's try the thick-sliced ​​upper loin cutlet. I'm also curious about the taco rice.
I was also happy that they gave me a huge discount ticket for 300 yen off the set meal, although the expiration date was short. Will you give it to me every time?
That's an incredible service!
It's within walking distance and I plan to visit next week.","It's a small restaurant with a capacity of about 10 people, so it gets quite crowded during lunch. I had the loin cutlet lunch for 800 yen, and it also came with a small side dish and pickles, so it was a decent meal. The miso soup had a bit of a strong taste, but it had a lot of ingredients in it. It might be better to have a large serving of rice. The white rice is shiny and delicious! The taste of the tonkatsu is delicious, but the coating tends to peel off easily, so I have no choice but to eat it in one bite. The lady running the store is also very nice, so it's no wonder it's such a popular store. Regarding the menu of pork cutlet restaurants, there are quite a few restaurants that serve ``Champon''. It seems to be a popular menu item at this restaurant. The Champon from the pork cutlet shop is delicious.","I went there for Champon, but since I couldn't find it on the Friday lunch menu, I had the most popular thick-sliced ​​top loin cutlet. The batter was thin and the meat wasn't as tender as I expected.
It would have been better to have the special loin cutlet.
Taco rice has a large amount of rice.
The accompanying salad was better with lettuce instead of cabbage...
What bothered me was that the soup was salty.
Is it overcooked?
The restaurant is a little bit off the road so it's hard to find, but the interior was clean and I was able to eat in a relaxed atmosphere.
You will have to park at a nearby coin parking lot, but it will fill up depending on the timing.
I would like to go eat Champon someday as revenge.","As with any store, if you go when it's busy, you tend to get a bad evaluation of the service that you can see.
This time, it seemed like they were processing orders from inside the store at the same time as customers who had ordered dozens of bento boxes for takeout, so the wait time was quite long.
As a result, the thick-sliced ​​pork cutlet that was ordered and served was hard and not good. My clothes are also peeling off.
I want to support them somehow, so next time I'd like to go when it's not busy.","Probably my favorite tonkatsu✨

The batter is crispy, but the meat is moist and soft and the fat is delicious.
It's delicious whether you eat it with wasabi salt, yuzu salt, or sauce, and the rest is your choice.
It was delicious even without adding anything♪

I’m also happy that you get a free refill of rice 😊

・Special loin cutlet set meal 1,430 yen (dinner)","Visited for lunch.
There is a sign outside saying that we have started serving cutlet curry!
It was my first visit to a tonkatsu restaurant and I was wondering what cutlet …","I ordered the top loin cutlet,
The oil was not drained well and the back of the cutlet was sticky with oil.
Because of that, it didn't taste delicious at all. I'm sorry.","Visited on 2023.04.10.
It will be about a year since they moved.
He used to run a shop in Minami Ward, Fukuoka City. 11th anniversary in total. …","Came here around 12 PM to have lunch.
Please take a seat at the counter.
Ordered the loin cutlet set meal. …","2023.6
A store I was interested in.
Visit the store to avoid peak hours. …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 3","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 4","Service: 3","Meal type","¥1–1,000","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Food: 2","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere, located within walking distance. The manager is very friendly and offers great service. The special loin cutlet set meal is a highlight, with a fluffy and fragrant pork cutlet that has a nice aroma of lard and pork. The thick-sliced upper loin cutlet is also worth trying. The taco rice has a large amount of rice, and the miso soup has a strong taste. The tonkatsu is delicious, but the coating can peel off easily. The restaurant's menu also includes Champon, which is a popular item."

Name: PREMIER MAI
Address: Japan, 151-0063 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Tomigaya, 1 Chome610  2F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 106 reviews","4 stars, 60 reviews","3 stars, 21 reviews","2 stars, 8 reviews","1 stars, 27 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Thursday, 8 am\u20135 pm","Friday, 8 am\u20135 pm","Saturday, 8 am\u20135 pm","Sunday, 8 am\u20135 pm","Monday, 8 am\u20135 pm","Tuesday, 8 am\u20135 pm","Wednesday, Closed"]
Reviews:
["The exciting concept for brunch. All menus are very appealing and not the kind of menus you can find anywhere else (I am pretty decisive when it comes to menus, but it takes 20 minutes for me to decide, everything looks good and exciting that I want to try).

I ordered French Toast with Salad (add: melted cheese). The bread and cheese tasted so good; the bread texture was "mochi-mochi," I am pretty sure they are using premium bread, and the cheese was also decent. They add one stick of basil, so we can sprinkle it on our own, as much as we want. It was delicious and fulfilling compared to another brunch; I was not hungry until the evening.

I am a big café latte fan, so I ordered a café latte, and my friend ordered a matcha latte. The drinks are very aesthetic; and for the taste, it tastes the same as other coffee.
Only cold drinks are available for this type of drink because the staff said they need ice cube to make the gradation.

I ordered a long millefeuille Easter edition for dessert because it was adorable!! But this type of food takes much work to eat. Once you cut the pie, the crumble is scattered everywhere, and the taste is not what I expected.

Prepare your card because they do not accept cash, and be patient because this place is so famous that you must line up. Not only among the locals but it is also famous among tourists.
A small and pretty store with new menu ideas, it is worth trying occasionally.","Let's start with the hard part: a tiny restaurant located on the 2nd floor of a building whose only exterior detail is an Irish pub. Their signage is practically nonexistent.

That aside, we stumbled into this place while searching for brunch the other day and, after some apprehension caused by climbing an old, nondescript stairway to open a blank door, were greeted by a cozy, busy, and very lively grill, with bar seating and a few tables. The place is tight, but the lack of signage seems to leave a few spots open for opportunistic eaters.

What can I say about the menu, but that it's fun? The dishes are unique and interesting (if predictably Japanese-brunch; see thick toast and uncrisped bacon) with clear thought put into the presentation. The food was fantastic, and it was a pleasure to watch the cooks working away at the grill on the other side of the bar.

All in all, I'm glad I found this place, especially since it seems to do all it can to hide, and I will be returning.","No store sign outside of the building so it took awhile to find. The cafe entrance is on the the 2nd floor, no sign either. The interior is not spacious but comfortable and beautifully design. You will be asked to look at the menu online and they will take your order and pay at at the corner of the cafe, not at your table once you decide what you want. I think that might be due to the space being tight.

The overall presentation of the food is nicely done with beautiful color, two different kinds of hard boiled eggs served in egg holders, coffee served in a tall wine style glass gives a nice sophisticated touch. Food tasted good too. White toast is the base for meal and deserts.","Amazing little open kitchen feel with bar seating (in front of kitchen) or communal table.  Can’t make reservations but I went in on a Sunday morning and waited no more than 5 min.  The food was artisanal and the drinks are very nicely made. Very surprisingly nice and huge scoop passion fruit sorbet on the rim of the cold brew coffee.  Had the egg white omelette and kale salad on cheese crepe.  All very good.","The food was really good! I like the layout and ambience of the place as well. There is a teppanyaki like grill where they heat the bread to make toast, melt the cheese and make eggs etc. you can see the staff make your order if you sit at …","Really enjoyed our visit to Premier Mai this morning for breakfast.  We arrived just before opening time of 8am - really nice to find cafes open this ‘early’ in the area.  Both of these French Toast dishes were delicious. A bit …","Amazing experience. English-speaker friendly. Trendy atmosphere. The attention to detail by the staff was immaculate. I recommend sitting at the bar so you can watch the pros at work 🙃 …","Hidden cafe at the second floor of a building without sign. The caramelised French toast was amazing. Expect to wait especially during weekend.","Their shokupan is so good!!! I had the white egg omelette toast with bacon 😋 love it!! Definitely added to my fav cafe in Tokyo list!
💓 …","Hard to find spot with no sign but once you find it, you’ll be glad you did. It is not in the Tokyo Sake building! …","Cheese Toast, Oat Latte","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Breakfast","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Brunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "I visited Premier Mai for brunch and had a great experience. The menu is unique and exciting, with dishes like French Toast with Salad and melted cheese. The bread is premium and has a \"mochi-mochi\" texture, and the cheese is decent. I also ordered a café latte and matcha latte, which are aesthetically pleasing and taste like regular coffee. For dessert, I had the long millefeuille Easter edition, which was adorable but took a lot of work to eat. Be prepared to wait, especially on weekends, as this place is very popular."

Name: Mutekiya
Address: Japan, 〒171-0022 Tokyo, Toshima City, Minamiikebukuro, 1 Chome−17−1 崎本ビル1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 3,435 reviews","4 stars, 1,860 reviews","3 stars, 928 reviews","2 stars, 251 reviews","1 stars, 218 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, 10:30 am\u20134 am","Monday, 10:30 am\u20133:30 pm, 5 pm\u20134 am","Tuesday, 10:30 am\u20133:30 pm, 5 pm\u20134 am","Wednesday, 10:30 am\u20133:30 pm, 5 pm\u20134 am","Thursday, 10:30 am\u20133:30 pm, 5 pm\u20134 am","Friday, 10:30 am\u20133:30 pm, 5 pm\u20134 am","Saturday, 10:30 am\u20134 am"]
Reviews:
["Mutekiya, a bustling Ramen eatery nestled in Ikebukuro, stands out as one of the most frequented Ramen destinations in the area. As expected, the queues are long, a testament to its popularity. Anticipate a wait of approximately 30 minutes or more during peak dining hours. Although not one to typically queue for food, we decided to give it a try given the opportunity and my wife's keen interest.

The Ramen experience at Mutekiya proved to be worth the wait. The generous portion sizes satisfied our hunger pangs, and the flavors did not disappoint. As I savored each bite, I found myself mentally preparing to savor the meal after the extended wait, contemplating the value of time spent versus the culinary experience—a lighthearted internal debate, indeed.

For Ramen enthusiasts willing to invest an evening without time constraints, Mutekiya is a must-visit. Indulge in a fulfilling Ramen feast and relish the flavors at a leisurely pace, ensuring a dining experience that transcends mere sustenance.","無敵 or “muteki” means invincible, unrivaled or undefeatable. I’m not sure about all that, but the Mutekiya Ramen is quite close. Every single element and ingredient in the bowl was excellent. The soup seems thick and heavy, but it was almost refreshing. The noodles were cooked to perfection. The chashu pork slices were thick but succulent and crumbled in my chopsticks and melted in my mouth. The gyoza was great too. Two notes: there is plenty of english in the menu and all signboards, so no worries. And the restaurant is very cramped, so don’t bring your luggage, baby strollers or etc. otherwise, bring a book because there is always a queue — but it is very worth the wait. I will definitely be back!","Haven’t been here for few years. Big disappointment on the quality of their ramen.

We ordered No 1, No 4 and 1 pounder.
Their signature thick cut pork’s were so bad.
It’s dry and they don’t torch the pork at all. It’s very oily. Noodle was ok. Soup base was ok.

I didn’t finish the meat and left.

This legendary ramen place has turned into a tourist restaurant. I didn’t feel passion from their ramen anymore.

The male staff (manager or owner) kept looking at our bowls because he wanted us to get out asap.

Very disappointed meal.","The place was really small like the common restaurant in japan. My quing time its around 35 minutes which still ok and quite worth it comparing the taste of the food. Finally I can find ramen that I really like it and suites with my taste. The soup was really rich the meat even quite thick but so tender and juicy, the presentation is so tempting. The only lack of this place is they don’t serve draft beer. If they can that would be perfect place to have ramen.","Best ramen I've ever had! I've lived in Japan for three years and I've never had ramen as flavorful as this. The best part was the thick cut pork. The portion size is very generous. I arrived at about 8 pm and there was about an hour and a half wait time to be seated but IT IS WORTH THE WAIT! Also, they only take cash.","I’ve walked past this place a ton of times and wondered why it was so popular. The reviews are plentiful, but kinda all over the place. And there’s always a queue. So I decided to try it. I waited for about 40 minutes, but because they take …","As a tourist on m my 10th day in Japan from the U.S., I thought that Ichiran was amazing and as good as it was going to get. Now, I know they were more for the "show" and less about the ramen when compared to Mutekiya. This is the best …","Great experiences!
We did pass this restaurent for the first time 7 years ago and we finally did it in May 2024. It's worth for waiting. It's served in quite big portion. The soup …","I don’t really recommend unless you love the rich taste of pork bone soup and big chunk of char siu pork.
For me, I prefer clean taste of ramen soup cos I like to drink warm broth.","Visited the restaurant recommended by friends.

The Ramen noodles and soup tastes good.  Only the pork belly is a bit too dry …","Soup, Pork Meat, Roast Pork","Dumplings, Original Ramen","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","¥4,000–5,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 2","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "The Ramen at Mutekiya is a must-try experience. The generous portion sizes are served with a thick and heavy soup, cooked noodles, and delicious pork slices. The gyoza is great too. The restaurant may have long queues during peak hours, but it's worth the wait."

Name: Rokkasen
Address: Japan, 〒160-0023 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Nishishinjuku, 1 Chome−10−2 110ビル 10F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,695 reviews","4 stars, 561 reviews","3 stars, 148 reviews","2 stars, 51 reviews","1 stars, 68 reviews"]
Reviews: ["If you want top notch quality beef and service. This is the place to go. Definitely super nice and wish I was able to experience the tatami mat but was seated at a table but the service was exceptional. The food was super delicious and savory. It was pricey but you pay what you pay for. The sukiyaki was super delicious and savory as well. We went with the Tsuki-all you can eat, drink and sukiyaki. Was worth every yen! Make sure you do reservation or you aren\u2019t getting any seat super rare to do any walk in!","The Service here is absolutely top notch. Food was AMAZING. Definitely go for the beef, literally melts in your mouth. Didn\u0027t get the crab or lobster this time but definitely will get it next time we stop by. Highly highly recommend this place. Don\u0027t forget to ask about the ice cream.","Great buffet yakiniku with a tasty selection and good vibes. The staff are lovely and friendly. The location is convenient and easy to find. They offer beef, pork, chicken, seafood, and more. If you love all-you-can-eat, this place is perfect for you!","Service here is exemplary. Friendly and courteous from start to finish. They take care of you. Very active in changing the hand towels and barbecue wire gauze now and then, and in keeping the table clean as can be. Food was excellent, and \u2026","This was our first full day in Japan and we decided to try this place out. The food was decent/okay but the service was incredible! If you\u2019re looking for a place with eat-all-you-can yakiniku and seafood, you should try it here (and get the TSUKI course for the full experience, all courses are 120mins \u2026","we stumbled upon it by chance and were able to get a table for two without a reservation, which is very rare for a saturday night! really pleased with the service, everything is designed with the customer in mind. a nice bonus was the \u2026","Food is amazing! Staff is so kind and welcoming. More food than you can eat. Splurge on the better short rib and sirlion.. very nice lady explained shabu shabu since we had never had it","The food was really nice! The Atmosphere was kinda noisy tho, but its all about the food and that was GREAT! Somehow I liked the Sukiyaki more than the Yakiniku with premium meat.","The food and service here is absolutely amazing with every details. The person who took care of us is Rico - he is very sweet which made our meal more impressive. \u2026","Tongue, Ribs, Seafood","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","\u00A510,000\u002B","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Seafood","Food: 4","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant serves top-notch quality beef with excellent service. The food is super delicious and savory, especially the sukiyaki. The buffet yakiniku offers a tasty selection of beef, pork, chicken, seafood, and more. The staff is friendly and courteous, taking care of every need. The service is top-notch, making it a great experience."

Name: Rokkasen Annex
Address: Japan, 〒160-0023 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Nishishinjuku, 7 Chome−2−6 西新宿Ｋ－１ビル 地下１階
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 809 reviews","4 stars, 180 reviews","3 stars, 41 reviews","2 stars, 14 reviews","1 stars, 25 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Monday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Thursday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Friday, 11 am\u201311 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u201311 pm"]
Reviews:
["Really great experience here at Rokkasen. Unlimited Wagyu beef, crab legs, lobster tails, and whole bunch of other stuff to grill or put in sukiyaki.  Excellent quality of meat and seafood.

Hina, our server, was amazing. Always on hand to change our grill every so often. The dishes we ordered on the tablet were quickly served. Very friendly and courteous.","The all you can eat meat here was really tender and tasty, which we could eat it either as yakiniku or shabu-shabu.

The enjoyable experience was topped off by amazing service from Kenta who was extremely thoughtful and made sure to help us with frequent changes of plates and the grill to keep our meat fresh. Highly recommended!","This all-you-can-eat yakiniku restaurant is quite popular among Mandarin-speaking visitors. However, the meat quality is just average, so I suggest exploring other excellent yakiniku spots in Tokyo. While the food may not impress, the tea and service are both commendable, making for a decent dining experience overall.","Staff can speak well English, friendly and willing to help 👍🏻

Meats r fresh, 3-4rounda already can make u feel so full

The price included all you can drink (depends on the package u chose), beers, red/white wine

Will recommend fds to come for sure ❤️","The food is fantastic, their staff Kenta is very kind and he knows a lot of languages.its  very convince to someone who doesn’t know how to speak Japanese. Even though it’s not cheap, but the hospitality and quality deserve it!","What an amazing place for foodies!!! I ordered two All you can eat Gobe beef! It comes along with all you can crab/lobster, all you can drink, including unli bottled wine or unli bottled whisky ( if only you can :) :) :) ) …","Amazing Food. Definitely worth the price to try the Kobe.

Amazing Service, as you'd expect.

Amazing Waitress, named Hina. She said she's learning Korean! Bless her 😊🙏.

All in all a 5-star restaurant.","This is one of our all-time favorite Yakiniku restaurants. Furthermore, the service here is phenomenally excellent, our waiter, Kairu, make us feel more relaxed and enjoyable. Well done…Thank you.","Great food and service, totally out of our expectations.

Special thanks Hiro San (who speaks great Cantonese😎) for his great service! 🤜🏻🤛🏻","5 stars!!
Amazing food
Amazing service, amazing people
Come try the wagyu, the lobster and the soup!","オマール海老, 焼肉, フィレ, 和牛","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 5","¥6,000–7,000","Service: 5","Meal type","¥10,000+","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Food: 5","Dinner","扇貝, 燒肉"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This Japanese restaurant, Rokkasen, offers an amazing all-you-can-eat experience with unlimited Wagyu beef, crab legs, lobster tails, and other delicious seafood and meat options. The staff, including Hina and Kenta, are very friendly and helpful, making sure customers have a great time. The meat is tender and tasty, and can be enjoyed as yakiniku or shabu-shabu. With great service and a variety of dishes to choose from, including Wagyu, lobster, and soup, Rokkasen is highly recommended."

Name: Meika Seven
Address: 7 Chome-2-1 Ojima, Koto City, Tokyo 136-0072, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 160 reviews","4 stars, 155 reviews","3 stars, 109 reviews","2 stars, 26 reviews","1 stars, 26 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, 8:30 am\u20138:30 pm","Monday, Closed","Tuesday, 9:30 am\u20138:30 pm","Wednesday, 9:30 am\u20138:30 pm","Thursday, 9:30 am\u20138:30 pm","Friday, 9:30 am\u20138:30 pm","Saturday, 8:30 am\u20138:30 pm"]
Reviews:
["About 3 minutes walk from Oshima Station. This shop is famous for its thin-skinned bean paste bread. Visited around 11am on weekdays. There were still plenty of thin-skinned bean paste bread, raisin bread, and many other items left.
The thin bean paste bread is
There is grain bean paste or strained bean paste.
I bought the grained bean paste type.
It looks small, but it's heavy.
The ratio is 1 part bread dough and 9 parts grainy red bean paste.
Almost a grain of red bean paste. The best!
The bean paste is sweet and has a rich bean flavor.
The bread dough is moist and delicious.
This ratio is perfect for bean paste lovers.
This bean paste bread is quite filling and satisfying.
I want to buy raisin bread next time.
PayPay can be used.","Visited on a rainy day in June. "Usukawa Anpan", which is often seen on TV, is a specialty of New Tokyo that you should try at least once. If you go for a walk on a Saturday morning, you won't be able to buy it because it's sold out, but on a weekday, even though it was noon, there were about 10 koshian. Bean paste is sold out. lucky! 200 yen excluding tax. I also bought bread filled with raisins. I was worried that the anpan would be heavy on my stomach, but it was delicious and not too sweet. It goes with milk and coffee. The cooked bread also looked delicious.
The staff's response was good.
You can use paypay.
Next time, there was Ogura-an. I like this one.","We believe this to be the best bakery in the local area, if not in all of Japan. The head pastry chef has been awarded several medals for their exceptional plain bread, making it a must-try for anyone. However, the most renowned dish of this bakery is their thin cover anpan うすかわあんパン, filled with a generous amount of red bean paste and wrapped in a delicate, thin cover. We highly recommend giving it a try. It's important to note that the bakery only makes a limited number of anpan each day. To avoid missing out on this delectable treat, we recommend visiting the shop early.
Please note that the bakery is closed on Mondays.","Almost red bean paste. The weight feels amazing👍
When I made an online reservation for in-store payment, the strained red bean paste was sold out, but when I went to the store to pick up the crushed red bean paste, there was strained red bean paste, so I bought it!
The red bean paste was heavy, but not too sweet, and was delicious with tea.
240 yen including tax was a good value for money!","I stopped by Meika Seven, which is about a 3-minute walk from Oshima Station. This is a long-established bakery founded in 1958 in the shopping district called Hashi on Sun Road. …","This shop is famous for its thin-skinned red bean paste.
being introduced on TV
I was thinking, ``I'd like to go there sometime,'' and a friend of mine was …","It’s a small bakery shop where you can grab a quick snacks with fresh breads and coffee. Very friendly staffs and good snacks. I recommend this place.","The inside of the store is also nice. It's spacious and you can relax. The bread is also delicious! The price is also reasonable. …","Love the anpan bread! Bread layer is so thin and the bread is just filled with red bean paste! Really worth the buy!","Girls talk　まぁ〜、A shop that can","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Service: 5","Meal type","Breakfast","¥1–1,000","Service","Dine in","Food: 5"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This bakery is famous for its delicious anpan, a thin-skinned bread filled with a generous amount of red bean paste. I visited the shop around 11 am on a weekday and was able to buy the grained bean paste type, which has a perfect ratio of 1 part bread dough and 9 parts rich bean paste. The anpan is sweet and has a strong bean flavor, and the bread dough is moist and delicious. It's quite filling and satisfying, and the price is reasonable at 200 yen without tax. I also bought bread filled with raisins, which is another tasty option. The staff is friendly and responds well, and you can even pay with PayPay."

Name: AFURI Ebisu
Address: Japan, 〒150-0013 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Ebisu, 1 Chome−1−7 117ビル 1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,234 reviews","4 stars, 1,029 reviews","3 stars, 461 reviews","2 stars, 104 reviews","1 stars, 87 reviews"]
Reviews: ["Chasu in the rice bowl and ramen was very dry and rough. I did like the shio ramen broth though! Overall compared to other ramen places like Ichiran, this was just okay. The tsukemen was not as good as the ramen. If you\u2019re going to come here anyways, I\u2019d just stick to the ramen.","The lightest, freshest noodles! I live in Japan and I love coming here or to one of their other locations. Would recommend the summer special if they still have it. Note that it\u2019s cashless but you can pay with a train card eg pasmo Suica etc. You also sit at a bar, not a table.","I usually don\u0027t leave any bad reviews, but this time I feel really bad. I ordered a set of Chashu Rice Bowl, but most of the meat on the Chashu Rice Bowl was burned. I don\u0027t recommend ordering a Chashu Rice Bowl Set even if other people visit\nI thought it was coal","I passed by Afuri\u2019s Ebisu location last Tuesday around 8pm.
