It was a \u2026","The best bowl of ramen. The yuzu shio ramen broth is so light and refreshing. The Aburi Koro Chashu Gohan is amazing with the smoky chashu grilled over charcoal. Go for the set to have the best of both!","Outstanding yuzu based spicy ramen. If you like this flavor profile, then this bowl is going to be outstanding for you. Quick service, delicious food, cool atmosphere.","When we arrive, it didn\u2019t need to line up. The soup is very different from the ramen I\u2019ve had which is fresh. However, it would be better if it had more meat.","I think every things in Japan is getting expensive. Price here is a bit raised. But if you want to have yuzu ramen, here is the best choice!","Unique ramen/tsukemen concept that\u2019s very tasty! I had the yuzu dipping noodles which were light \u0026 delicious.","They have Konjac noodles, vegan noodle bowl, and a bunch of rice bowls","Great place to eat clear based ramen in Ebisu. Clean, tasty \uD83D\uDE0B \u2026","Wheat Noodle-Wavy Type, Grilled Pork, Chicken Oil, Shoiu Ramen","Grilled Pork, Soup, Fine Ramen, Shoiu Ramen","Rainbow vegan ramen available.","You don\u2019t have to add meat","Dietary restrictions","Recommended dishes","Vegetarian options","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 3","\u00A52,000\u20133,000","\u00A51,000\u20132,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Spicy Yuzu","Service: 1","Service: 3","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Food: 1","Food: 3","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "Here is a paragraph summarizing the reviews:\n\nMany people loved the shio ramen broth at Afuri, saying it's light and refreshing. Some reviewers thought the noodles at Afuri are the best, and the yuzu shio ramen is a must-try. Others enjoyed the Aburi Koro Chashu Gohan, which has smoky chashu grilled over charcoal. Some complained that the Chashu Rice Bowl was too dry and rough, but others loved it. The reviews also mentioned the unique ramen and tsukemen concepts, and some liked the vegan options."

Name: AFURI Harajuku
Address: Japan, 〒151-0051 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Sendagaya, 3 Chome−63−1 グランデフォレスタ原宿 1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 2,107 reviews","4 stars, 1,026 reviews","3 stars, 368 reviews","2 stars, 93 reviews","1 stars, 89 reviews"]
Reviews:
["I first discovered this restaurant 6 months ago, when I saw a gigantic line outside and became curious. I added it to my list and returned this August to find that there was no line and no wait 3:30pm on an extremely busy Sunday in Tokyo.

The menu has many options, but I tired their recommended yuzu ramen with pork, and my brother and I shared a portion of their pork fried rice.

What a delicious experience! This was one of the most unique bowls of ramen I’ve ever tasted. Slightly citrusy, not spicy, but very full of flavor. The pork was tender and had a really nice taste to it.

The fried rice really surprised us with how tasty it was! My brother liked the Yuzu beer as well.

Definitely check this place out if you’re considering visiting Tokyo and looking for a new twist on ramen!","I discovered AFURI Harajuku and had a fantastic experience. The restaurant's vegan ramen was terrific, with a rich and flavorful broth, perfectly cooked noodles, and various fresh, colourful vegetables. The atmosphere was lively and inviting, and I especially appreciated the ice-cold water they served, which helped keep me cool on a hot day. The friendly and efficient service made the overall dining experience a delight. I highly recommend AFURI Harajuku to anyone looking for delicious vegan ramen in a great setting.","The soup was unique and flavorful yet the pork chashu was disappointing.
We tried both the yuzu soup and ume soup, and both were delicious. The fruits’ aroma indeed could reduce the greasy heaviness of the ramen, and suitable for a warm summer day. Both the thin and thick noodles were boiled perfectly, the chewy texture of the dough was well preserved yet still easy to chew on.
However, the pork chashu was not soft enough, and the pork odor was not properly removed.","The yuzu ramen is fantastic! As was the yuzu beer. This place is super busy, so even later at night, there was a line. But ordering is fast and easy on the machine, and they get people in and out pretty quickly and efficiently so it wasn't a long wait. Really enjoyed this ramen!","I have had AFURI before at the Shinjuku location and this was my first time at their Shibuya location. The wait in line was about 30 minutes because it was a weekend. It was very delicious and the service was fast after ordering. This is a must try ramen when in Harajuku.","The yuzu ramen was one of the best ramens I’ve ever had. The chashu was grilled in front of you and had lots of flavor, complemented by the yuzu broth. We did have to wait for more than half an hour even though we came at 2pm on a Friday but it was well worth it.","This ramen shop, famous for its long online queues, is worth the wait. The yuzu ramen stands out with its unique aroma and flavor. For those who enjoy some heat, there’s a spicy option too. The char siu in the ramen and the char siu rice …","Best ramen EVER. We weren’t necessarily looking for the TikTok ramen hype. We stumbled across this restaurant while we were just looking for something to eat. OMG what a find. It’s a small restaurant but we arrived at a perfect time, no …","I visited many AFURI ramen shop in the other district in Tokyo, and this one offered nice cuisines and gave warm hospitality. The staffs are energy and willing to help, highly recommend to gourmet from overseas.","Tasty vegan ramen! Loved the clear broth very much. Came here twice for dinner and the second time I added extra yuzu in my soup. Extra yuzu made the ramen even more tastier! Definitely coming back here again :)","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","¥1,000–2,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Food: 3","Food: 4","Dinner"," More","Lunch","Vegan"]
AiReviewSummary: "The reviews of AFURI Harajuku are overwhelmingly positive. The yuzu ramen is a standout dish, with a unique and flavorful broth and tender pork. The fried rice is also a popular choice, and the vegan ramen is a great option for those looking for a plant-based meal. The atmosphere is lively and inviting, and the service is friendly and efficient. Some reviewers have noted that the pork chashu can be disappointing, but overall, the restaurant is a must-try for anyone visiting Tokyo."

Name: AFURI Azabujuban
Address: Japan, 〒106-0045 Tokyo, Minato City, Azabujuban, 1 Chome−8−10, Vort Azabu Juban III, 1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 438 reviews","4 stars, 412 reviews","3 stars, 175 reviews","2 stars, 50 reviews","1 stars, 34 reviews"]
Reviews:
["This is hands down my favorite ramen spot! I always order the Yuzu ramen with their recommended pork—it's absolutely delicious. I've been to another branch and ordered the same, consistently great.

All seating is at the counter, and there's a convenient storage area for your bags. They also have a machine at the entrance for easy ordering, which I find very convenient","Flavorful and delicious ramen, yet light and with good variety of choices to choose from the menu. I especially like their tsukemen set with yuzu dipping sauce and charsiu rice bowl. They even have mini sizes ramen which are great for kids. Sitting is comfortable as well, more spacious than typical ramen restaurants.","Chicken broth ramen, excellent choices, hot and savory - love the simple ordering upfront, water at the counter, and spaces for your packs and items in the back. While the grilled pork on the top wasn't the best, the ramen underneath and the ramen soup was very delicious.","Awesome ramen here though I’d think twice about getting both the chashu rice and a beer too. Unless you’re starving, it’ll leave you pretty bloated! Definitely the yuzu ramen, half chicken, half pork. Shoyu or shio, up to personal taste though I lean towards the shio.","Randomly walked past this ramen shop on a crowded stretch of Azabujuban. Seemed pretty modern and had quite a few tourists. To my surprise the food was very good. Yuzu soup ramen and tsukemen were both great. Service is quick with no frills.","I had the yuzu ratan ramen. The broth was very light and very flavorful. The thin noddles were cooked prepared perfectly.  My only gripe was I wish the regular portion of noddles was larger.","Order and pay at the machine at the front of the shop. The chef's will tell you where to sit. The Yuzu broth is excellent. Your taste buds will love you for eating here","The yuzu ramen with grilled pork is highly recommended. If you find yourself in the neighborhood, it's certainly worth trying! Wonderful first experience in Tokyo.","dipping ramen is a lot better than soup ones

good if you are looking for sth new to try","Super nice.  Vegetarian options are limited and you cannot add tofu but still very nice.","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","Vegan Ramen","Service: 5","Service: 3","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Food: 3","Dinner"," More","Ramen","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This ramen shop is a favorite among customers, with many raving about the Yuzu ramen with recommended pork. The restaurant has a modern feel and plenty of space to sit, with convenient storage areas for bags. The ramen is delicious and flavorful, with options like tsukemen sets with yuzu dipping sauce and charsiu rice bowls. Some recommend the chicken broth ramen and shoyu or shio variations. The service is quick and the atmosphere is nice, making it a great spot to try something new."

Name: Afuri Shinjuku Lumine
Address: Japan, 〒160-0023 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Nishishinjuku, 1 Chome−1−5 ルミネ1 B2F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 702 reviews","4 stars, 473 reviews","3 stars, 191 reviews","2 stars, 54 reviews","1 stars, 40 reviews"]
Reviews:
["I love this place so much 😍 It was a great experience ✨

Yuzu Ratan Ramen was the best. It was not spicy, it was sour and smell was very good. I do recommend a thin noodle 👍🏻

We went there for dinner and didn't have to wait. You can order through the machine in front of the restaurant. You can also add chicken, thin noodles, and other things to your bowl to make it your own.  You'll get a ticket after placing your order, and then you can sit down at the bar. Your order will be picked up by staff. The food came to us very quickly.

The only places to sit were at the bar. The staff were very helpful. Price was adorable for 1 bowl of ramen. Definitely will visit again 🥺

It a must try for ramen lovers 🍜","We arrived around 9:00 PM, and there was a short queue. However, it didn’t take long (probably around 10 minutes) until it was our turn. We ordered the recommended ramen from the menu: yuzu ramen in soup and yuzu tsuke men. It’s a nice touch to have the option of chicken breast and konjac noodles for people on a low-carb diet. The soup base is light and balanced, and pork belly were delicious. (Perhaps should have ordered the set with pork belly rice on the side!?) The staff service were excellent, and I love the minimalistic cafe style deco.","Finding this restaurant was a little difficult, but it was worth it. it was pretty easy to order (as someone who doesn’t speak japanese), and the wait wasn’t too long. also i was surprised that they offer low carb noodles for anyone who is health conscious. thank you for a good hearty meal.","The joint is located in Lumine 1.

There was a short queue but it moved pretty fast. You order at the machine and wait for your turn to be seated.

I ordered the recommended yuzu noodles. The fragrance is distinct. Honestly there’s nothing to shout about.

Most patrons are tourists.","Easily one of the best bowls of ramen we've had during our visit to Japan. Afuri has a unique style of shoyu ramen with yuzu added. It's incredibly light and refreshing but packs a flavorful punch. We enjoyed this location because it has a …","I love Afuri ramen, especially the yuzu ratan ramen. I always get chicken chashu with thick noodles and extra yuzu. So delicious and hits just the right spot. This is probably the only ramen I can eat over and over again! I wish they have …","Very popular ramen chain with a unique yuzu flavour that can be chosen among the other common flavours.  There are options to change your noodles (original thin, thick wavy, or Konjac noodles), customize the soup (oil level), and create …","I had one of the best bowls of ramen I've ever had here. I didn't know how good Yuzu could be in ramen and I'm so glad now I do. The best choice here is the Tonkotsu Ramen cold. They also recommend the rice bowl with pork which I didn't …","I didn’t know I needed some yuzu ramen in my life until I came to Afuri. Go for the tsukumen version if you want that flavor punch. Very interesting indeed and atypical.","Popular ramen restaurant, if arrived late will need to queue up.
Arrived around 11 something, and had  waited for 30 minutes until we get a seat. …","i don’t eat pork or beef so i’m happy this place offers chicken and vegetarian options.","Spicy Yuzu, Ramen, Yuzu","Dietary restrictions","Recommended dishes","Roasted Pork, Yuzu","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant is so good that I want to go back! The yuzu ratan ramen is amazing, it's not spicy, instead it's sour and smells great. You can customize your bowl by adding thin noodles, chicken, and more. The food comes quickly and the staff is very helpful. The price is low and the decor is modern."

Name: Afuri Roppongi Crossing Gate
Address: Japan, 〒106-0032 Tokyo, Minato City, Roppongi, 4 Chome−9−4 ＵＦビル ４ 1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 503 reviews","4 stars, 413 reviews","3 stars, 228 reviews","2 stars, 62 reviews","1 stars, 45 reviews"]
Reviews:
["We arrived in Japan pretty late and got stuck at immigration lines, so finding Afuri open till late was a life saver. This was my first time trying Tsukamen and I enjoyed it a lot. You order with a vending machine which has English options as well. People come and go quick as they eat so try not to take too long when here.","The yuzu flavoured soup for the ramen was interesting and made for a pleasant meal. The lean pieces of char siu was also nice though I left without fully feeling satisfied, perhaps from a more hearty stock that traditionally comes with ramen. However, this may still be worth trying if you're into different styles of ramen.","I had Afuri twice during my stay in Tokyo as this is literally right in front of my hotel. Self service machines. Once you ordered and paid, the Ramen came really fast. I had two different kinds of yuzu broth and two different thickness of the noodles. Both amazing. Great place if you are craving for ramen!","Fast, friendly, reliably excellent flavor. I always get an extra egg. Great vibes, honestly.

This place makes me happy when the world is too intense. Just came from Roppongi Hills. Depressing exhibit followed by delicious food. Totally worth the journey.","One of the best Ramen in Tokyo :) I visited a few times during my trip last week. The ramen and Tsukemen are great, you will like the Yuzu-flavored Ramen here❤️You may come here after visiting the Tokyo Tower, as it's not far away from Shiba koen (芝公園).","We were trying to get into our normal Ramen place in Roppongi one night, but there was a long line so we we decided to look for another Ramen place nearby, and ended up at “Afuri.” Afuri is a sort of alternative to regular ramen.  They have …","The self-service machine ordering mobile phone we used has received a successful deduction message, but the merchant said that the payment was not received. We are very grateful to the clerks who have been patiently helping us solve these …","Good ramen, self service machine helped us (non-Japanese speakers) to know exactly what we’re ordering. Staff were professional and nice. Good option for a quick lunch. The yuzu infused broth was lovely.","Came here because a lot of people said its unique and delicious ramen.

We orderes 2 dishes, pork rice bowl and yuzu shio ramen. …","Loved the amount of veggies in the vegan ramen, but the broth could use a little more flavor. Cosy place, beautiful presentation.","Price per person","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "Here's a summarized review of Afuri Ramen: Afuri Ramen is a great option when craving ramen. You can order with a vending machine and enjoy different styles like Tsukamen and Yuzu-flavoured ramen. They serve lean char siu and good vibes. Even with self-service machines, the ramen arrives quickly. I had two types of yuzu broth and noodles, both amazing! Many people love the Yuzu-flavored ramen, and the veggies in the vegan option were generous, although the broth could be stronger. Good option for a quick lunch or dinner."

Name: Afuri Roppongi Hills
Address: Japan, 〒106-0032 Tokyo, Minato City, Roppongi, 6 Chome−4−1 ヒルズメトロハット/ハリウッドプラザ B2F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 471 reviews","4 stars, 330 reviews","3 stars, 134 reviews","2 stars, 37 reviews","1 stars, 30 reviews"]
Reviews: ["Great place. You can choose your own noodle thick or thin. They even have low carb noodles. I pick the thick one with their recommended yuzu shio soup. It\u2019s great. Strong yuzu taste. My daughter has the spicy which also good for spice lover. I like the noodles so chewy not too soft. And I like how they fire your pork right away for your ramen.","Pretty good Ramen. The yuzu broth was a nice little flare to this standard meal. The citrus added to the broth and the rice bowl was a nice change of pace from the standard fare but other than that this place wasn\u0027t too much to write home about. I had the yuzu shio ramen set with thick noodles.","This was our first Afuri experience...staff members were working hard to deliver the food for us....this place also gets busy....not difficult to get a seat...the price is a bit high but reasonable....it has a very good vibe dining here....food quality is great...","So surprised. No lines here at dinner time!  I went to the one in Shinjuku Lumine for 2 days and it took more than an hour to wait   even it\u0027s 20.30 hrs where they gonna close already. So I decided to come to this branch instead. This one \u2026","Order at the screen outside, get a ticket and find a seat. My wife had yuzu beer which was delicious and the vegan ramen was really good too. In and out quick, high quality food, good location.","Ordered the signature Yuzu Shio Ramen with double chicken oil, tastes fresh and the texture of noodle is good, not to mention the chashu, I think I feel the \u2018doink doink\u2019 texture in my mouth. \u2026","I greatly enjoyed the recommended ramen, half the family agreed. Reasonable wait time, the five of us split up into two groups to find counter seats.","Best yuzu shio ramen in Tokyo with a distinctive nice soup base. I\u2019d come here again whenever I visit tokyo!","My favorite ramen of my Japan visit so far. The spicy ratan ramen was excellent.","Chewy cold ramen is yum\uD83D\uDE0B\nDipping sauce is delicious wz white sesame \u2026","Rainbow Vegan Ramen","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","\u00A52,000\u20133,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service\u2026","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant serves delicious ramen with a variety of options, including thick and thin noodles and a yuzu shio soup that is tangy and full of flavor. The staff is friendly and efficient, and the atmosphere is cozy and welcoming. The yuzu beer and vegan ramen are also popular choices. One reviewer says it's the best yuzu shio ramen in Tokyo and they would definitely come back."

Name: Afuri Nakameguro
Address: Japan, 〒153-0051 Tokyo, Meguro City, Kamimeguro, 1 Chome−23−1 1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 661 reviews","4 stars, 505 reviews","3 stars, 260 reviews","2 stars, 56 reviews","1 stars, 47 reviews"]
Reviews:
["Vegetable Ramen Delight for Veggie Day

This was our second visit to Afuri, and we were just as impressed as the first time we dined at their Ebisu location.

I tried the veggie ramen and was pleasantly surprised by how flavorful and satisfying it was. The broth was rich and flavorful, and the vegetables were almost cooked to perfection. I especially enjoyed the daikon radish, asparagus, broccoli, fresh tomatoes, and mizuna greens. The noodles had a great al dente texture, and the garlic added a nice kick of flavor. While there was a slight burn on some of the asparagus, overall, this was a delicious and healthy meal.

The service was friendly and courteous. The staff was helpful in answering my questions about the ingredients.

I initially planned to order the summer special: cold yuzu shio ramen because of the poster located in front of the vending machine. But I changed my mind when I learned it was Vegetable Day in Japan.

I also learned from my kid that Afuri is a place, a mountain actually. The restaurant's decor features umbrellas, which are perfect for rainy days and add a touch of charm.

We had a great experience at Afuri Naka-Meguro. The food was delicious, the service was friendly, and the atmosphere was inviting.","If you like shio (salt) or shoyu (soy sauce) ramen, then Afuri ramen is the place to go -- also especially if you are female! Afuri is the first ramen shop in Japan that wanted to create a nice ramen experience for women. Most of the regular ramen shops in Japan are usually packed with salarymen slurping their noodles, but Afuri changed all that and now has many locations in Tokyo. I like the shio ramen best -- the broth is very light and smooth. The chashu is also very tasty since it's flamed grilled. The noodles are thin, but you can order thicker noodles instead. The atmosphere is very chic and comfortable. I've visited the Naka-Meguro and Ebisu locations and they're both within walking distance from the train. Note: Cash is not accepted, only cards (including IC cards). If you are looking for tonkosu ramen, then Afuri is not for you -- that's the one type I wish they served, but you can't go wrong with other offerings. Enjoy!","The signature ramen is with Yuzu flavored soup. It has a rich flavor, but tastes light and refreshing, with the al-dente ramen is such a perfect match! It’s a popular ramen restaurant. The good thing is that it doesn’t take a lunch break, and opens till 11 pm. You can come at a quiet time to avoid crowds.","A hip place with vending machine ordering. We tried the tsukemen here and it was very good. I ordered a chicken cold tsukemen. It was a very hot day so the tsukemen was very refreshing. The chicken was fresh and the broth was not too salty. I enjoyed this place very much!","Food was only okay given its price, didn't quite enjoy the grilled chicken on rice; it was very dry. The dipping noodles were okay, didn't like the yuzu flavour but that's my personal preference. Service was good. One bowl per person minimum.","Accidentally pass by when we go to nakameguro area and looking for lunch. Yuzu shio ramen turned out so delicious with refreshing for the day. We went ~11.30am on weekday and it was no queue. The staffs are friendly with warmly greeting. …","Light broth with refreshing yuzu. Perfect when you're tired of strong flavours.  I ordered the tsukemen with chicken and kakuni and enjoyed it thoroughly. Don't forget to ask for the soup in the end to add to your tare","solid ramen option among the many places around the city. The vegan ramen has great flavor and is served piping hot. The service is perfect, with the team offering a smiling and warm welcome.","One of a must eat noodle joint fof me every time to Tokyo. It is just simply fantastic in taste, yet the price and portion is reasonable, services are ok.","Great atmosphere and the shoyu ramen is really amazing! Definitely recommend and you need to give it a try. Staff is friendly and give a really good vibe","Spicy Yuzu, Shoyu Plain Ramen, Rice Bowl, Vegan Ramen","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","Yuzu, Ramen","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 5","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "We had a wonderful experience at Afuri Naka-Meguro. The food was delicious, especially the Vegetable Ramen on offer for Veggie Day. The flavorful broth was rich and satisfying, with a variety of vegetables such as daikon radish, asparagus, broccoli, fresh tomatoes, and mizuna greens. The noodles had a great al dente texture, and the garlic added a nice kick of flavor. The service was friendly and courteous, making it a great spot for a meal."

Name: Afuri Karakurenai Shinjuku Subnade
Address: Japan, 〒160-0021 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Kabukicho, 1 Chome−2−2, Shinjuku Subnade Building, B1F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 516 reviews","4 stars, 256 reviews","3 stars, 97 reviews","2 stars, 32 reviews","1 stars, 17 reviews"]
Reviews:
["Afuri Karakurenai Shinjuku Subnade
is located at Subnade building B1F. People can find this restaurant easily cause of Its bright red color design.

After we bought the ramen and drink tickets from the machine, we handed the tickets to the friendly staff.  There are 8 spice levels and the super extreme spice level that you can choose from. We ordered Yuzu Kara Kurenai ramen spicy 1290 yen (mild spicy level 1,2, 3) Don’t really want to challenge our stomachs with too spicy ramen.

We were escorted to the counter seats and ordered Yogurt drink w yuzu (430 yen each). We found that this yummy yogurt drink complimented the spicy ramen perfectly.

The chefs cooked the ramen in front of us. We enjoyed watching the the chefs focus cooking the ramen at the  kitchen. The spicy broth was perfectly complemented by the sourish yuzu flavour.

If you want to try spicy ramen other than the usual shio ramen (salt ramen), shoyu ramen (soy sauce ramen), or miso ramen (fermented bean paste ramen), wakayama ramen, ramyeon ramen, tonkotsu ramen, then Afuri Spicy ramen will be  your choice.","After 2 weeks in Japan I was really craving for spicy food.

My friend recommended Afuri and it was not dissapoint!

I chosed spicy level 8 and it was enough. I think more than this level would be no more other Flavour.

The tangy and spicy went well together. The service is good, Efficient and fast.

The original yuzu one also very very good. All the topping were amazing from the tender chicken slices to the pork.

Yuzu lassi was life saver after the level 8 spicy ramen.

If you are a bit sick of rich pork broth ramen and want something fresh (and spicy) to reset your palate. This is the go to ramen store for sure.

I would visit them again if I try this store early during the trip.","Spicy noodle/ramen shop with spicy level from 1-8, then 28!  I tried the level 8, spicy but can go higher, not sure if I can do level 28, likely not enjoyable.  The broth has the Chinese numbing spice which I didn’t like too much.  Otherwise the noodle and meat were done well, and broth was tasty.  Price was a bit on the pricy side but still reasonable.","Delicious tsukemen. Chewy thick noodles. The dipping soup is mildly spicy, flavorful, and rich as I prefer. They have different level of spiciness to choose as well. They also have choices between chicken and pork, so I chose chicken this time. The meat is so soft. And not to mention staff is friendly and welcoming. Highly recommended.","Tried level 28 spicy Yuzu Kara Kurenai Ramen (hells fire). Be warned, it truly is spicy, but also delicious. Yuzu flavour was still present despite the heat, the egg was gorgeous, and the braised pork belly was delicious. The level 28 ramen comes with some kind of stomach ache relief medicine.","Very interesting ramen besides the traditional style. The spicy ramen was served in cold with room temperature dipping sauce. The meat was tender, juicy while the tendon was not so soft, excellent stew. It went well with yogurt drink. The …","Very close by from the Shinjuku station! You order off the machine then give your receipt to the staff at the table, swift and easy. They’re very kind too. Take a seat at the counter, put on your bib to prevent stains, and chow down. …","Afuri with a spicy twist. No waits at around 1pm on a weekday.

Take note mild spicy (level 2) can be quite spicy! Braised pork char siu is a …","Spicy soup impressed me. Grapefruit flavor also made ramen fresh. All mix together brought me to a whole new world. Good job AFURI!","Very tasty ramen !
Recommend!
There's also a spicy ramen, which is good too …","Seasoned Soft-Boiled Eggs, Mixed Spicy Noodle","Recommended dishes","Spicy Miso Noodle","Price per person","Atmosphere: 4","Atmosphere: 5","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 4","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Dinner"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "Here is the paragraph summary of the reviews with simple English:\n\nMany people like Afuri Karakurenai Shinjuku Subnade for its unique spicy ramen. The restaurant has different levels of spiciness, from 1 to 8, and even a level 28 that's super hot! They offer yummy dishes like Yuzu Kara Kurenai ramen with a sourish yuzu flavor, and their yogurt drink with yuzu is a perfect complement. The chefs cook the ramen in front of the customers, and the service is efficient and friendly. The customers can choose between chicken and pork, and the meat is always soft and tender."

Name: Ramen Kamo to Negi
Address: 6 Chome-4-15 Ueno, Taito City, Tokyo 110-0005, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 2,304 reviews","4 stars, 1,570 reviews","3 stars, 652 reviews","2 stars, 167 reviews","1 stars, 159 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, 9 am\u20134 am","Monday, 9 am\u20134 am","Tuesday, 9 am\u20134 am","Wednesday, 9 am\u20134 am","Thursday, 9 am\u20134 am","Friday, 9 am\u20134 am","Saturday, 9 am\u20134 am"]
Reviews:
["Woke up early to try duck ramen. Got there around 8:50am. About 10 ppl ahead of me. You have to purchase before waiting in line.
You get to sit in a small chair before they open. First few people were asked what 2 toppings they wanted out of the 3 ( red onions, scallion, bamboo shoots).
I got the normal size which was 980 yen. Luckily I did because the ramen wasn't good at all. Visually it looks great but wasn't. I love ramen and I was so hyped for this duck ramen. I tasted the broth first to see what it taste like but oily broth. I mixed the toppings around to get a deeper flavor.. Nope then I added yuzu and shichimi to enhanced the flavors. Still a nope... Then I added a scoop of yuzu lol... Wasn't satisfied at all. Didn't finish the broth as you can see how oily it was.

Left hungry still so I ended up going to a konbini and get me a famichiken.
Remember to always buy normal size instead of going bigger first if you never been to this place or anywhere else.","Arrived on a saturday around 1145am just in time for brunch. Key point to note is to choose and pay for the meal ticket before starting to queue. I queued for about an hour. They have mandarin speaking staff too in case you need some help. …","An utterly stellar bowl of ramen can be found here. The specialty is a broth made with just water, duck, and negi which creates an intensely deep soup that is brimming with umami. Upon coming to the restaurant you will need to select your …","God ramen. Came here 3 times during our stay. You cannot beat the value here, the duck tastes like it could be on a Michelin star menu. The okayodon is better than some specialty places. The broth is delicate but nuanced. The …","Best ramen I have ever had.  The aroma of the soup is incomparable.  Recommend the dip noodle (with thicker noodles) most.  A bit of a line when we arrived at 7 pm on a Friday.  Waited for 30 minutes to get seated.  CASH ONLY.","Had the house special with leek (the leek is an option, strongly recommended).

Excellent soup base with strong but not overwhelming flavours.  Tender meats and well textured noodles with some elasticity.","The soup of the duck noodle is amazing.
It’s heavy and the amount of oil on top is just nice.
The duck meat is well marinated that it’s so tender juicy. …","Must eat place in Tokyo.
Remember to purchase your food tickets at the machine before lining up.
A staff is outside to monitor and help the line. …","Overall, I will come back if I'm in the area! A fresh tasting ramen that didn't leave me feeling heavy at the end. …","Hi,

I tried your duck ramen recently, and it was fantastic! The stock was clear and …","Atmosphere: 5","Service: 5","Food: 2"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "The reviewer tried duck ramen at this restaurant, but unfortunately, it didn't meet their expectations. The broth was oily and didn't have a good flavor, even with added toppings. They ended up not finishing the ramen and had to get something else to eat from a konbini. However, others had a positive experience, saying the broth is intense and full of umami, the duck tastes like Michelin-star quality, and the noodles are well-textured. Some even said it's the best ramen they've ever had."

Name: Soba House Konjiki-Hototogisu
Address: Japan, 〒160-0022 Tokyo, Shinjuku City, Shinjuku, 2 Chome−4−1 第22宮庭マンション 1階105号室
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,012 reviews","4 stars, 712 reviews","3 stars, 279 reviews","2 stars, 78 reviews","1 stars, 123 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, Closed","Monday, Closed","Tuesday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Thursday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20133 pm"]
Reviews:
["amazing food, subpar service and hospitality. you are not allowed to take photos inside the restaurant, groups over 4 are not allowed and they are not accommodating to vegetarians at all (had a sign saying that and if you are a group accompanied by a vegetarian they will not let the vegetarian into the restaurant as well). the whole experience felt rushed as there were plastic signs in the restaurant *everywhere* that told customers to eat quickly and that they are not allowed to be on their phones or have “long conversations” which i understand is important because of the people waiting outside the restaurant, but the signs were everywhere and it did ruin the atmosphere. i have been to two other michelin restaurants in tokyo which had lines waiting outside while i was served and in neither of those was i told to not have long conversations and i didnt feel rushed. however i did enjoy the food a lot and if you can get over the rushed aspect i would recommend it.","Not woth the 2hr wait. We STOOD in the line at 11:45am and didn't get in until 01:45pm. This was no  Taylor Swft concert! Then we had a 5-minute wait for food. We ordered the Tsuke special and the Shoi special, and we had better at our local, no-name ramen joint around the corner from our hotel. Cost us just over 3000 yen for the 2 of us.
Remember that solar noodles are served traditionally cold, so the Tsuke special was cold. It's not ideal on a rainy cold day. Egg was cooked to perfection.
I won't be going back. It was like the scene at the Seinfeld Soup shop. Too regimented in the lineup, time to eat, and only photo of food inside. Not clear signage for the ticketting system either. We waited in line for 10 minutes before we realised that people were getting tickets before lining up. There are so many other ramen places that are not trying to be something...just serving good ramen!","MAR 2024

Arrived a few minutes after they opened and got in line after getting a ticket number from the machine. Wait time was close to an hour before I got in. Once you place your order from the ticket machine your ramen will be ready in a few minutes. I've ordered the shio (salt) soup base which is their most popular. The soup uses clams and red sea bream so it has a pretty strong seafood umami but not fishy. The ramen also has flavor packed toppings including white truffle oil, pancetta bacon bits and inca berry sauce to change up the taste with each slurp. The ramen was tasty and quite unique with the toppings, worth trying but wouldn't revisit if I need to wait more than half an hour, especially if the weather is bad.","Ramen is incredible- obviously the Michelin star speaks for itself. You must go early, get in line for a ticket. Once you get the ticket you wait for a text or in our case an email to confirm a time frame to come back for your seat. You order on a machine and wait a bit more before being seated at an actual table or counter. Once seated you must eat quickly and that is made very obvious by the signs posted, a person watching how far along you are and the cooks themselves watching you eat. You come here for the food only, no hanging out, no drinks other than water, and get moving.
That being said, the soba noodles are outstanding and the broth is excellent. Well worth the experience!","The restaurant still has their Michelin star despite what the other posts are saying. My experience started at 10:30 when we got our ticket. During that time we wandered into the national garden to kill time and was called in at 12:15.

The food was fantastic, the bowls are quite large and the taste was perfect. Each bite was consistent and not overly saturated.

There is a washroom inside.","After queuing for an hour, we got inside to the machine to order our food only to realise almost everything is sold out. Only the meat bowl was left in their “recommended” section with some other basic shio ramen. All eggs were sold out . …","Let me just start and say the Ramen was great, very flavorful!!
But all over was horrible, the line is pretty long but at least they work with a QR code which is good, but by the time it was our turn, most of the Ramen …","My first Michelin star Ramen experience. It just hits differently.

Ordered the Special Shio Soba and they did not disappoint!!! The soup had a rich …","This is a famous ramen restaurant that I’d been meaning to try for a long time. It’s one of three Michelin star ramen restaurants in Tokyo. …","Very good ramen 🍜. It has a system where you get a number and an indication of time where you're gonna be called. …","this restaurant is not vegetarian they have 0 vegetarian options and are not willing to accommodate.","Recommended dishes","Vegetarian options","Recommended Ramen","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","¥3,000–4,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Service: 3","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 3","Dinner"," More","Lunch","Ramen"]
AiReviewSummary: "The reviews were mixed, with some enjoying the food but being dissatisfied with the service and atmosphere. The Tsuke special was cold, which not everyone enjoyed, while the Shoi special was well received. The ramen was unique with toppings such as white truffle oil and inca berry sauce. The prices were around ¥3,000-4,000 per person."

Name: Sōsakumen Kōbō Nakiryū
Address: Japan, 〒170-0005 Tokyo, Toshima City, Minamiotsuka, 2 Chome−34−4 ＳＫＹ南大塚 １F
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,429 reviews","4 stars, 582 reviews","3 stars, 252 reviews","2 stars, 70 reviews","1 stars, 112 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Tuesday, Closed","Wednesday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Thursday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20133 pm"]
Reviews:
["This is the recent English review you are looking for:

Reservation:
Reservation is simpler now than before. On the day you want to go eat you can go to the restaurant early in the morning (from 8am) and there will be an iPad at the door on which you reserve a time slot for you and your party. I came at 8.15am on a Wednesday and there was slots open at 11, 1130 and later. I chose the 1130 one and got a ticket and returned to my hotel.

At around 1120 I arrived again and waited outside for about 5 minutes before one of the staff came outside and looked at our ticket and brought us in. Much better than standing in line 2-3 hours which I did last year!!

I saw some people coming around 1120 to reserve at the iPad and they still go seats later in the day.

Food:
Food is pretty delicious with various side dishes. I had tantanmen this time and shoyu ramen last time. I dont like it too spicy, but the tantanmen wasn't too spicy so I was able to eat it. I however liked the shoyu one better :)","Nakiryu Ramen definitely lived up to the hype! This 1 Michelin star ramen spot offered the best ramen I've ever had to date. I opted for the tonkatsu, and it was phenomenal. The broth was creamy with deep umami flavors and had a nice kick to it. The pork was incredibly tender, simple yet elegant in flavor.

For those planning to visit, I recommend arriving at the restaurant around 7:30-8:00 am to guarantee seating. You choose the time you want to eat at, with 11 am being the earliest slot. The ticket counter provides a ticket for your chosen time, and you return at that time to order your ramen at the machine.

Additionally, the gyoza was outstanding! Overall, Nakiryu provided an exceptional dining experience that I highly recommend.","This place was incredible. The presenation, ambience, flavors were close to perfection. We had the Tantanmen. The broth was so rich and flavorful. I could not help but wish I could keep eating it! Noodles were perfectly cooked. We also had the shrimp dumplings and pork bowl which were also delicious. They do serve a limited number of people per day. We for there around 8am and was able to get a reservation for 11am on a Wednesday morning. The reservation is done through a tablet. This was our favorite Michelin star ramen in Tokyo! We can’t wait to come back during our next trip to Japan!","I went here before they opened 1 hours .But we got 18-19th in a line then waited 1 hour more (1+1=2hours waiting). The my best dish here is a side dish slow cooked chicken with sauce.The sauce was tangy,savory and a little sweet with very crunchy sesami+peanut and a lot of fragrant from sesame oil that I never never had🤩.Tantan ramen was so great .Then if you want to skip the line you can buy instant ramen noodles this brand at 7-eleven.I tried it 92% same in the restaurant.😎🤪","Got my ticket at 9:00. 11-13 was fully booked. I went for 14:00-15. Came back around 13:50 and waited 15 minutes to be seated. Suited my plans for the day.
I definitely over-ate, but as everything was quite cheap I ordered the tantanmen ramen with coriander, the shrimp and meat dumplings and the slow cooked meat with rice and a mustard based sauce. The latter being my favorite.","Michelin failed me, again! This shoyu ramen (Michelin ever gave it one star, not sure is it dropped to Bib) gave me 1 out of 5 satisfaction. Now I dont rate food as nice or not cos everyone got own taste bud n like n dislike, I do my own …","HONEST REVIEW AND EXPERIENCE: This place was extremely underwhelming from the beginning. To start you grab your ticket for the next available reservation time which for us was 14:30. The ticket tells you to arrive 5 mins early, which we …","It works like this: you need to go there in the morning, possibly between 8am and 9am, to get a number from a machine outside the shop. Then you show up again at the time written on the paper. …","It is really a high quality cuisine. The atmosphere is cozy due to the control of people inside. The noodles are very tasty and personally the most impressive one is the tender chicken.","The restaurant opens at 11 AM. The first time we tried going there they closed that Sunday. So we ended up trying again a week later on our last leg in Japan. …","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "Nakiryu Ramen is a must-try spot with delicious food and efficient reservation system. I had tantanmen and shoyu ramen, and both were tasty. The tantanmen was not too spicy, and the shoyu ramen was phenomenal. I also enjoyed the gyoza, tonkatsu, and shrimp dumplings. The presentation, ambiance, and flavors were close to perfection. Don't miss the slow-cooked chicken with sauce, which is a standout side dish."

Name: Chūka Soba Ginza Hachigo
Address: Japan, 〒104-0061 Tokyo, Chuo City, Ginza, 3 Chome−14−2 第一はなぶさビル 1階
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 915 reviews","4 stars, 437 reviews","3 stars, 147 reviews","2 stars, 27 reviews","1 stars, 63 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, 11 am\u20134 pm","Monday, Closed","Tuesday, 11 am\u20133:30 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20133:30 pm","Thursday, 11 am\u20133:30 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133:30 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20134 pm"]
Reviews:
["If you can’t snatch a reservation here you have to be prepared to line up as early as 7 or 8 am to get into their daily seating availability! We lined up around 8:30am on a random weekday and got into second seating around 11:30am. The first group in line said they got here around 7am. Around 9am a staff member comes out and gets your group count and then about 30 minutes later they will return to ask you to make your order. It’s strongly encouraged that the entire group is present for the counting or you may not be counted with your full group. In our experience, one person can stay in line and do the ordering while others go off and come back as needed.

The ramen noodles and broth were both amazing and up there as one of the best I’ve had. But what really left an impression was their truffle ravioli specialty. Unfortunately they seem to limit one ravioli per pair in the group to ensure there are enough for the reservations later in the day. Oh the eel rice bowl was also surprisingly good.

Overall I enjoyed the experience but wouldn’t wait in line again. I’ve had similar quality of ramen elsewhere with less of a wait and it’s really only the ravioli that blew me away.","The atmosphere of the restaurant is like a Japanese fancy restaurant, very clean and beautiful. The customer service is courteous. I felt that all the ramen dishes were carefully made. At the same time, I felt that everything was not good enough. Overall, I felt that everything was not good enough. Is this salt ramen? I don't like salt ramen to begin with, and there are very few places where I have found salt ramen to be good. I think it was not to my taste. It is a good restaurant and there were so many people waiting, but I would not revisit.","Absolutely worth it. The attention to detail, the carefully crafted meal, elaborate plating and delicate flavours are what makes you go… ah so this is Michelin Star… I can go on and on but details of my review can food on my site.

Recommend to make reservations online before visiting. The week’s schedule is released every Saturday. Standby your laptop and the page cuz it gets booked out very fast.

The shop don’t accept cash so bring your card.","Very unique & delicious ramen
The noodles were slightly chewy, the broth was very flavourful (a bit too salty but still so good), and the truffle & foie gras ravioli was so unique!!

It was also nice to see the chefs cook in front of us, and the serving & presentation was great.

Reservation is a MUST. They have very few seats and get booked out very quickly (bookings open every Saturday at 9am local time)","This is a Michelin-rated place any foodie should experience. Getting into this  restaurant is through online reservations only, unless you are lucky enough there is a free seat at any given time because people usually line up for their appointed time here.  The soba is perfect, a piece of art.  If you want to have a very good gastronomic experience, get reservations at this soba place. 👍👍👍","This place has perfectly made bowls of noodles. I can't emphasize how well they craft each bowl. It's no wonder this spot is Michelin recommended! Getting a reservation is super difficult but if you can't, get here really early before opening to get a walk-in spot.","We tried to make a booking online but didn't have any luck. We arrived at 8.45am Friday 3 May and were lucky enough to be one of the 30 people who could dine in. Shortly after our arrival, another 5 people behind us and they were the last …","Super enjoyed the lightness of the ramen broth.  The chasyu was so good, but the star of the dish was the dumpling. Best to get a reservation, if you can't, you can line up before opening hours.","Watching the chefs cook and prepare the ramen together was a pleasure. They are perfectly in-sync with no words needed. …","It is an experience to see how skillfully the chefs prepare the food with so much dedication! …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥1,000–2,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 5","Food: 4","Food: 3","Dinner","Lunch"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This restaurant is very popular and can be hard to get into without a reservation. When you do get in, the ramen noodles and broth are amazing, and their truffle ravioli specialty is a standout. The eel rice bowl is also good. The atmosphere is fancy and Japanese-style, and the customer service is courteous. The chefs cook in front of you and the serving is great. The restaurant is Michelin-rated, so it's definitely worth trying."

Name: Iruca Tokyo Roppongi
Address: 4 Chome-12-12 Roppongi, Minato City, Tokyo 106-0032, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 548 reviews","4 stars, 220 reviews","3 stars, 78 reviews","2 stars, 29 reviews","1 stars, 99 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, 11 am\u20138:50 pm","Monday, Closed","Tuesday, 11 am\u20138:50 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20138:50 pm","Thursday, 11 am\u20138:50 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20138:50 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20138:50 pm"]
Reviews:
["Arrived the restaurant at almost 5 pm and waited around an hour until seated. The Michelin dish is Special porcini shio (salt) ramen (¥2000) so I ordered this one. The ramen came with duck, chicken, pork, wonton, and soft boiled egg with little spoon of truffle. The chicken and pork are very tender and duck is very flavorful. There is grated yuzu peel on top. The most impressive thing for me is the broth. After having tried so many ramen store in Tokyo, it is probably the best broth for me so far. There is the scent of salt left in the mouth but it is not salty. However, after mixing truffle into the broth, it doesn’t make that difference. So next time I would go for normal shio ramen or normal yuzu ramen. The price is affordable in terms of Michelin guide dish and as compared to the quality and satisfaction received.

Waiting 1 hour is acceptable especially during this kind of weather. The store prohibits seating for long time due to the long line, therefore the waiting time is quite predictable. 11-12 persons is the max capacity of this store. There is english menu available as well as guideline to order and the order is made by vending machine. Make sure you have enough cash!","⭐️ 入鹿 Tokyo⭐️ Score: 73
Appearance: 🔶🔶🔶🔶
Broth: 🔶🔶🔶🔸
Noodle texture: 🔶🔶🔶🔸
Ingredients: 🔶🔶🔶🔶🔸
Layering: 🔶🔶🔶🔸
Food review: I waited for about two hours, and it was raining, so it was really unlucky. Anyway, we were the first ones to enter the restaurant and ordered their most signature special soy sauce ramen. The first sip of the broth was incredibly soothing (after waiting in the cold rain for two hours, it was really comforting to drink). The presentation of the whole bowl was rich, and the various types of meat were outstanding. Adding the truffle sauce when the noodles were about 70-80% finished really elevated the flavor profile and made me want to continue eating. The egg was also delicious and flavorful. The only complaint I have is that the two meatballs felt unnecessary and didn't taste good in my opinion.","I had the yuzu-flavored ramen. The broth is light but full of flavor! The ramen has just the right amount of softness. If you like light broths, this is worth a try. We had to line up, but the waiting time was reasonable, approximately 20 to 30 minutes. I enjoyed both the food and the environment! The staff are friendly and speak English, so as tourists, we had no issues with communication.","Waited for exactly 60 mins on a Friday. Got in line at 7pm and got seated at 8:04pm. So worth it. This is probably the best ramen in my whole freaking life. The presentation is amazing. The broth is incredibly soothing. Unforgettable!!!!!!","Coming here I had low expectations for this ramen restaurant, but somehow it's not the best ramen I've had, but it's also not the worst ramen I've had. So pretty average, the soup i had was the shoyu (soy) maybe it is because I prefer …","One of the best ramen I had in Tokyo. There are multiple layer of flavours which make it unique.

Though the queue can be quite long especially during lunch/dinner hour and they have limited seats available.","If you don’t want to wait in line for hours, my tip is go around 10:30 am (30 mins before the open time). The ramen was yummy and the rice too. I also got the limited egg sandwich, which was delicious too.","Definitely worth a visit if you want to try a unique ramen experience, but expect a line. Came here around 2PM on a Saturday and there was still about a 45 minute wait. …","Delicious and unique ramen that is worth the travel for.

I have never tasted such a unique ramen before, with so much flavour! My partner …","4 star for the food, minus 1 for the hype and queue.

The ramen they serve is quite different from traditional ramen, which is …","Recommended dishes","Pork Ramen, Ramen","Rice Bowl, Ramen","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 4","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 4","Food: 5","Dinner","Ramen"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "The reviewers were mostly impressed with their meals at this restaurant. They liked the broths, which were flavorful and not too salty. Some dishes mentioned include the Special porcini shio ramen, shoyu ramen and normal yuzu ramen. The chicken and pork were tender, and the duck was flavorful. The egg was also delicious and the presentation was rich. The rice was yummy and the limited egg sandwich was delicious too. The reviewers thought the prices were affordable considering the quality and satisfaction. However, some of them had to wait in line for a long time, which was understandable. Overall, it is a unique ramen experience worth trying."

Name: Ramenya Shima
Address: 3 Chome-41-11 Honmachi, Shibuya City, Tokyo 151-0071, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 325 reviews","4 stars, 135 reviews","3 stars, 59 reviews","2 stars, 18 reviews","1 stars, 22 reviews"]
Reviews:
["We were the only westerners on the list that day, and we felt bad about that; but we were on a honeymoon trip and this was on my short list of things I had to try.

We tried our best to come as prepared as possible but still had some mishaps so here is what to know if you’re not fluent.

60 bowls / day, ingredients run out as day goes on and you aren’t guaranteed to get a certain bowl. The specialty bowls of course run out first.

A list goes out at 830am or so, maybe earlier now, and you sign up in the next available opening (no picking a time). I posted a photo of what to do, which includes saying do not write more than one name. This confused us as other people were writing (1) or (2) beside their name so at first we thought only write one name and how many with your group.
That is not correct.
Each person needs to write their name on each line, he is just saying that you can only write your own name - and each person needs to be there if you want a seating. No cheating and writing names for anyone else 🙏🏽.

We were 46/47 for 12:45. You come at your time and line up on the side walk, nearest the street. We were the first ones there to wait and didn’t know where to stand. Others walked in and got yelled at, do not walk in the store ever until you’re invited in. Seriously though, especially if you’re not Japanese. It’s only for people eating and it’s tiny.
Once you’re invited in you will pay at the vending machine as usual and give him your order ticket. I shared a photo of the offerings current as of February. Just keep in mind to be prepared to eat faster than you’re used to, people are waiting and you have a time slot. This one was easy for us as we’ve been working hard to speed up our eating time, as we are still a few minutes slower than locals; at other places without the nice dedicated time slot it’s more of a burden to others waiting to eat.

Food:
Best ramen of my life, and I’m a tonkotsu lover. My wife agrees and in the video you can see her quietly whispering me “it’s soo good”. We are not ramen food critics by any means but we have had hundreds of bowls of ramen all over the world, as well as about 10 Michelin star recognized places now and this is hands down my favorite.
The variety of chashu, the thought that goes into the arrangement, the varied texture, fattiness and complexity is incredible. Some melts, some melds with each bite.
Wontons - possibly perfection as far as ramen wontons go
For me, the ingredients are just incredible.

The soup / base - Up there with the best I’ve had, possibly my favorite. I thought it got better and better as it slightly cool

The noodles - we went with the hand rolled and thought they were quite good. Not my ideal noodle style or thickness but an 8/10 still.

Pork rice bowl was super good and left us overstuffed but while we had the opportunity, I had to get it.

Loved getting to watch his workflow putting the bowls together, raise and drain the noodles.

While a high hurdle to get a seat, and a bit stressful as a foreigner - it was such a pleasure to get to enjoy this.","MAR 2024

There are 60 slots per day and I arrived 30 minutes before the reservation time which starts at 8:30AM. I managed to get a seat for 11:45AM. Ordering is via cash only from the ticket machine and there is self serve water. I had the special soy sauce ramen which had a few different cuts of pork slices, a half boiled egg and wonton dumplings. The soup has a deep and flavorsome soy sauce taste without being too salty, noodle was slightly on the softer side, both the lean and fatty cuts of pork were tender. Wonton and egg were tasty as well. The grilled pork with spring onion and egg yolk mini rice bowl was pretty good when you add in some of the ramen soup. Overall a solid and delicious bowl of ramen worth trying once if you can plan ahead your schedule because most likely it will be a few hours wait after you have reserved your seat on the day.","Ramen 🍜:
I tried their Shiyo Ramen.
No words can describe the umami that the bowl exhumes. It was amazing!

Queue:
Came at Friday 7:45am.
There was about 32 people on the queue.
We got the 11:45am slot.
Most of them were locals.

Haiku:
Tender char Siew melts,
Savoring each savory bite,
Shiyo Ramen bliss.

I would definetly come again 💯","I do not say this lightly- best bowl of ramen and one of the best meals I have had in my life. Such thoughtful preparation. There is emotion going into the broth. It is above other shoyu. Even the wonton which may usually be discounted in ramen, permeated the soup with its own intricate herb.  If you are able, make a reservation.","Got in line at 9am sharp on a Tuesday. An employee came out just a few minutes later with the signup list. I ended up with the 21st spot, one of six seatings in the 11:05 time slot. Since I was staying in Shinjuku, it was easy enough to go …","Solid shoyu chicken(mostly chicken?) based broth. Unique chashu that tastes halfway between Japanese and Cantonese chashu. I gave 3 star for service not because the service was bad, but the complaint is about the reservation system’s …","Definitely deserving of its rep. Best shoyu ramen I’ve had, it packs such a punch and the toppings are plenty and perfection. Worth every bit the struggle to get a spot on the list and I had to try several days to get up early enough…","I got here just before 7am and was lucky to be the 6th person in line, so I got in the first round of seating. The queue grew steadily—and quickly. At 9am a staff member came out to start the sign-up process and 2/3 of the sheet was …","Went just after the full switch to Omakase reservations. Thankful because I would have been disappointed if I had to wait a few hours for this bowl. …","This is it. The best ramen we had in Tokyo. I am still thinking about this ramen even long after I have left Japan. …","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","¥2,000–3,000","¥1,000–2,000","Service: 5","Meal type","Food: 5","Service","Dine in"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "Here's a summary of the reviews in simple English. We didn't expect to love this place so much, but it was the best ramen we've ever had. The variety of chashu, arrangement, and texture was amazing. The soup was incredible, and the noodles were good. We also tried the pork rice bowl, which was super good. The service was a bit stressful because of the reservation system, but it was worth the struggle to get a seat."

Name: Mugi to Olive
Address: 6 Chome-12-12 Ginza, Chuo City, Tokyo 104-0061, Japan
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 946 reviews","4 stars, 895 reviews","3 stars, 413 reviews","2 stars, 78 reviews","1 stars, 80 reviews"]
Reviews:
["It’s usual situation to queue up to wait for the seat in Japan !
We wait for 45 mins then the waitress comes out to bring us in to ring up the order and settled the bill first, then we have to wait agin at the entrance.
The restaurant got 18 seats , it’s quite big in Japan actually, wait another 10 mins , we got our seat inside the corner, clean and tidy but not narrow. Comfortable
We treat this as our dinner and quite hungry after a long wait, so we choose the big portion for the noodle, it’s really huge and we can’t finish ( felt sorry for that)
The presentation looks very tempting , a big Clam on the top , and noodle is tender and  really tasty, the soup is so so yummy 👍must try and worth for waited it","Went to this due to the long lines so I thought it must be awesome

Turns our, I just don't like clams probably. I ordered the triple flavor and it was too fishy for me.

The best part was taking out the noodles onto a spare plate and dousing it with olive oil and pepper. That was delicious.

Other that, I'm not really a fan of clam flavor so I guess it's just not for me.

I do at least recommend sprinkling pepper into the broth. That made it more palatable for me. Also, while egg is my favorite topping, it did not go well in this dish IMO. I recommend not buying the egg","Light ramen in Ginza. Good taste of soup and well cooked noodle are really refreshing. Not like oily regular ramen. You will love it. I had ramen with clam, pork and chicken. Easy to order from automatic machine and pay by your credit card or QR payment. English operation on the screen. Always have people cue up in front of the store. Try it and you will like.","Welcoming and friendly staff. Order at the machine, hand the receipt over to the waitress, take a seat at the bar and the bowl will be ready in about 3-5 min. The noodles were perfect. Never had clam ramen until now and it’s probably my favorite! Definitely recommend this place for anyone who wants to try something a little different.","Never needed to write a review before, maybe it’s just not our taste, but it’s really, really bad. It’s definitely not worth the hype and even without the queue (we went in and the restaurant was almost empty) it’s definitely not worth it. …","Stayed at Tokyo for 10 days and ate at Mugi 3 times. We tried a couple of famous Ramen restaurants and always wanted to come back to Mugi. Friendly staff, efficient service and the food itself was unforgettable. They are usually closed on …","This ramen place has decent soba ramen. Ordering via the kiosk is convenient, though the Google name doesn't match the store's sign, which is a bit confusing. Overall, not bad for a quick meal. …","Excellent ramen. Get ready to wait in a queue on the sidewalk. Just FYI, the soup has a fish taste because of the clams. I liked it a lot. As usual, you make the order and pay in the machine.","Had the clam Ramen with the three different toppings. Absolutely delectable!

The broth had quite a sweetness to it, but it doesn't disrupt the meal …","This shop serves clam ramen, fairly popular. There is regular and large size with extra side toppings that can be ordered.","Difficult to find parking","Parking is unavailable","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Parking options","Atmosphere: 5","Parking space","¥1,000–2,000","¥2,000–3,000","Triple Soba","Service: 5","Meal type","Service","Dine in","Food: 2","Food: 5","Dinner"," More"]
AiReviewSummary: "This ramen restaurant in Ginza, Japan has a unique experience with a wait time before being seated. The big portion noodle dish is popular, with a huge serving and tender noodles. The presentation is impressive with a big clam on top. Some people like it, but one reviewer didn't like the clam flavor and thought it was too fishy. Others enjoyed the dish with olive oil and pepper, and recommended it with a light seasoning. The service is friendly, and ordering is convenient through the automatic machine. The triple flavor ramen was too fishy for one reviewer, but another enjoyed the clam ramen with three toppings."

Name: Tsuta
Address: Japan, 〒151-0066 Tokyo, Shibuya City, Nishihara, 3 Chome−2−4 フロンティア代々木上原 B1
CountPerRating: ["5 stars, 1,164 reviews","4 stars, 542 reviews","3 stars, 291 reviews","2 stars, 89 reviews","1 stars, 117 reviews"]
OpeningHours: ["Sunday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Monday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Tuesday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Wednesday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Thursday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Friday, 11 am\u20133 pm","Saturday, 11 am\u20133 pm"]
Reviews:
["This is not your traditional ramen shop. It’s ramen but done sophisticated- think ramen but fine dining. When I visited there were mainly tourists and the odd salaryman. Booked online an hour prior to visiting the restaurant. Ordering was a breeze with English translated vending machines. Then you are led down the stairs to this restaurant with a lovely ambiance, attentive staff and a personalised welcome card. It was all very lovely and you felt special. The ramen was complex, a lot of elements and a little pamphlet that explains each ingredient and even a recommended sequence on how to eat it. Presentation was stunning, but I felt it was a bit overwhelming. Flavours were perfect, well balanced. Overall more expensive than your typical ramen but it’s a nice experience. I booked with table check.","A modernized classy ramen restaurant. They put a lot of attention to the plating and presentation of their dishes.

The classic ramen to order is their 醤油 (shoyu) ramen. I tried a taste of the broth and it was pretty nice. It had lots a flavor, depth and wasn’t too delicate or refined.

I order the 和牛坦々麺 (wagyu tantanmen). The creamy cashew sauce was very nice. It wasn’t too spicy and the flavor was nice.

All things considered this is a decent ramen shop. I’m not sure I would want to wait a long time or spend this much money for their ramen again though 🤷🏽‍♂️

It seemed to attract a lot of tourists.","It was a famous ramen shop, but it was average and pricy. With half of the price, you could get more quality ramen in Japan. I loved the presentation, and it was more like an upscale restaurant than a ramen shop. There is a nice open kitchen where you can see a few chefs cooking in front of you. I recommend sitting at the counter if you want to know the vibe. Ramen was ok. I'll probably not come back.","It’s might not be the ideal place for ppl who are after classic taste of Raman. But for a chef this place is perfect with the flavours and presentation.
I like how they add French flavours and techniques into the Japan Raman.
I really enjoyed everything I had on the day!","Atmosphere and service are great but the ramen is definitely not the best ramen I’ve had for this price range. Tried both variations and the egg rice I think was around 5-6k yen. Seems to be more for tourists than local Japanese. Not a place I would desire to return to.","My husband had the shoyu and I had the shio ramen. The food was to standard of what I expected from a Michelin starred restaurant. We both agreed that the shio was tastier than the shoyu. The grilled tomato added more umami to the dish, as …","Actually, I think everything was nice. It’s delicious because there are wagyuu beef. It was cooked very perfectly for wagyuu. for ramen i think they were good as well. It was not too heavy and very light. Easy to eat. Wagyuu beef was very …","Broth and the noodles were fantastic! Raw wagyu with rice and egg was also great. Glad to have tried this Michelin star restaurant. It’s great that you can book ahead and that the place is not as crowded as the other ramen places.","The soy sauce ramen tastes very bland and not thick enough. There was almost no service. There was no one in front of us, but they made us wait for fifteen minutes just because we didn't have a reservation.","This bowl of ramen seems to evolve with every bite. The soup is made with a lot of patience and love. You can feel the commitment to the craft. Make a reservation. Totally worth the trek.","Soba Noodles, Ramen","Recommended dishes","Price per person","Atmosphere: 5","Atmosphere: 3","¥3,000–4,000","¥2,000–3,000","Service: 5","Service: 4","Service: 3","Service: 1","Meal type","Food: 5","Service","Dine in","Food: 3"," More","Lunch"]
AiReviewSummary: "This modernized ramen shop offers a sophisticated take on traditional ramen. The atmosphere is lovely with attentive staff and a personalized welcome card. The ramen is complex with many elements, and presentation is stunning. The flavours are well-balanced, but the dish can be overwhelming. You can order the classic shoyu ramen or try the wagyu tantanmen with creamy cashew sauce. While the ramen is okay, it's not the best for the price range."
